original: @353b # // dpal bde mchog gi rgya cher bshad pa tshig don rab tu gsal ba zhes bya ba /
analyzed: @353b # // dpal bde mchog gi rgya cher bshad pa tshig don rab tu gsal ba zhes bya ba /
translated: The Glorious Cakrasa·πÉvara Commentary, Called ‚ÄúThe Clear Words‚Äù

original: dpal bde mchog mkha' 'gro la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dpal bde mchog mkha' 'gro la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the glorious Cakrasa·πÉvara.

original: kun 'gro kun snying nam mkha'i dbus gyur mchog zhi ba //
analyzed: kun 'gro kun snying nam mkha'i dbus gyur mchog zhi ba //
translated: The all-pervading, all-encompassing, central space, the supreme peace,

analyzed: he ru ka dpal mchog tu mya ngan 'das pa de nyid dngos //

analyzed: thabs dang shes rab las byung rab gsal nye bar 'bar ba'i 'od //

analyzed: nyi gzhon phun tshogs bde mchog zhabs btud de nyid bshad par bya // 'grel pa dag gis rgyud rgyal ni //
translated: is the youthful sun. I bow to the feet of the glorious Cakrasa·πÉvara and will explain that reality.üîΩThe king of tantras has not been fully elucidated

original: ma lus rnam par ma bkrol zhes //üîΩrtsa ba'i rgyud las bdag gis ni //
analyzed: ma lus rnam par ma bkrol zhes // rtsa ba'i rgyud las bdag gis ni //
translated: by the commentaries.üîΩI have heard it as a story

original: gtam du dris pa bzhin du thos //
analyzed: gtam du dris pa bzhin du thos //
translated: from the root tantra, as if it were a question-and-answer.

original: bdag ni shin tu blo dman yang //
analyzed: bdag ni shin tu blo dman yang //
translated: Although I am of very little intelligence,

original: bla mas byin gyis brlabs pa dang // bshad rgyud yang dag rtogs pa yis //
analyzed: bla mas byin gyis brlabs pa dang // bshad rgyud yang dag rtogs pa yis //
translated: I have been blessed by the guru and have correctly understood the explanatory tantras.

original: de don rtsom phyir nyes pa med //
analyzed: de don rtsom phyir nyes pa med //
translated: Therefore, I am without fault in composing this.

original: rgyud kyi brjod par bya ba ni gang /
analyzed: rgyud kyi brjod par bya ba ni gang /
translated: What is the subject matter of the tantra?

original: dgos pa'i dgos pa ni gang zhig / de nas zhes bya ba nas bka' stsal to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis rjod par byed pa'i rgyud yin la /
analyzed: dgos pa'i dgos pa ni gang zhig / de nas zhes bya ba nas bka' stsal to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis rjod par byed pa'i rgyud yin la /
translated: The ultimate purpose is expressed by the passage beginning with ‚ÄúThen‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúhe spoke.‚Äù

original: de nas brjod par bya ba ni rgyu'i rgyud dang thabs kyi rgyud dang / 'bras bu'i rgyud do //
analyzed: de nas brjod par bya ba ni rgyu'i rgyud dang thabs kyi rgyud dang / 'bras bu'i rgyud do //
translated: Then, that which is to be expressed is the causal continuum, the method continuum, and the resultant continuum.

original: de la rgyu'i rgyud ni le'u nyi shu rtsa drug pa las ston pa'i gang zag rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de la rgyu'i rgyud ni le'u nyi shu rtsa drug pa las ston pa'i gang zag rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Therein, the causal continuum is the three kinds of persons taught in the twenty-sixth chapter.

original: thabs kyi rgyud ni bskyed rdzogs gnyis so //
analyzed: thabs kyi rgyud ni bskyed rdzogs gnyis so //
translated: The method continuum is the two, creation and completion.

original: 'bras bu'i rgyud ni sku gsum mo //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyud ni sku gsum mo //
translated: The resultant continuum is the three bodies.

original: de la gtso bor thabs kyi rgyud gsungs pa nas de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la gtso bor thabs kyi rgyud gsungs pa nas de brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therein, the method continuum is primary, and that is to be expressed.

original: de la le'u dang po'i tshigs bcad gcig gis rgyud kyi dgos pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la le'u dang po'i tshigs bcad gcig gis rgyud kyi dgos pa bstan to //
translated: Therein, one verse of the first chapter teaches the purpose of the tantra.

original: tshig bcad phyed kyis mtshan bstan to //
analyzed: tshig bcad phyed kyis mtshan bstan to //
translated: Half a verse teaches the title.

original: tshigs bcad phyed dang gnyis kyis ni rgyud kyi gleng gzhi bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs bcad phyed dang gnyis kyis ni rgyud kyi gleng gzhi bstan to //
translated: One and a half verses teach the introduction to the tantra.

original: tshigs bcad gnyis kyis ni lus rnam gzhag bstan /
analyzed: tshigs bcad gnyis kyis ni lus rnam gzhag bstan /
translated: Two verses teach the presentation of the body.

original: le'u dang po'i lhag mas ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo dang zhi ba'i btung ba dang pho nya'i gtsang sbra gnas dang bcas pa mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: le'u dang po'i lhag mas ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo dang zhi ba'i btung ba dang pho nya'i gtsang sbra gnas dang bcas pa mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The remainder of the first chapter briefly teaches the ga·πáacakra, the drink of peace, and the purity of the messenger together with the place.

original: le'u gnyis pas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bstan to //
analyzed: le'u gnyis pas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bstan to //
translated: The second chapter teaches the ma·πá·∏çala wheel.

original: le'u gsum pas slob ma dbang bskur ba bstan to //
analyzed: le'u gsum pas slob ma dbang bskur ba bstan to //
translated: The third chapter teaches the consecration of the disciple.

original: le'u bzhi pas lha dgod pa bstan to //
analyzed: le'u bzhi pas lha dgod pa bstan to //
translated: The fourth chapter teaches the placement of the deities.

original: de ltar le'u gsum pa dang bzhi pas bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgom pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar le'u gsum pa dang bzhi pas bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgom pa gsungs so //

original: le'u lnga pas rkang pa brgyad pa'i gsal byed btu ba bstan to //
analyzed: le'u lnga pas rkang pa brgyad pa'i gsal byed btu ba bstan to //

original: le'u drug pas dpa' bo drug gi sngags btu ba bstan to //
analyzed: le'u drug pas dpa' bo drug gi sngags btu ba bstan to //
translated: The sixth chapter teaches the extraction of the mantras of the six heroes.

original: le'u bdun pas rkang pa brgyad pa'i dbyangs yig btu ba bstan //
analyzed: le'u bdun pas rkang pa brgyad pa'i dbyangs yig btu ba bstan //
translated: The seventh chapter teaches the extraction of the vowels of the eight lines.

original: le'u brgyad pas snying po bzhi dang go cha'i lha mo drug gi sngags btu ba bstan /
analyzed: le'u brgyad pas snying po bzhi dang go cha'i lha mo drug gi sngags btu ba bstan /
translated: The eighth chapter teaches the extraction of the mantras of the four essences and the six armor goddesses.
The ninth chapter

original: dgu pas rtsa ba'i sngags kyi phrin las lnga bcu bstan //
analyzed: dgu pas rtsa ba'i sngags kyi phrin las lnga bcu bstan //
translated: teaches the fifty activities of the root mantra.

original: le'u bcu pas snying po sngags kyi mchog dang 'jig rten pa'i sngags grub pa bstan //
analyzed: le'u bcu pas snying po sngags kyi mchog dang 'jig rten pa'i sngags grub pa bstan //
translated: Chapter X teaches the supreme essence mantra and the accomplishment of worldly mantras.

original: le'u bcu gcig pas dngos grub kyi bzas kyi kha zas skye ba bdun pa bstan //
analyzed: le'u bcu gcig pas dngos grub kyi bzas kyi kha zas skye ba bdun pa bstan //
translated: Chapter XI teaches the food of the siddhi, the seven-birth [being].

original: le'u bcu gnyis pa nye ba'i snying po'i phrin las bstan //
analyzed: le'u bcu gnyis pa nye ba'i snying po'i phrin las bstan //
translated: Chapter XII teaches the activity of the proximate essence.

original: le'u bcu gsum pas go cha'i sngags kyi phrin las bstan //
analyzed: le'u bcu gsum pas go cha'i sngags kyi phrin las bstan //
translated: Chapter XIII teaches the activity of the armor mantra.

original: de ltar le'u lnga pa nas bcu gsum pa'i bar gyis bskyed pa'i rim pa'i bzlas pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar le'u lnga pa nas bcu gsum pa'i bar gyis bskyed pa'i rim pa'i bzlas pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, from chapter V up to chapter XIII, the recitation of the creation stage is taught.

original: le'u bzhi pas dngos grub kyi dkyil 'khor tshogs kyi 'khor lo bstan //
analyzed: le'u bzhi pas dngos grub kyi dkyil 'khor tshogs kyi 'khor lo bstan //
translated: Chapter IV teaches the ga·πáacakra of the siddhi ma·πá·∏çala.

original: le'u bco lnga pa nas nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bar gyis tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i yan lag bstan to //
analyzed: le'u bco lnga pa nas nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bar gyis tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i yan lag bstan to //
translated: From chapter XV up to chapter XXV, the limbs of the ga·πáacakra are taught.

original: le'u bco lnga pas dag byed kyi lha mo'i yi ge'i brda bstan /
analyzed: le'u bco lnga pas dag byed kyi lha mo'i yi ge'i brda bstan /

original: bcu drug pas dag byed kyi lha mo'i brda'i mtshan nyid bstan /
analyzed: bcu drug pas dag byed kyi lha mo'i brda'i mtshan nyid bstan /

original: bcu bdun pas dbang gi lha mo'i mtshan nyid bstan /
analyzed: bcu bdun pas dbang gi lha mo'i mtshan nyid bstan /

original: bco brgyad pas dpa' bo'i lha mo'i mtshan nyid bstan /
analyzed: bco brgyad pas dpa' bo'i lha mo'i mtshan nyid bstan /

original: bcu dgu pas bka' bsgo ba'i mtshan nyid bstan /
analyzed: bcu dgu pas bka' bsgo ba'i mtshan nyid bstan /

original: nyi shu pas dbang gi lha mo'i brda bstan /
analyzed: nyi shu pas dbang gi lha mo'i brda bstan /
translated: The twentieth chapter teaches the signs of the empowerment heroines.

original: nyi shu rtsa gcig pas dpa' bo'i lha mo'i mtshan nyid dang / rtsa gnyis pa las bkas gnang ba'i lha mo'i brda dang / rtsa gsum pa las kun spyod ma'i mtshan nyid dang / rtsa bzhi pa las de'i brda dang / rtsa lnga pa las lha mo lnga'i lus la dpa' bo dang dpa' mo dgod pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gcig pas dpa' bo'i lha mo'i mtshan nyid dang / rtsa gnyis pa las bkas gnang ba'i lha mo'i brda dang / rtsa gsum pa las kun spyod ma'i mtshan nyid dang / rtsa bzhi pa las de'i brda dang / rtsa lnga pa las lha mo lnga'i lus la dpa' bo dang dpa' mo dgod pa'i sngags so //
translated: The twenty-first chapter teaches the characteristics of the heroines, the twenty-second chapter teaches the signs of the permitted heroines, the twenty-third chapter teaches the characteristics of the conduct heroines, the twenty-fourth chapter teaches their signs, and the twenty-fifth chapter teaches the mantras for placing heroes and heroines in the bodies of the five heroines.

original: le'u nyi shu rtsa drug pa nas rtsa dgu'i bar gyis le'u dang po'i rdzogs rim rgyas par bshad pa las /
analyzed: le'u nyi shu rtsa drug pa nas rtsa dgu'i bar gyis le'u dang po'i rdzogs rim rgyas par bshad pa las /
translated: Chapters twenty-six through forty-nine extensively explain the completion phase of the first chapter.

original: rtsa drug pas rgyu dang thabs dang 'bras bu gsum bstan /
analyzed: rtsa drug pas rgyu dang thabs dang 'bras bu gsum bstan /
translated: The twenty-sixth chapter teaches the three topics of cause, method, and result.

original: rtsa bdun pas sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang rjes gsum bstan /
analyzed: rtsa bdun pas sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang rjes gsum bstan /

original: rtsa brgyad pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i gzhan don bstan //
analyzed: rtsa brgyad pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i gzhan don bstan //
translated: The twenty-eighth chapter teaches the benefit for others of the completion phase.

original: rtsa dgu pas dbang bzhi pa bstan //
analyzed: rtsa dgu pas dbang bzhi pa bstan //
translated: Chapter forty-nine teaches the fourth initiation.

original: le'u sum cu pas bskyed pa'i rim pa srung ba'i 'khor lo bstan to //
analyzed: le'u sum cu pas bskyed pa'i rim pa srung ba'i 'khor lo bstan to //
translated: Chapter thirty teaches the creation stage of the protection wheel.

original: sum cu rtsa gcig nas bzhi bcu pa'i bar gyis dngos grub len pa'i rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i 'khor lo bstan //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gcig nas bzhi bcu pa'i bar gyis dngos grub len pa'i rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i 'khor lo bstan //
translated: From chapter thirty-one to forty teaches the animate and inanimate wheels, the cause for taking up spiritual powers.

original: bzhi bcu rtsa gcig pa nas lnga bcu'i bar gyis dngos grub len pa'i gsang sngags kyi 'khor lo bstan to //
analyzed: bzhi bcu rtsa gcig pa nas lnga bcu'i bar gyis dngos grub len pa'i gsang sngags kyi 'khor lo bstan to //
translated: From chapter forty-one to fifty teaches the mantra wheel for taking up spiritual powers.

original: le'u gcig pas bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgom pa'i thabs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: le'u gcig pas bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgom pa'i thabs bstan pa'o //
translated: Chapter one teaches the method for meditating on the creation stage.

original: de ltar na le'u lnga ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa yin la //
analyzed: de ltar na le'u lnga ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa yin la //

original: le'u bcu gsum ni bskyed pa'i rim pa yin //
analyzed: le'u bcu gsum ni bskyed pa'i rim pa yin //

original: le'u bcu gnyis ni gnyis ka'i yan lag tshogs kyi 'khor lo yin la //
analyzed: le'u bcu gnyis ni gnyis ka'i yan lag tshogs kyi 'khor lo yin la //
translated: Twelve chapters are the branch of both, the ga·πáacakra.

original: mtshan ma thob nas dngos @354b grub len pa ni le'u nyi shu yin la //
analyzed: mtshan ma thob nas dngos @354b grub len pa ni le'u nyi shu yin la //
translated: Taking up spiritual powers after obtaining the signs is chapter twenty.

original: thabs kyi kha skong ba ni le'u nga gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs kyi kha skong ba ni le'u nga gcig pa yin no //

original: de ltar na thabs 'bras bu bcas pa ni brjod par bya ba yin la //
analyzed: de ltar na thabs 'bras bu bcas pa ni brjod par bya ba yin la //
translated: Thus, the means and the result are the subject matter.

original: thos bsam sgom gyis de khong du chud pa nyi dgos pa yin la //
analyzed: thos bsam sgom gyis de khong du chud pa nyi dgos pa yin la //
translated: The understanding of that by means of hearing, reflection, and meditation is the purpose.

original: tshan ma thob nas dngos grub gsum bskyed pa ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: tshan ma thob nas dngos grub gsum bskyed pa ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa yin no //
translated: The generation of the three powers after having obtained the initiation is the ultimate purpose.

original: 'brel ba ni de'i bdag nyid dang thabs dang thabs las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel ba ni de'i bdag nyid dang thabs dang thabs las byung ba'o //
translated: The connection is the identity, the means, and the arising from the means.

original: de'i bsdus pa'i don ni thabs dang bskyar ba'i cho ga dang dngos grub len pa'i kha bskang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bsdus pa'i don ni thabs dang bskyar ba'i cho ga dang dngos grub len pa'i kha bskang ba'o //
translated: The summarized meaning is the means, the rite of repetition, and the rite of taking the result.

original: bskyed rdzogs gnyis ni thabs yin la /
analyzed: bskyed rdzogs gnyis ni thabs yin la /

original: tshogs kyi 'khor lo ni bskyar ba'i cho ga yin la /
analyzed: tshogs kyi 'khor lo ni bskyar ba'i cho ga yin la /

original: rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i 'khor lo ni 'bras bu dngos grub len pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i 'khor lo ni 'bras bu dngos grub len pa yin la /

original: le'u nga gcig pa ni kha bskang ba'i man ngag go //
analyzed: le'u nga gcig pa ni kha bskang ba'i man ngag go //
translated: The thirty-first chapter is the instruction on the supplement.

original: da ni yan lag gi don brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni yan lag gi don brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the subsidiary topics will be explained.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud le'u 'bum pa dang / rgyud phyi ma shlo ka 'bum pa rdzogs pa'i rjes la le'u nga gcig pa ston par bzhed nas da nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //üîΩde yang dpa' bo dang dpa' mo brjod kyi mi lang ba bas phyag 'tshal nas bdud rtsi rnam pa lngas mchod de bstod nas gsol ba btab pa'i rjes thabs la //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud le'u 'bum pa dang / rgyud phyi ma shlo ka 'bum pa rdzogs pa'i rjes la le'u nga gcig pa ston par bzhed nas da nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no // de yang dpa' bo dang dpa' mo brjod kyi mi lang ba bas phyag 'tshal nas bdud rtsi rnam pa lngas mchod de bstod nas gsol ba btab pa'i rjes thabs la //
translated: After completing the root tantra in one hundred thousand chapters and the later tantra in one hundred thousand ≈õlokas, he declares the fifty-first chapter, beginning Now, and so on.

analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no // de yang thob mar rgyud kyi brjod bya ston par bzhed nas //
translated: Further, after bowing to the innumerable heroes and heroines, making offerings with the five elixirs, praising, and supplicating, he declares Then, and so on.

original: gsang ba bshad bya ba zhes gsungs te //
analyzed: gsang ba bshad bya ba zhes gsungs te //
translated: Further, wishing to teach the subject matter of the tantra, he declares the secret that is to be explained.

original: gsang ba'i don ni gnyis te //
analyzed: gsang ba'i don ni gnyis te //

analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //

analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i gsang ba ni gnyis te /

original: dpa' bo gcig pu bsgom pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo gcig pu bsgom pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa'o //

original: de ci'i phyir gsang ba yin zhe na //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir gsang ba yin zhe na //
translated: Why is that secret?

translated: The Vajra≈õekhara Tantra also says:

analyzed: gsang chen theg pa 'di ru ni //
translated: In this vehicle of the great secret,

original: zhugs pa gang dang gang yin pa //
analyzed: zhugs pa gang dang gang yin pa //
translated: whatever one enters

analyzed: rgyal ba'i gnas kyis thob 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: is attained by the abode of the victors.

analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni phyag rgya bzhi dang thabs bzhi dang ldan pas gsang ba'o //

original: ci'i phyir gsang pa yin zhe na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir gsang pa yin zhe na //
translated: Why is it secret?

original: tshangs pa dang khyab 'jug dang dbang phyug chen po dang nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba rnams kyis ma goms par bde ba stong pa nyid ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa dang khyab 'jug dang dbang phyug chen po dang nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba rnams kyis ma goms par bde ba stong pa nyid ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because BrahmƒÅ, Vi·π£·πáu, Mahe≈õvara, ≈õrƒÅvakas, and pratyekabuddhas do not realize the emptiness of bliss because they are not accustomed to it.

original: de yang 'di nyid las /

translated: does not approach one-sixteenthüîΩof the bliss of the gathered vajra holders.

analyzed: dang / kha sbyor las kyang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod yul yin pas na gsang ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is secret because it is the domain of all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: bshad bya zhes bya ba ni sgra'i dgos pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bshad bya zhes bya ba ni sgra'i dgos pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The expression to be explained indicates the purpose of the sound.

original: sngon dpa' bo dang dpa' mo rnams kyis khong du chud pa yin yang /
analyzed: sngon dpa' bo dang dpa' mo rnams kyis khong du chud pa yin yang /
translated: It is the domain of the heroes and heroines of the past,

original: da ltar rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rtogs pa'o //

original: de'i rjod par byed pa ji ltar yin zhe na //
analyzed: de'i rjod par byed pa ji ltar yin zhe na //

original: mdor bsdus pa ste rgyas par min //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa ste rgyas par min //

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te rgyud le'u 'bum pa las 'dir mdor bsdus pa dang / shlo ka 'bum pa las mdor bsdus pas na rgyas par min pa ste ltos sa gnyis nas phyi ma'i phyi ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te rgyud le'u 'bum pa las 'dir mdor bsdus pa dang / shlo ka 'bum pa las mdor bsdus pas na rgyas par min pa ste ltos sa gnyis nas phyi ma'i phyi ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is concise from the tantra in one hundred thousand chapters, and it is concise from the one hundred thousand ≈õlokas, so it is not extensive. The meaning is that it is the latter of the two that are dependent.

original: brjod par bya ba de nyid gsal bar bstan pa ni //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba de nyid gsal bar bstan pa ni //
translated: The expression of that very thing to be expressed is taught:

original: he ru ka dpal yang dag sbyor //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te //
analyzed: he ru ka dpal yang dag sbyor //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te //

original: mtshan nyid pa sku gsum gyi rang bzhin yin yang de'i rgyu ba bskyed rdzogs gnyis kyi thabs la dpal he ka zhes bya ba sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' brdar btags pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid pa sku gsum gyi rang bzhin yin yang de'i rgyu ba bskyed rdzogs gnyis kyi thabs la dpal he ka zhes bya ba sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' brdar btags pa yin no //

analyzed: dngos kyi yum sa bcu gnyis pa'i stong pa nyid shes rab yin la //
translated: The actual mother is the emptiness of the twelfth stage, which is wisdom.

original: de'i rgyud bskyed rdzogs gnyis kyi shes rab la btsun mo zhes brdar btags pa yin no //üîΩthabs ni du //
analyzed: de'i rgyud bskyed rdzogs gnyis kyi shes rab la btsun mo zhes brdar btags pa yin no // thabs ni du //

original: shes rab ni du zhes na //
analyzed: shes rab ni du zhes na //

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa dpa' bo gcig pu dang / dkyil 'khor 'khor lo rdzogs pa'i thabs dang shes rab dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i las kyi phyag rgya dang / chos kyi phyag rgya dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang / phyag rgya chen po'i thabs dang shes rab bo //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa dpa' bo gcig pu dang / dkyil 'khor 'khor lo rdzogs pa'i thabs dang shes rab dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i las kyi phyag rgya dang / chos kyi phyag rgya dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang / phyag rgya chen po'i thabs dang shes rab bo //
translated: The wisdom is the karma consort of the completion stage, the dharma consort, the samaya consort, and the method and wisdom of the great seal.

analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid phyis bshad par bya'o // yang dag sbyor zhes bya ba ni bya'o //
translated: Its definition will be explained later.üîΩ‚ÄúCorrect union‚Äù means union with the real.

original: yang dag sbyor zhes bya ba ni rna mnyam par sbyor ba'i don yin //
analyzed: yang dag sbyor zhes bya ba ni rna mnyam par sbyor ba'i don yin //

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin brgyad cu dang bral ba'i bde ba rtogs pa mngon sum skye ba dang / chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid phyag rgya chen po mngon sum du mthong bas yul ji lta ba bzhin gyi rnam par shes pa skyes pas mnyam par sbyor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin brgyad cu dang bral ba'i bde ba rtogs pa mngon sum skye ba dang / chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid phyag rgya chen po mngon sum du mthong bas yul ji lta ba bzhin gyi rnam par shes pa skyes pas mnyam par sbyor zhes bya'o //
translated: The direct realization of the bliss free from the eighty natural concepts, and the direct perception of the emptiness of the dharma-dhƒÅtu, the great seal, is called ‚Äúunion‚Äù because the consciousness of the object as it is arises.

original: sa bcu gcig pa'i ye shes kyi chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid dang mnyam par sbyor ba ni 'dir ma yin no //
analyzed: sa bcu gcig pa'i ye shes kyi chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid dang mnyam par sbyor ba ni 'dir ma yin no //
translated: The union of the wisdom of the eleventh stage with the emptiness of the dharma-dhƒÅtu is not meant here.

original: dgos pa gang zhe na //
analyzed: dgos pa gang zhe na //
translated: What is the purpose?

original: 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub byed pa //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub byed pa //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It accomplishes all desired aims.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi 'dod pa'i don ni 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub 'dod pa'i khams kyi yon tan dang / thun mong gi dngos grub bsam gtan @355b dang // gzugs med kyi ting nge 'dzin dang // mchog gi dngos grub sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi 'dod pa'i don ni 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub 'dod pa'i khams kyi yon tan dang / thun mong gi dngos grub bsam gtan @355b dang // gzugs med kyi ting nge 'dzin dang // mchog gi dngos grub sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes so //
translated: The desired aim of yogins is the mundane perfections, the qualities of the desire realm, the common perfections, the concentrations and the meditative stabilizations of the formless realm, and the supreme perfection, the gnosis of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gzhan don sku gnyis kyi mdzad pa ni 'dir rgyu'i skabs yin pas brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gzhan don sku gnyis kyi mdzad pa ni 'dir rgyu'i skabs yin pas brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: The deeds of the two Buddha bodies for the sake of others are not to be mentioned here, because this is the chapter on the cause.üîΩIf that aim is common to all unexcelled tantras, then which tantra was taught by the Sugata?üîΩThe Bodhisattvas thought this,

original: dgos pa de bla na med pa'i rgyud thams cad kyi thun mong yin na bde bar gshegs pas da ltar gyi rgyud gang zhig gsungs pa snyam du byang chub sems dpa' rnams rtog pa la //
analyzed: dgos pa de bla na med pa'i rgyud thams cad kyi thun mong yin na bde bar gshegs pas da ltar gyi rgyud gang zhig gsungs pa snyam du byang chub sems dpa' rnams rtog pa la //
translated: and the BhagavƒÅn said,

original: phyi ma las kyang phyi ma ste //
analyzed: phyi ma las kyang phyi ma ste //
translated: ‚ÄúThe one that is later than the later

original: mkha' 'gro ma yi dra ba sdom //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma yi dra ba sdom //
translated: is the binding of the dakini‚Äôs net.

original: zhes mtshan gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes mtshan gsungs pa yin no //

original: mtshan ni rdo rje'i tshig yin pas brjod bya rnam pa gsum du gyur pa yin te //
analyzed: mtshan ni rdo rje'i tshig yin pas brjod bya rnam pa gsum du gyur pa yin te //
translated: Since the title is a vajra statement, it has three topics.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa'i snying pos dbyings su rtogs pa dang / spyan ras gzigs kyis sngags su rtogs pa dang 'jam dpal gyis chos su rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa'i snying pos dbyings su rtogs pa dang / spyan ras gzigs kyis sngags su rtogs pa dang 'jam dpal gyis chos su rtogs pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva K·π£itigarbha realized it as the realm, Avalokite≈õvara realized it as mantra, and Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ realized it as dharma.

original: de la dbyibs ni rtsa ba'i 'khor lo byang chub kyi sems phab pas dga' ba bzhi sdom pa'o //
analyzed: de la dbyibs ni rtsa ba'i 'khor lo byang chub kyi sems phab pas dga' ba bzhi sdom pa'o //
translated: Among them, the realm is the binding of the four joys by the descent of the bodhicitta of the root cakra.

original: sngags ni dbugs 'byung rngub kyis 'khor lo srog aa wa dh'u t'ir bcug pas mi rtog pa'i sdom pa'o //
analyzed: sngags ni dbugs 'byung rngub kyis 'khor lo srog aa wa dh'u t'ir bcug pas mi rtog pa'i sdom pa'o //
translated: Mantra is the binding of nonconceptuality by the exhalation and inhalation of the breath, which causes the life-force to enter the avadh≈´ti cakra.

original: chos nyid stong pa nyid la sgyu ma'i ye shes skyes pas bde ba chen pos sdom pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid stong pa nyid la sgyu ma'i ye shes skyes pas bde ba chen pos sdom pa'o //
translated: Dharma is the binding of great bliss by the arising of illusory pristine consciousness in emptiness, the nature of reality.

original: ci'i phyir phyi ma'i phyi ma yin zhe na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir phyi ma'i phyi ma yin zhe na //
translated: Why is it the latter of the latter?

original: le'u 'bum pa ni rtsa ba'i rgyud yin la //
analyzed: le'u 'bum pa ni rtsa ba'i rgyud yin la //

original: shlo ka 'bum pa nas nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i phyir phyi ma yang le'u lnga bcu rtsa gcig pa ni phyi ma'i phyi ma yin pas so //
analyzed: shlo ka 'bum pa nas nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i phyir phyi ma yang le'u lnga bcu rtsa gcig pa ni phyi ma'i phyi ma yin pas so //
translated: Since the latter is equal to space, the latter half of the fifty-first chapter is the latter of the latter.

original: sprul pa'i sku ci'i phyir bde mchog ma yin zhe na //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku ci'i phyir bde mchog ma yin zhe na //
translated: Why is the emanation body not supreme?

original: de ni rjod par byed pa ma yin te //
analyzed: de ni rjod par byed pa ma yin te //
translated: It is not the speaker.

original: la las gzugs kyi rnam par rtog pas chos ston pa dang / la la sgra'i rnam par rtog pas chos ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la las gzugs kyi rnam par rtog pas chos ston pa dang / la la sgra'i rnam par rtog pas chos ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because some teach the Dharma with the conceptualization of form, and some teach the Dharma with the conceptualization of sound.

original: de la gzugs kyi rnam par rtog pa la mos pa la lha'i sku bsgom pa dang / sgra'i rnam par rtog pa la mos pa sngags bzlas pas bcos ma yin te //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi rnam par rtog pa la mos pa la lha'i sku bsgom pa dang / sgra'i rnam par rtog pa la mos pa sngags bzlas pas bcos ma yin te //
translated: For those who are devoted to the conceptualization of form, the cultivation of the divine body, and for those who are devoted to the conceptualization of sound, the recitation of mantras are artificial.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro las /
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro las /
translated: In the Vajradaka it is said:

original: rang bzhin ma grub rtog pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rang bzhin ma grub rtog pa'i phyir //

analyzed: phyir rol bcos mang rab tu sbyar // zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: many external artificialities are applied.

original: ston pa ni su zhig / gnas ni gang du //
analyzed: ston pa ni su zhig / gnas ni gang du //

original: dus ni nam gyi tshe 'khor ni su dag dang / chos ni ci zhig bstan snyam pa la bcom ldan 'das kyi gleng gzhi gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: dus ni nam gyi tshe 'khor ni su dag dang / chos ni ci zhig bstan snyam pa la bcom ldan 'das kyi gleng gzhi gsungs pa ni //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn‚Äôs introduction is as follows:

original: gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa na //
analyzed: gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa na //
translated: In the supreme secret‚Äôs place of joy,

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: üîΩüîΩ

original: mkha' 'gro dra ba'i sdom pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs so //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro dra ba'i sdom pa yin // zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs so //
translated: . . . is the binding of the dakini‚Äôs network.

original: de la gsang ba ni dga' ba'i gnas so //üîΩmchog ni mchog dga'i gnas so //
analyzed: de la gsang ba ni dga' ba'i gnas so // mchog ni mchog dga'i gnas so //
translated: Therein, the ‚Äúsupreme secret‚Äù is the place of joy.üîΩThe ‚Äúsupreme‚Äù is the place of supreme joy.

original: dgyes pa'i lhan cig skyes dga'i gnas so //
analyzed: dgyes pa'i lhan cig skyes dga'i gnas so //
translated: The ‚Äújoy‚Äù is the place of innate joy.

original: @356a * // 'dzam bu'i gling gru gsum na bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: @356a * // 'dzam bu'i gling gru gsum na bzhugs pa'o //
translated: He resides in the triangular continent.

original: thams cad bdag nyid ni gcig ste /
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid ni gcig ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù is one.

original: gdul bya'i 'khor drag po 'jigs byed dang / nyan pa'i 'khor sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / sprul pa'i 'khor rigs lnga'i dpa' bo dpa' mo dang / sdud pa po'i 'khor lcang lo can gyi bdag po'o //
analyzed: gdul bya'i 'khor drag po 'jigs byed dang / nyan pa'i 'khor sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / sprul pa'i 'khor rigs lnga'i dpa' bo dpa' mo dang / sdud pa po'i 'khor lcang lo can gyi bdag po'o //
translated: The retinue of disciples is Rudra Bhairava, the retinue of listeners is buddhas and bodhisattvas, the retinue of emanations is heroes and heroines of the five families, and the retinue of compilers is the lord of A·π≠akƒÅ.

original: rtag tu bzhugs zhes bya ba ni dus de gnyis ldan gyi dus su drag po 'jigs byed btul ba'i tshe'o //
analyzed: rtag tu bzhugs zhes bya ba ni dus de gnyis ldan gyi dus su drag po 'jigs byed btul ba'i tshe'o //
translated: The phrase always abiding refers to the time of subduing the fierce and terrifying Rudra in the two times.

original: bzhugs zhes bya ba ni gnas dang sbyar na sangs rgyas kyi zhing du ston pa yin la /
analyzed: bzhugs zhes bya ba ni gnas dang sbyar na sangs rgyas kyi zhing du ston pa yin la /
translated: The word abiding refers to the Buddha-field when applied to the place, and to the teacher when applied to the teacher.

original: ston pa dang sbyar na dbang byas pa dang longs spyod pa'i mdzad pa rnams dang ldan par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: ston pa dang sbyar na dbang byas pa dang longs spyod pa'i mdzad pa rnams dang ldan par ston pa yin no //
translated: When applied to the teacher, it refers to the teacher who possesses the deeds of mastery and enjoyment.

original: mkha' 'gro kun dngos sems dpa' ni //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro kun dngos sems dpa' ni //
translated: The hero who is the actuality of all dakinis

original: zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i sku ste 'bras bu'i he ru ka zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i sku ste 'bras bu'i he ru ka zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: is the emanation body, the meaning of the term heruka of the result.

original: mkha' 'gro ni gnyis te /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of dakinis:

original: rtog pa med pa'i zhi gnas kyi nam mkha' bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med par 'gro ba dang gzung 'dzin dang bral ba'i lhag mthong stong pa nyid kyi nam mkha' ste sa bcu gcig tu 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i zhi gnas kyi nam mkha' bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med par 'gro ba dang gzung 'dzin dang bral ba'i lhag mthong stong pa nyid kyi nam mkha' ste sa bcu gcig tu 'gro ba'o //
translated: the dakinis who go to the four meditative concentrations and the four formless states, the space of nonconceptual calm abiding, and the dakinis who go to the eleventh stage, the space of emptiness, the insight free from subject and object.

original: kun zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa ni 'jig rten gyi mkha' 'gro dur khrod brgyad na gnas pa kun nam /
analyzed: kun zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa ni 'jig rten gyi mkha' 'gro dur khrod brgyad na gnas pa kun nam /
translated: All means that the attainment of the concentrations and formless absorptions is the attainment of all the mundane sky-farers who dwell in the eight charnel grounds.

original: sa bcu gcig rtogs pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor lo lnga'i dbus na bdag po 'bras bu he ru ka ni gtso bo yin pas dngos zhes bya'o //üîΩsems ni snying rje'i dbang gis rgya che ba'i sems can la dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: sa bcu gcig rtogs pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor lo lnga'i dbus na bdag po 'bras bu he ru ka ni gtso bo yin pas dngos zhes bya'o // sems ni snying rje'i dbang gis rgya che ba'i sems can la dmigs pa'am /
translated: The transcendent buddhas and bodhisattvas who have realized the eleven grounds are the retinue. The resultant heruka who is the lord in the center of the five wheels is the principal one and is therefore called the actual.

original: shes rab kyi dbang gis zab pa'i chos nyid la gzigs pas na sems dpa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang gis zab pa'i chos nyid la gzigs pas na sems dpa'o //
translated: Hero means that the mind is a hero because it focuses on the vast sentient beings through the power of compassion or it sees the profound reality through the power of wisdom.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' bde ba'i mchog / ces bya ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste rgyu'i he ru ka'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' bde ba'i mchog / ces bya ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste rgyu'i he ru ka'o //
translated: The supreme bliss of Vajrasattva is the enjoyment body, the causal heruka.

original: rdo rje ni sa bcu gcig pa'i stong pa nyid de de la sems dpa' ni dag pa'i 'jig rten pa'i ye shes te nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral bas na dpa' ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni sa bcu gcig pa'i stong pa nyid de de la sems dpa' ni dag pa'i 'jig rten pa'i ye shes te nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral bas na dpa' ba'o //
translated: The vajra is the emptiness of the eleventh stage. The hero on that is the pure mundane gnosis, because it is heroic in being free from the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: sgyu ma lta bu dang stong pa nyid ro gcig pas na bde mchog ni ji snyed pa'am ji lta ba mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu dang stong pa nyid ro gcig pas na bde mchog ni ji snyed pa'am ji lta ba mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Supreme bliss is the gnosis that knows things in their variety and in their nature, because it is of one taste with the illusion-like emptiness.

original: 'di ni rang byung bcom ldan dpa' //
analyzed: 'di ni rang byung bcom ldan dpa' //
translated: This is the self-arisen, transcendent hero.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku ste bde ba chen po'i ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku ste bde ba chen po'i ye shes so //
translated: This is the body of truth, the gnosis of great bliss.

original: rang byung ni sems rang gi 'od gsal nyams su myong ba'i rgyu rkyen las skyes pa yin gyi glo bur gyi rgyu rkyen las ma skyes pas na rang byung ngo //
analyzed: rang byung ni sems rang gi 'od gsal nyams su myong ba'i rgyu rkyen las skyes pa yin gyi glo bur gyi rgyu rkyen las ma skyes pas na rang byung ngo //
translated: Self-arisen is arisen from the cause and condition of the experience of the clear light of one‚Äôs own mind, but not arisen from adventitious causes and conditions, and so it is self-arisen.

original: bdud bzhi bcom pas na bcom ldan @356b 'das so //
analyzed: bdud bzhi bcom pas na bcom ldan @356b 'das so //
translated: Transcendent is transcendent because it has conquered the four demons.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag la nyal spangs pas na dpa' ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag la nyal spangs pas na dpa' ba'o //
translated: Heroic is heroic because it has abandoned the latent propensities of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: mkha' 'gro dra ba'i sdom pa yin //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro dra ba'i sdom pa yin //
translated: It is the binding of the dakinis‚Äô network.

original: zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i chos te sprul pa'i sku dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dra ba'i sdom pa'am dbyibs dang sngags dang chos kyi bde mchog yin pas na sdom pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i chos te sprul pa'i sku dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dra ba'i sdom pa'am dbyibs dang sngags dang chos kyi bde mchog yin pas na sdom pa'o //
translated: The Dharma to be explained is the vow of the network of heroes and heroines of the Emanation Body, or the supreme bliss of the shape, mantra, and Dharma of the Vow of Supreme Bliss.

original: phun sum tshogs pa lnga'i gleng gzhi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mngon sum du grub pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la dgongs pa ci yod ce na 'di ni dgongs pas bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa lnga'i gleng gzhi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mngon sum du grub pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la dgongs pa ci yod ce na 'di ni dgongs pas bshad pa yin te /
translated: What is the intention of the Lord in teaching the nidana of the five perfections, which is established in the direct perception of the Bodhisattvas? This is an explanation by way of intention,

original: sa'i snying pos dbyings su go ba dang / spyan ras gzigs kyis sngags su go ba dang / 'jam dpal gyis chos su go ba'o //
analyzed: sa'i snying pos dbyings su go ba dang / spyan ras gzigs kyis sngags su go ba dang / 'jam dpal gyis chos su go ba'o //
translated: because Ksitigarbha understands it as the realm, Avalokitesvara understands it as mantra, and Manjusri understands it as Dharma.

original: de la dbyings ni las kyi phyag rgya dkyil 'khor bha ga ni gnas yin la de yang mtshan nyid gsum ste /
analyzed: de la dbyings ni las kyi phyag rgya dkyil 'khor bha ga ni gnas yin la de yang mtshan nyid gsum ste /
translated: Therein, the realm is the action seal, the bhaga of the mandala, the place, and that is also threefold:

original: dga' ba 'byung bas gsang pa dang / mchog dga' 'byung bas mchog dang / lhan cig skyes dga' 'byung bas na dgyes pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba 'byung bas gsang pa dang / mchog dga' 'byung bas mchog dang / lhan cig skyes dga' 'byung bas na dgyes pa'o //
translated: the secret, because bliss arises; the supreme, because supreme bliss arises; and the delight, because the innate bliss arises.

original: thams cad bdag nyid 'khor lo ste rtsa drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid 'khor lo ste rtsa drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: All of them are the wheel, that is, the sixty-four channels.

original: rtag tu bzhugs ni dga' ba bzhi'i dus so //
analyzed: rtag tu bzhugs ni dga' ba bzhi'i dus so //
translated: Always abiding is the time of the four joys.

original: sku gsum ni lkog ma dang snying ga dang lte bar phyin pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: sku gsum ni lkog ma dang snying ga dang lte bar phyin pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: The three bodies are the bliss that reaches the throat, heart, and navel.

original: ston pa des bshad pa'i 'khor lo bzhi khyab pa ni 'khor ro //
analyzed: ston pa des bshad pa'i 'khor lo bzhi khyab pa ni 'khor ro //
translated: The retinue that pervades the four wheels explained by that teacher is the retinue.

original: sngags ni dkyil 'khor gyi lus kyi gnas na dbugs 'byung rngub gsum gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pas na gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa na'o //
analyzed: sngags ni dkyil 'khor gyi lus kyi gnas na dbugs 'byung rngub gsum gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pas na gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa na'o //
translated: The mantra is in the supreme secret place of the body of the ma·πá·∏çala, endowed with the characteristics of the three inhalations and exhalations.

original: thams cad bdag nyid ni dbugs nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'o //
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid ni dbugs nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'o //
translated: All of them are the twenty-one thousand six hundred breaths.

original: rtag tu bzhugs ni rlung gnyis 'gog pa'i dus ni srog aa wa dh'u t'ir chud pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu bzhugs ni rlung gnyis 'gog pa'i dus ni srog aa wa dh'u t'ir chud pa'o //
translated: Always abiding is the time of the cessation of the two vƒÅyus, which is the prƒÅ·πáa entering the avadh≈´ti.

original: ston pa po ni rtsa gsum gyi rlung dbus su chud pas mi rtog pa skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa po ni rtsa gsum gyi rlung dbus su chud pas mi rtog pa skyes pa'o //
translated: The teacher is the arising of nonconceptuality through the vƒÅyu of the three nƒÅ·∏çƒ´s entering the central nƒÅ·∏çƒ´.

original: des bshad pa'i chos ni dbugs nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'i dra ba sdom pa las bde ba skyes pa'o //
analyzed: des bshad pa'i chos ni dbugs nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'i dra ba sdom pa las bde ba skyes pa'o //
translated: The dharma explained by that teacher is the arising of bliss from the binding of the net of twenty-one thousand six hundred breaths.

original: de la chos kyi dbang du byas na phyag rgya chen po'i chos kyi dbyings kyi gnas so //
analyzed: de la chos kyi dbang du byas na phyag rgya chen po'i chos kyi dbyings kyi gnas so //
translated: In terms of the Dharma, it is the abode of the dharmadhatu of mahamudra.

original: de yang stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pas gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa na'o //
analyzed: de yang stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pas gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa na'o //
translated: Moreover, it is the supreme secret of bliss, endowed with the characteristics of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: thams cad bdag nyid ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun no //
translated: The nature of everything is the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: rtag tu bzhugs ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus te /üîΩshes rab ye shes yul gyi stong pa nyid dang dbang bzhi pa yul can gyi stong pa nyid mthong ba'i dus so //
analyzed: rtag tu bzhugs ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus te / shes rab ye shes yul gyi stong pa nyid dang dbang bzhi pa yul can gyi stong pa nyid mthong ba'i dus so //
translated: Always abiding is the inconceivable time.

original: rtag tu bzhugs ni sems 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu bzhugs ni sems 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'o //
translated: Always abiding is the nature of the clear-light mind.

original: ston pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te gong @357a * //
analyzed: ston pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te gong @357a * //
translated: The teacher is nonconceptual wisdom.

original: bu'i gzugs las 'das par gyur pa sprul pa'i sku dang dngos po med pa yin zhes gsungs pas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / de yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes gsungs pas gnyis su med pa'i bde ba chen po chos kyi sku'i ston pa des bshad pa'i sems kyi bde mchog gi dra ba sdom pa'o //
analyzed: bu'i gzugs las 'das par gyur pa sprul pa'i sku dang dngos po med pa yin zhes gsungs pas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / de yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes gsungs pas gnyis su med pa'i bde ba chen po chos kyi sku'i ston pa des bshad pa'i sems kyi bde mchog gi dra ba sdom pa'o //
translated: Since it is said that the form of the son is beyond the nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya, the sambhogakƒÅya is non-entity. Since it is said that that is inconceivable, the teacher of the dharmakƒÅya, great nondual bliss, is the binding of the net of the mind's Cakrasa·πÉvara.

original: de lta bas na ston pa'i gleng gzhi bshad pa las kyi phyag rgya chags lam bsgom pa dang / chos dang / dam tshig gis phyag rgya grol ba'i lam bstan pa dang / phyag rgya chen po bsgom par rang lhag par gnas pa'i lam bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na ston pa'i gleng gzhi bshad pa las kyi phyag rgya chags lam bsgom pa dang / chos dang / dam tshig gis phyag rgya grol ba'i lam bstan pa dang / phyag rgya chen po bsgom par rang lhag par gnas pa'i lam bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the nidƒÅna of the teacher is explained: the path of meditation on the karma consort is the path of liberation through the dharma and samaya consorts, and the path of the meditation of the mahƒÅmudrƒÅ is the path of the special abidance.

original: bshad pa'i rgyud rdo rje mkha' 'gro dang kha sbyor thig le las dkyil 'khor bha ga'i dbang du byas nas 'byung ba bzhi'i rtsa'i dbus su nam mkha'i rtsa gnas su bshad pas 'byung ba lnga dang sbyar ba /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud rdo rje mkha' 'gro dang kha sbyor thig le las dkyil 'khor bha ga'i dbang du byas nas 'byung ba bzhi'i rtsa'i dbus su nam mkha'i rtsa gnas su bshad pas 'byung ba lnga dang sbyar ba /
translated: The explanatory tantra Vajradaka and the Yuganaddha-tilaka explain that the mandala is in the bhaga, and that the central channel of the four elements is the channel of space.üîΩThus, they are associated with the five elements.üîΩThe mandala is in the body, and the five winds are taught.üîΩThe mandala is in the dharmadhatu, and the appearance of the perfect clear light, which is the abandonment of the imagined and the dependent, is explained by the sixteen syllables.

original: dkyil 'khor lus kyi dbang du byas nas rlung lnga ston pa dang / dkyil 'khor chos kyi dbyings kyi dbang du mdzad nas yi ge bcu drug gis kun brtags pa dang gzhan dbang gi snang ba spangs pa'i yongs su grub pa'i 'od gsal ba'i snang ba bshad pas stong pa nyid bcu drug mtshon pa yin pas bshad pa'i rgyud kyi don
analyzed: dkyil 'khor lus kyi dbang du byas nas rlung lnga ston pa dang / dkyil 'khor chos kyi dbyings kyi dbang du mdzad nas yi ge bcu drug gis kun brtags pa dang gzhan dbang gi snang ba spangs pa'i yongs su grub pa'i 'od gsal ba'i snang ba bshad pas stong pa nyid bcu drug mtshon pa yin pas bshad pa'i rgyud kyi don
translated: Thus, the sixteen emptinesses are illustrated.

original: la rmongs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: la rmongs par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not be confused about the meaning of the explanatory tantra.

original: de ltar gleng gzhi bshad nas rgyud kyi lus mdor gzhag par bzhed pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar gleng gzhi bshad nas rgyud kyi lus mdor gzhag par bzhed pa ni /
translated: Having explained the nidana, the root text of the tantra is presented in brief:

original: sgra yi tshul la nges 'byung rnams //
analyzed: sgra yi tshul la nges 'byung rnams //
translated: The ones who are certain about the way of sound

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: sgra ni rlung dbus ma las 'byung ba'i yi ge h'um ngo //
analyzed: sgra ni rlung dbus ma las 'byung ba'i yi ge h'um ngo //
translated: Sound is the syllable h≈´·πÉ that arises from the central wind.

original: de las 'byung ba ni lha drug cu rtsa gnyis te /
analyzed: de las 'byung ba ni lha drug cu rtsa gnyis te /
translated: From that arise the sixty-two deities.

original: sprul pa las 'byung dpa' bo rnams //
analyzed: sprul pa las 'byung dpa' bo rnams //
translated: The heroes arise from the emanations.

original: yan lag drug cu sems kyis sprul //
analyzed: yan lag drug cu sems kyis sprul //
translated: The sixty branches are emanated by the mind.

original: dag pa'i chos kyi sprul pa ni //
analyzed: dag pa'i chos kyi sprul pa ni //
translated: The emanation of pure phenomena

original: phag mo'i gzugs su bstan pa yin //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phag mo'i gzugs su bstan pa yin // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is taught to be the form of VƒÅrƒÅhƒ´.

original: dam tshig spyod pa ni rten gyi gang zag rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig spyod pa ni rten gyi gang zag rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: The practitioner who is the person who is the basis of the commitments is the yogin.

original: spyod yul ni lha'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: spyod yul ni lha'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: The domain is the wheel of deities.

original: de yang ji lta bur bsgom par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bur bsgom par bya zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how should one meditate on that?üîΩIt is said:

original: thog ma dbus mthar rnam par bzhes //üîΩzhes bya bar gsungs te /
analyzed: thog ma dbus mthar rnam par bzhes // zhes bya bar gsungs te /
translated: Meditate on the beginning, middle, and end.

original: thog ma ni gnas pa'i rnal 'byor te tshad med pa byin gyis brlabs pa dang tshogs bsags pa dang / stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: thog ma ni gnas pa'i rnal 'byor te tshad med pa byin gyis brlabs pa dang tshogs bsags pa dang / stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The beginning is the yoga of abiding, which is the yoga of abiding in the immeasurable, the yoga of blessing, the yoga of gathering the accumulations, and the yoga of abiding in emptiness.

original: dbus ni ldang ba 'jug pa yongs su rdzogs pa byin gyis brlabs pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / srung ba'i 'khor lo dang / mchod pa'i rnal 'byor te ting nge 'dzin de rnam pa gsum @357b mo ;
analyzed: dbus ni ldang ba 'jug pa yongs su rdzogs pa byin gyis brlabs pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / srung ba'i 'khor lo dang / mchod pa'i rnal 'byor te ting nge 'dzin de rnam pa gsum @357b mo ;
translated: The central one is the yoga of arising, entering, and complete perfection, consecration, empowerment, protection wheel, and offering.

original: / mthar nye bar bsdu ba dang kun du spyod pa ste ldang ba'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: / mthar nye bar bsdu ba dang kun du spyod pa ste ldang ba'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The final one is the yoga of arising, which is the near-withdrawal and the conduct.

original: rnam par gnas zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor rgyud la sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi rjes 'jug dge bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gnas zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor rgyud la sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi rjes 'jug dge bar gnas pa'o //
translated: The abiding is the abiding in the virtue of the yoga tantra, the application, the main subject, and the conclusion.

original: de'i phan yon ci zhig ce na //
analyzed: de'i phan yon ci zhig ce na //
translated: What is the benefit of that?

original: 'jig rten gsum du rnyed dka' zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum du rnyed dka' zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said, difficult to attain in the three worlds.

original: sa bla dang sa 'og dang sa steng gsum du ye shes sems dpa' lus la 'jug pa dang 'ching ba'i tshe ye shes sems dpa' la phar 'jug pa rnyed par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: sa bla dang sa 'og dang sa steng gsum du ye shes sems dpa' lus la 'jug pa dang 'ching ba'i tshe ye shes sems dpa' la phar 'jug pa rnyed par dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to attain the wisdom being entering and binding the body, and the wisdom being entering the body, in the three worlds of the upper, lower, and middle realms.

original: bshad pa'i rgyud rdo rje mkha' 'gro las zab mo'i rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dbang du mdzad nas sgra ni aa wa dh'u t'i'i rlung yin la 'byung ba ni dga' ba bzhi'i shes pa yin la dam tshig spyod pa ni skye mched bcu gnyis bde bas khyab pa yin
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud rdo rje mkha' 'gro las zab mo'i rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dbang du mdzad nas sgra ni aa wa dh'u t'i'i rlung yin la 'byung ba ni dga' ba bzhi'i shes pa yin la dam tshig spyod pa ni skye mched bcu gnyis bde bas khyab pa yin
translated: Samaya conduct is the pervasion of bliss in the twelve sense bases.

original: la / spyod yul ni bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i lam las thams cad bde bas khyab par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: la / spyod yul ni bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i lam las thams cad bde bas khyab par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The field of experience is the realization that all phenomena are pervaded by bliss through the path of self-consecration.

original: rang rig 'od gsal gyi bde ba de dus thams cad du gnas pas na /üîΩthog ma dbus mthar yang dag gnas //
analyzed: rang rig 'od gsal gyi bde ba de dus thams cad du gnas pas na / thog ma dbus mthar yang dag gnas //
translated: Since the bliss of one‚Äôs vidyƒÅ exists at all times,

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúTotally present in the beginning, middle, and end.‚Äù

original: de la dbang bzhi pa'i dus kyi tshe mngon sum du rtogs pa ni 'jig rten gsum du rnyed par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: de la dbang bzhi pa'i dus kyi tshe mngon sum du rtogs pa ni 'jig rten gsum du rnyed par dka' ba yin no //
translated: At the time of the fourth empowerment, the direct realization is difficult to find in the three worlds.

original: de yang thabs gang gis rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de yang thabs gang gis rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: If it is asked by what method is it realized,

original: shes rab thabs kyis sbyor ji bzhin //
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyis sbyor ji bzhin //
translated: it is realized by the method of wisdom.

original: zhes pas phyag rgya bzhi las bde ba stong pa nyid du rtogs par bya'o zhes gsungs pas bshad pa'i rgyud la rmongs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pas phyag rgya bzhi las bde ba stong pa nyid du rtogs par bya'o zhes gsungs pas bshad pa'i rgyud la rmongs par mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should not be confused about the explanatory tantra.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With respect to the stage of completion,üîΩit is said:

original: thabs dang shes rab sbyor ba bzhin //üîΩsngags bzlas bsam gtan la sogs ldan //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab sbyor ba bzhin // sngags bzlas bsam gtan la sogs ldan //
translated: Like the union of method and wisdom,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: endowed with mantra repetition, meditation, and so on.

original: bde ba rtog pa med pa lhan cig skyes pa dang / bde ba stong pa nyid du shes pa don gyi lhan cig skyes pa gnyis grub par byed pa'i thabs ni shes rab phyag rgya bzhi dang thabs bzhi ste /
analyzed: bde ba rtog pa med pa lhan cig skyes pa dang / bde ba stong pa nyid du shes pa don gyi lhan cig skyes pa gnyis grub par byed pa'i thabs ni shes rab phyag rgya bzhi dang thabs bzhi ste /
translated: The method for accomplishing the two‚Äîthe nonconceptual bliss that is connate and the bliss that is known as emptiness, which is the ultimate connate‚Äîis the four seals of wisdom and the four methods.

original: de yang phyag rgya bzhi ni las kyi phyag rgya ni lo brgyad nas nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i bar gyi bud med kyi aa wa dh'u t'i nam mkha'i rtsa'i reg bya'o //
analyzed: de yang phyag rgya bzhi ni las kyi phyag rgya ni lo brgyad nas nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i bar gyi bud med kyi aa wa dh'u t'i nam mkha'i rtsa'i reg bya'o //
translated: The four seals are as follows: The action seal is the tactile object of the avadh≈´tƒ´ space-cakra of a woman from eight to twenty-four years of age.

original: chos kyi phyag rgya ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga yid du mi 'ong ba dang / bar ma spangs pa'i gzugs sdug pa dang sgra snyan pa dang dri zhim pa dang reg bya rnams kyis yid du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga yid du mi 'ong ba dang / bar ma spangs pa'i gzugs sdug pa dang sgra snyan pa dang dri zhim pa dang reg bya rnams kyis yid du 'ong ba'o //
translated: The seal of Dharma is the pleasant forms, sounds, smells, and sensations that arise from the five sense objects, which are not unpleasant or neutral.

original: dam tshig gi phyag rgya ni sa dang chu dang rlung spangs pa'i rlung me'i drod can no //üîΩphyag rgya chen po ni rjes su dpag pa dang lung gis bstan @358a * //
analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgya ni sa dang chu dang rlung spangs pa'i rlung me'i drod can no // phyag rgya chen po ni rjes su dpag pa dang lung gis bstan @358a * //
translated: The seal of commitment is the wind element that is not earth, water, or wind, but is the heat of fire.

original: pa dang lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa chos nyid mngon sum gyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: pa dang lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa chos nyid mngon sum gyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: The great seal is the realization of reality by direct perception, which is not inferred or taught by scripture, and is not hidden.

original: thabs ni 'khrul 'khor gyis byang chub kyi sems 'dzin par nus pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i phyi'i lus kyi dbang po mngon sum las kyi phyag rgya'i thabs so //
analyzed: thabs ni 'khrul 'khor gyis byang chub kyi sems 'dzin par nus pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i phyi'i lus kyi dbang po mngon sum las kyi phyag rgya'i thabs so //
translated: The method is the external sense organ of the body of the yogin who is able to retain the bodhicitta by means of the yantra, which is the method of the karmamudra.

original: chos kyi thabs ni yul 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga yid du 'ong ba las skyes pa'i bde ba yid kyi mngon sum mo //
analyzed: chos kyi thabs ni yul 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga yid du 'ong ba las skyes pa'i bde ba yid kyi mngon sum mo //
translated: The method of Dharma is the bliss that arises from the pleasant five sense objects, which is the direct perception of the mind.

original: dam tshig phyag rgya'i thabs ni nang gi reg bya bde ba skyes pa'i lus kyi dbang po mngon sum mo //
analyzed: dam tshig phyag rgya'i thabs ni nang gi reg bya bde ba skyes pa'i lus kyi dbang po mngon sum mo //
translated: The method of the pledge seal is the direct perception of the body sense faculty that gives rise to the inner tactile bliss.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i thabs ni rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis chos nyid mthong ba'i rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum mo //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i thabs ni rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis chos nyid mthong ba'i rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum mo //
translated: The method of the great seal is the direct perception of the yogin who sees reality by means of the direct perception of reflexive awareness.

original: sbyor ji bzhin ni dga' ba gsum la rang bzhin brgyad cu dang bral nas rtog pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / bde ba stong pa nyid shes pa'i 'od gsal ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: sbyor ji bzhin ni dga' ba gsum la rang bzhin brgyad cu dang bral nas rtog pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / bde ba stong pa nyid shes pa'i 'od gsal ba'i ye shes so //
translated: Just as the union is is the nonconceptual consciousness free from the eighty natural [afflictions] in the three joys, and the clear light gnosis that knows bliss and emptiness.

original: yul ji lta ba bzhin du mngon sum gyi lam gyis rtogs pas na sbyor ji bzhin no //
analyzed: yul ji lta ba bzhin du mngon sum gyi lam gyis rtogs pas na sbyor ji bzhin no //
translated: Since one realizes the path of direct perception just as the object is, it is just as the union.

original: sngags bzlas ni dbugs 'byung rngub aa wa dh'u t'ir bcug pa'o //
analyzed: sngags bzlas ni dbugs 'byung rngub aa wa dh'u t'ir bcug pa'o //
translated: The mantra repetition is the exhalation and inhalation of breath inserted into the avadh≈´tƒ´.

original: bsam gtan ni rtog med kyis mthong ba'i stong pa nyid de snang ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni rtog med kyis mthong ba'i stong pa nyid de snang ba'o //
translated: The concentration is the emptiness seen by the nonconceptual, which is the light.

original: sogs ni bla na med pa'i sbyin sreg dang mchod sbyin dang slob dpon no //
analyzed: sogs ni bla na med pa'i sbyin sreg dang mchod sbyin dang slob dpon no //
translated: The ‚Äúetc.‚Äù is the unsurpassed burnt offering, sacrifice, and master.

original: de yang kha sbyor las /
analyzed: de yang kha sbyor las /
translated: Moreover, the Samputa Tantra states:

original: 'byung rngub 'khor bas bzlas pa yin /
analyzed: 'byung rngub 'khor bas bzlas pa yin /
translated: The recitation is the repetition of the exhalation and inhalation.

original: sgom pa so sor snang bas na //
analyzed: sgom pa so sor snang bas na //
translated: The meditation is the individual appearances.

original: slob dpon sems kyi rgyal po yin //
analyzed: slob dpon sems kyi rgyal po yin //
translated: The master is the king of minds.

original: ae wam la sogs gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ae wam la sogs gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is the teaching of E-VAM, and so forth.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: sbyor nyid cho ga'i ye shes ni mtshan nyid kyi theg pa ltar goms pa lam du byed pa ma yin pa phyag rgya bzhi'o //
analyzed: sbyor nyid cho ga'i ye shes ni mtshan nyid kyi theg pa ltar goms pa lam du byed pa ma yin pa phyag rgya bzhi'o //
translated: The wisdom of the ritual of union is the four seals, which are not the path of familiarization as in the vehicle of characteristics.

original: rgyu rkyen bsags pa las byung ba'i ye shes bla ma'i man ngag mngon sum gyi gzhan don gyis bskyed pas na mchog gi ye shes so //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen bsags pa las byung ba'i ye shes bla ma'i man ngag mngon sum gyi gzhan don gyis bskyed pas na mchog gi ye shes so //
translated: The supreme wisdom is the wisdom that arises from the accumulation of causes and conditions, generated by the direct perception of the guru's instructions for the benefit of others.

original: rgyud las gsungs pa zhes pa ni le'u 'bum pa dang shlo ka 'bum pa las so //
analyzed: rgyud las gsungs pa zhes pa ni le'u 'bum pa dang shlo ka 'bum pa las so //
translated: The statement taught in the tantra refers to the Hundred Thousand and the Hundred Thousand Shlokas.

original: nyan par gyis zhes bya ba ni sdud pa po lag na rdo rje la sems rtse gcig pas nyon cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: nyan par gyis zhes bya ba ni sdud pa po lag na rdo rje la sems rtse gcig pas nyon cig ces pa'o //
translated: The phrase listen means listen with a one-pointed mind to the compiler Vajrapani.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis le'u lnga bcu rtsa gcig gi lus mdor gzhag gsungs nas /
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis le'u lnga bcu rtsa gcig gi lus mdor gzhag gsungs nas /
translated: Thus, having stated in two verses the concise body of the fifty-one chapters,

original: de ni le'u dang po rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i mdor bstan gnas dang bcas pa rgyas par bshad par bzhed nas dbugs 'byung bar ma mchog dag dang // dri yi zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni le'u dang po rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i mdor bstan gnas dang bcas pa rgyas par bshad par bzhed nas dbugs 'byung bar ma mchog dag dang // dri yi zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Now, wishing to explain the first chapter, the summary of the completion stage, together with its topics, he says, ‚Äúexhalation, supreme, and so on, and smell,‚Äù and so on.üîΩFirst, the substance for relying on the ga·πáacakra feast is the five nectars: the feces of a cow, the urine of a horse, the blood of a rabbit, the semen of a bull, and the bone of an elephant.

original: dang po snod gcig tu @358b za ba tshogs kyi 'khor lo bsten pa'i rdzas dang / dbugs 'byung byang chub kyi sems dang / bar ma rang byung gi khrag dang / mchog sha chen po dang / dri ni bshang ba dang ro'i chu ni gci ba dang /
analyzed: dang po snod gcig tu @358b za ba tshogs kyi 'khor lo bsten pa'i rdzas dang / dbugs 'byung byang chub kyi sems dang / bar ma rang byung gi khrag dang / mchog sha chen po dang / dri ni bshang ba dang ro'i chu ni gci ba dang /
translated: The five supreme substances are the five meats: human flesh, horse flesh, elephant flesh, dog flesh, and cow flesh.

original: bcas pa ni rta dang glang po dang khyi dang ba lang dang mi sha ste lnga'o //
analyzed: bcas pa ni rta dang glang po dang khyi dang ba lang dang mi sha ste lnga'o //
translated: The five substances that are possessed are the five: horse, elephant, dog, cow, and human flesh.

original: de aom a'a: h'um gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs nas rigs lnga'i rang bzhin can gyis ro rdo rje mar bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de aom a'a: h'um gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs nas rigs lnga'i rang bzhin can gyis ro rdo rje mar bskyed pa'o //
translated: Having consecrated those with the three syllables, o·πÉ, ƒÅ·∏•, and h≈´·πÉ, one should generate them as the nature of the five families and as RƒÅgavajrƒÅ.

original: rnal 'byor pas dus rtag tu khyad par rigs ldan rnams ni mchod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni thun bzhi'am dus drug tu tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i lha mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas dus rtag tu khyad par rigs ldan rnams ni mchod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni thun bzhi'am dus drug tu tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i lha mchod par bya'o //
translated: The yogi/nƒ´ should always worship the special families, means that one should worship the deities of the ga·πáacakra in four sessions or six times a day.

original: rnal 'byor pa ni rten gyi gang zag go //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni rten gyi gang zag go //
translated: The yogi/nƒ´ is the person who is the basis.

original: dus rtag tu zhes pa ni rgyun mi 'chad par dus drug go //
analyzed: dus rtag tu zhes pa ni rgyun mi 'chad par dus drug go //
translated: ‚Äú Always‚Äù means without interruption, in the six periods of the day.

original: khyad par ni rtog pa med pa'i shes pas ro myang ba'i rigs ldan ni lha drug cu rtsa gnyis su bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par ni rtog pa med pa'i shes pas ro myang ba'i rigs ldan ni lha drug cu rtsa gnyis su bskyed pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Special‚Äù refers to the families who enjoy the taste of nonconceptual consciousness, generated as the sixty-two deities.

original: mchod pa ni nang du 'khor lo bzhi pa la dkyil 'khor bzhi bsgom pa dang / lus kyi dkyil 'khor dang lnga la nang gi sbyin sreg dbul ba'o //
analyzed: mchod pa ni nang du 'khor lo bzhi pa la dkyil 'khor bzhi bsgom pa dang / lus kyi dkyil 'khor dang lnga la nang gi sbyin sreg dbul ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Worship‚Äù is the inner fire offering, which is the meditation on the four ma·πá·∏çalas in the four cakras of the body and the five ma·πá·∏çalas of the body.

original: tshogs kyi 'khor lo de yang gnyis su gyur te bdud rtsi lnga'i ro rdo rje ma la yid nang du chud pas bde ba rtog med kyi 'dod pa'i dngos grub sgom pa'am /
analyzed: tshogs kyi 'khor lo de yang gnyis su gyur te bdud rtsi lnga'i ro rdo rje ma la yid nang du chud pas bde ba rtog med kyi 'dod pa'i dngos grub sgom pa'am /
translated: That ga·πáacakra is of two types: the ga·πáacakra of the five am·πõtas, which is the meditation on the nonconceptual bliss of the taste of the vajra lady that enters the mind;

original: gal te yid phyir byung na dus drug tu rigs ldan dkyil 'khor la sbyin sreg gis mchod pa'o //
analyzed: gal te yid phyir byung na dus drug tu rigs ldan dkyil 'khor la sbyin sreg gis mchod pa'o //
translated: If the mind turns away, one should make offerings to the mandala of the clan in the six times by means of burnt offerings.

analyzed: ro 'ba' zhig gis tshogs kyi 'khor lo bya'am zhe na /

original: pho nya lhan cig skyes dngos grub //üîΩmchog dang 'bring dang tha ma ste //
analyzed: pho nya lhan cig skyes dngos grub // mchog dang 'bring dang tha ma ste //
translated: The messenger, the innate, the power,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the supreme, the middling, and the inferior.

original: pho nya ni mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i bud med dge bsnyen ma'i sdom pa dang byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa dang sngags kyi dbang bskur thob pa'o //
analyzed: pho nya ni mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i bud med dge bsnyen ma'i sdom pa dang byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa dang sngags kyi dbang bskur thob pa'o //
translated: The messenger is a woman who has the characteristics, who has obtained the vows of the upƒÅsikƒÅ, the vows of the bodhisattva, and the empowerment of the mantra.üîΩAnd it is said:

analyzed: de yang / gzhi ni sa gzhir byas nas su //
translated: Having made the ground the basis,

original: rnal 'byor pa yis longs spyod bya //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yis longs spyod bya // zhes gsungs so //
translated: the yogin should enjoy.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dngos grub ni /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dngos grub ni /
translated: The innate power is

original: goms pa las byung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: goms pa las byung ba ma yin pa /

analyzed: bde ba rtog med rgyud tshogs pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba bzhi ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dngos grub po //

analyzed: mchog ni las las skyes pa ste skye ba snga mar gsang sngags kyi sgom pa goms pa'i tshogs lam dang sbyor lam mthong lam sgom lam thob pa'i byang chub sems ma'o //

analyzed: 'bring ni zhing skyes te gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang yul dbus su skyes pa dang @359a * //
translated: The middling is born in a pure land, born in one of the twenty-four sacred lands,

original: dbang po tshang ba dang las kyi mtha' ma log pas dge ba la 'jug pa dang / sngags kyi bstan pa la dad pa dang / bstan pa dang phrad pa ste bdag gi 'byor pa lnga dang ldan pa'o //

translated: and endowed with the five personal resources: complete faculties, not engaging in perverted actions, engaging in virtue, faith in the mantra teaching, and encountering the teaching.

original: tha ma ni sngags las skyes ma ste rdo rje slob dpon gyi phyag rgyar gyur pas ma dang ; rang dang lhan cig dbang bskur ba'i sring mo dang / rang gis dbang bskur ba'i bu mo dang / slob mas dbang bskur ba'i tsha mo dang /
analyzed: tha ma ni sngags las skyes ma ste rdo rje slob dpon gyi phyag rgyar gyur pas ma dang ; rang dang lhan cig dbang bskur ba'i sring mo dang / rang gis dbang bskur ba'i bu mo dang / slob mas dbang bskur ba'i tsha mo dang /
translated: The least is born from mantra, a vajra master‚Äôs consort who is a mother, a sister who was initiated at the same time as oneself, a daughter who was initiated by oneself, a niece who was initiated by a disciple,
