analyzed: rang gi sgom pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa pho nya ma'o //
translated: and a messenger who is a branch of one‚Äôs own meditation.

original: tshig de rnams ni reg bya rdo rje ma yin la de la gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang / reg bya dang ldan pas tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i yul ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: tshig de rnams ni reg bya rdo rje ma yin la de la gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang / reg bya dang ldan pas tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i yul ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Those words are not the tactile-vajra woman, but since she possesses form, sound, smell, taste, and touch, the field of the ga·πáa-wheel is the five sense objects.

original: yid ni nang du chud pa yin /
analyzed: yid ni nang du chud pa yin /
translated: The mind is absorbed internally.

original: 'dod pa'i dngos grub bsgrub par bya ba la yid ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dngos grub bsgrub par bya ba la yid ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: In order to accomplish the desired attainment, the mind is discursive thought.

original: nang du chud pa ni srog aa wa dh'u t'ir chud pas 'dod yon lnga la shes pa rtog pa med par skyes pa'o //
analyzed: nang du chud pa ni srog aa wa dh'u t'ir chud pas 'dod yon lnga la shes pa rtog pa med par skyes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAbsorbed internally‚Äù means that since the life-force is absorbed in the avadh≈´ti, the five sense objects arise without discursive thought.

original: 'dod pa'i dngos grub ni bde ba rtog pa med pa bsam gtan gyi sdom pa mi g-yo ba'i las so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dngos grub ni bde ba rtog pa med pa bsam gtan gyi sdom pa mi g-yo ba'i las so //
translated: ‚ÄúDesired attainment‚Äù is the karma of unwavering meditative concentration, which is nonconceptual bliss.

original: gal te rtog pa skye bar gyur na ji ltar bya zhe na /üîΩrang rdzas thig les sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' mchod par bya //
analyzed: gal te rtog pa skye bar gyur na ji ltar bya zhe na / rang rdzas thig les sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' mchod par bya //
translated: If discursive thought arises, what should one do?

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: One should make offerings to the buddhas and bodhisattvas with one‚Äôs own bindu substance.

original: dga' bral du song ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyis phung po lnga'i sangs rgyas dang / dbang po drug gi byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'byung ba lnga'i yul mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: dga' bral du song ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyis phung po lnga'i sangs rgyas dang / dbang po drug gi byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'byung ba lnga'i yul mchod par bya'o //
translated: With the awakening mind that has gone beyond joy, one should make offerings to the buddhas of the five aggregates, the bodhisattvas of the six sense faculties, and the objects of the five elements.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro rnams la dga' bral du song na gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pas phyi dang nang gi dkyil 'khor la mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro rnams la dga' bral du song na gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pas phyi dang nang gi dkyil 'khor la mchod par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, if form, sound, smell, and taste have gone beyond joy, one should make offerings to the outer and inner ma·πá·∏çala with R≈´pavajrƒÅ and so forth.

original: de skad du yang mnyam sbyor las //
analyzed: de skad du yang mnyam sbyor las //
translated: Thus it is said in the Union with Yoga Tantra:üîΩThose who engage in deity yoga

original: lha la dmigs pa byed pa dag / rnal 'byor gzugs brnyan rang bzhin te //
analyzed: lha la dmigs pa byed pa dag / rnal 'byor gzugs brnyan rang bzhin te //
translated: are of the nature of the reflected image.

original: rang gi dam tshig bdag sbyor ba //
analyzed: rang gi dam tshig bdag sbyor ba //
translated: One‚Äôs own commitment is the union.

original: mi 'gyur dam pa grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: mi 'gyur dam pa grub par 'gyur //
translated: The supreme unchanging is accomplished.

original: gzugs brnyan lugs ma la sogs pa //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan lugs ma la sogs pa //
translated: The reflected image, such as a statue,

original: rnal 'byor 'byung bar mi 'gyur kyang //
analyzed: rnal 'byor 'byung bar mi 'gyur kyang //
translated: does not give rise to the yoga.

original: byang chub sems la rab brtson na //
analyzed: byang chub sems la rab brtson na //
translated: But if one strives at the awakening mind,

original: de las rnal 'byor lhar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las rnal 'byor lhar 'gyur ro //
translated: the yoga will become the deity.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: las kyi phyag rgya spangs pa yi //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya spangs pa yi //
translated: One should abandon the karmamudrƒÅ.

original: 'gro ba'i lam la ji ltar yin //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i lam la ji ltar yin //
translated: How is it on the path of beings?

original: nang du chud par bya zhe na //
analyzed: nang du chud par bya zhe na //
translated: How is it to be brought within?

original: mthong ba dang ni reg pa dang // thos pa dang ni dran pa yis //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mthong ba dang ni reg pa dang // thos pa dang ni dran pa yis // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: By seeing, touching, hearing, and remembering,üîΩBy seeing, from Rupavajra to Spar≈õavajra; by hearing, from ≈öabdaravajra; and by remembering, from Dharmadhara.

original: @359b mthong ba gzugs rdo rje ma nas reg bya rdo rje ma'i bar du thos pa sgra rdo rje ma dang / dran pa chos kyi rdo rje ma las ma rmongs pa dran pa'i 'du byed sngon nyams su myong ba'i don to //
analyzed: @359b mthong ba gzugs rdo rje ma nas reg bya rdo rje ma'i bar du thos pa sgra rdo rje ma dang / dran pa chos kyi rdo rje ma las ma rmongs pa dran pa'i 'du byed sngon nyams su myong ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the experience of the formations of mindfulness that is not confused is that the mind is brought within.

original: de la yid nang du chud pa rtog pa med pa skyes pas rtog pa las grol bar 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: de la yid nang du chud pa rtog pa med pa skyes pas rtog pa las grol bar 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: When the non-conceptual mind arises, one is liberated from conceptuality.

original: yid phyir byung nas rtog pa skyes na dang ba'i dad pas gzugs rdo rje ma la sgos pas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mchod par byed pa /
analyzed: yid phyir byung nas rtog pa skyes na dang ba'i dad pas gzugs rdo rje ma la sgos pas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mchod par byed pa /
translated: Or, when the mind comes out and conceptuality arises, one makes offerings to the buddhas and bodhisattvas by means of clear faith in Rupavajra and so on.

original: de ltar grol ba'i lam 'di la yang the tshom med par mchod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar grol ba'i lam 'di la yang the tshom med par mchod par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, one makes offerings without doubt on this path of liberation.

original: de'i phan yon gsungs pa ni yid nang du chud pas /
analyzed: de'i phan yon gsungs pa ni yid nang du chud pas /
translated: The benefits of that are stated:

original: rnal 'byor pa nyid bsod nams mchog / dag byed sdig pa 'jig byed pa //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa nyid bsod nams mchog / dag byed sdig pa 'jig byed pa //
translated: The yogi himself is the supreme merit, the purifier, the destroyer of evil.

original: bsod nams mchog gi rtog pa med pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs dgu'o //
analyzed: bsod nams mchog gi rtog pa med pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs dgu'o //
translated: The supreme merit is the accumulation of the wisdom of non-conceptualization.

original: dag ni rgyu kun 'byung dag pa'o //
analyzed: dag ni rgyu kun 'byung dag pa'o //
translated: Purifier is the purification of the cause, the origin.

original: sdig pa 'jig pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa 'jig pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zad pa'o //
translated: Destroyer of evil is the exhaustion of the truth of suffering.

original: gal te yid phyir 'byung ba la bsod nams kyi tshogs su gyur pa ni /
analyzed: gal te yid phyir 'byung ba la bsod nams kyi tshogs su gyur pa ni /
translated: If the mind is turned away, the accumulation of merit is

original: gsang sngags zlos pa'i bzlas brjod dang // bsam gtan gyis kyang 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: gsang sngags zlos pa'i bzlas brjod dang // bsam gtan gyis kyang 'grub par 'gyur //

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /

analyzed: gsang sngags zlos pa'i dus drug tu ris drug gi bzlas pa zlos pa'o //

analyzed: bzlas brjod ni dbugs 'byung rngub kyi bzlas pa'o //

original: bsam gtan ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang rnam snang dang padma gar dbang dang he ru ka dang rdo rje nyi ma dang rta mchog gi ting nge 'dzin bsgoms nas dus drug tu bdud rtsi rnam pa drug mya ngan grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang rnam snang dang padma gar dbang dang he ru ka dang rdo rje nyi ma dang rta mchog gi ting nge 'dzin bsgoms nas dus drug tu bdud rtsi rnam pa drug mya ngan grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Meditation is the cultivation of the samadhis of Vajrasattva, Vairocana, Padmanarteshvara, Heruka, Vajrasurya, and Hayagriva, and the six nectars are tasted in the six times.

original: kyang zhes pa ni yid nang du chud pa las phyir 'byung ba yang bsod nams kyi tshogs su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: kyang zhes pa ni yid nang du chud pa las phyir 'byung ba yang bsod nams kyi tshogs su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that even the emergence of the mind from within is the accumulation of merit.

original: de skad du yang rdo rje mkha' 'gro las /
analyzed: de skad du yang rdo rje mkha' 'gro las /
translated: Thus, the Vajradaka says:

original: tho rangs dgun smad gyur pa na //
analyzed: tho rangs dgun smad gyur pa na //
translated: At dawn, in the last month of winter,

original: dpyid dang dbyar ni nyi cha gnyis //
analyzed: dpyid dang dbyar ni nyi cha gnyis //
translated: in spring and summer, in the two fortnights,

original: nyin phyed mkhas pas sogs ka sbyar //üîΩsrod ni de bzhin ston ka ste //üîΩdgun stod mtshan phyed cha yin no //
analyzed: nyin phyed mkhas pas sogs ka sbyar // srod ni de bzhin ston ka ste // dgun stod mtshan phyed cha yin no //
translated: at midday, the wise one should apply the first.üîΩIn the evening, it is autumn,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: and in the first month of winter, it is midnight.

original: rdo rje 'di rnams kyi rang bzhin shes par byas la rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa dang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje 'di rnams kyi rang bzhin shes par byas la rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa dang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Having understood the nature of these vajras, one should apply them to Vajrasattva and so forth.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dgun smad de //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dgun smad de //
translated: Vajrasattva is the last month of winter,

analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: mi 'chi bcu phyed ni bdud rtsi lngas dri ma med pa'i de kho na nyid dang / 'dod pa'i dbang phyug gi de kho na nyid dang / tshe 'phel ba'i de kho na nyid du grub pas na dngos grub thams cad grub ces bshad do //
analyzed: mi 'chi bcu phyed ni bdud rtsi lngas dri ma med pa'i de kho na nyid dang / 'dod pa'i dbang phyug gi de kho na nyid dang / tshe 'phel ba'i de kho na nyid du grub pas na dngos grub thams cad grub ces bshad do //
translated: Since the half-death of the immortal is established as the reality of the five nectars, the reality of the lord of desire, and the reality of increasing life, it is explained as the accomplishment of all powers.

original: de ltar zhi ba'i btung ba bshad nas da ni pho nya'i gtsang sbra bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhi ba'i btung ba bshad nas da ni pho nya'i gtsang sbra bshad par bya ste /
translated: Having explained the peaceful drink in this way, now the purity of the messenger should be explained.

original: mchod bzhi rnal 'byor ma /
analyzed: mchod bzhi rnal 'byor ma /
translated: The four offerings are the yoginƒ´s.

original: dbang gnyis snyoms par 'jug pa yi //
analyzed: dbang gnyis snyoms par 'jug pa yi //
translated: The two initiations are the union.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: mchod bzhi ni dpes ston pa yin te /üîΩdung can ma dang padma can la sogs pa'i las kyi phyag rgya dang / yid du 'ong ba'i yul chos kyi phyag rgya dang / sbyor ba legs pa'i gtum mo me drod can dang / mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i stong pa nyid kyi phyag rgya chen po las bde ba zag pa med pa de bzhin du tha mal pa las kyi phyag rgya'i rnal 'byor ma la yang bsnyen sgrub bzhis sbyangs pa'i sa chu gnyis kyi pha rol me rlung gnyis kyi tshu
analyzed: mchod bzhi ni dpes ston pa yin te / dung can ma dang padma can la sogs pa'i las kyi phyag rgya dang / yid du 'ong ba'i yul chos kyi phyag rgya dang / sbyor ba legs pa'i gtum mo me drod can dang / mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i stong pa nyid kyi phyag rgya chen po las bde ba zag pa med pa de bzhin du tha mal pa las kyi phyag rgya'i rnal 'byor ma la yang bsnyen sgrub bzhis sbyangs pa'i sa chu gnyis kyi pha rol me rlung gnyis kyi tshu
translated: The four mudras are illustrated by the following analogies.üîΩThe analogy for the karma mudra is a conch shell or lotus.üîΩThe analogy for the dharma mudra is a pleasing object.üîΩThe analogy for the gnosis mudra is the blazing of the ca·πá·∏çƒÅlƒ´ fire.üîΩThe analogy for the mahƒÅmudrƒÅ is the direct perception of emptiness.üîΩIn the same way, the yoga of the ordinary karma mudra consort is the nonconceptual bliss that arises from the union of the central channel and the vƒÅyu of space, which is in the middle between the two vƒÅyus of fire and air, which are on the other side of the two vƒÅyus of earth and water, which are purified by the four sessions of approach and accomplishment.üîΩThe nonconceptual bliss that arises from the union of the two vƒÅyus of fire and air, which are on the other side of the two vƒÅyus of earth and water, which are purified by the four sessions of approach and accomplishment, is the nonconceptual bliss that arises from the union of the two vƒÅyus of fire and air, which are on the other side of the two vƒÅyus of earth and water, which are purified by the four sessions of approach and accomplishment.üîΩThe nonconceptual bliss that arises from the union of the two vƒÅyus of fire and air, which are on the other side of the two vƒÅyus of earth and water, which are purified by the four sessions of approach and accomplishment, is the nonconceptual bliss that arises from the union of the two vƒÅyus of fire and air, which are on the other side of the two vƒÅyus of earth and water, which are purified by the four sessions of approach and accomplishment.

original: rol na dbus ma nam mkha'i rlung dang kha sbyar nas bde ba rtog pa med pa ni rgyu rkyen gyi tshogs pa las skyes la bla ma'i gdams ngag mngon sum gyi gzhan don la ni reg bya stong pa nyid du rtogs pas rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum skye
analyzed: rol na dbus ma nam mkha'i rlung dang kha sbyar nas bde ba rtog pa med pa ni rgyu rkyen gyi tshogs pa las skyes la bla ma'i gdams ngag mngon sum gyi gzhan don la ni reg bya stong pa nyid du rtogs pas rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum skye
translated: The nonconceptual bliss that arises from the union of the two vƒÅyus of fire and air, which are on the other side of the two vƒÅyus of earth and water, which are purified by the four sessions of approach and accomplishment, is the nonconceptual bliss that arises from the union of the two vƒÅyus of fire and air, which are on the other side of the two vƒÅyus of earth and water, which are purified by the four sessions of approach and accomplishment.

original: ste / de nyid zag pa med pa'i bde ba shes rab ye shes yin pas /
analyzed: ste / de nyid zag pa med pa'i bde ba shes rab ye shes yin pas /
translated: That is the uncontaminated bliss, the wisdom exalted wisdom.

original: dbang gnyis snyoms par 'jug pa yi //üîΩsnyoms par 'jug pa'ang de nyid 'dzin //
analyzed: dbang gnyis snyoms par 'jug pa yi // snyoms par 'jug pa'ang de nyid 'dzin //
translated: The union of the two initiations

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is also the retention of reality.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa dang pos ni rtog pa med pa zhi gnas skye la /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa dang pos ni rtog pa med pa zhi gnas skye la /
translated: The first union is the arising of non-conceptual serenity.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis pas ni reg bya yul gyi stong pa'i de kho na nyid 'dzin cing rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis pas ni reg bya yul gyi stong pa'i de kho na nyid 'dzin cing rtogs pa'o //
translated: The second union is the retention and realization of the reality of the emptiness of the object of touch.

original: 'byung ba bzhi'i dbus ma nam mkha'i rtsa dang sprad pa las ji ltar bde ba skye zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhi'i dbus ma nam mkha'i rtsa dang sprad pa las ji ltar bde ba skye zhe na /
translated: How does bliss arise from the union of the central channel of the four elements and the space element?

original: mnyam sbyor las /üîΩsgyu ma dag ni thams cad las //
analyzed: mnyam sbyor las / sgyu ma dag ni thams cad las //
translated: The Union with Buddha states:üîΩAmong all illusions

original: bud med sgyu ma khyad par 'phags //üîΩzhes @362a * //
analyzed: bud med sgyu ma khyad par 'phags // zhes @362a * //
translated: the illusion of a woman is supreme.

original: gsungs te / de la stong pa nyid ji ltar rtogs she na /üîΩbla mas slob ma'i rna drung du //üîΩrab tu 'bad de bklag par bya //
analyzed: gsungs te / de la stong pa nyid ji ltar rtogs she na / bla mas slob ma'i rna drung du // rab tu 'bad de bklag par bya //
translated: How is emptiness realized?üîΩThe guru should read this

original: zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas /
translated: in the disciple's ear with great effort.

original: bla ma'i tshig gis stong pa nyid las dran pa'i nges pa drangs nas aa sams  ma zhes te nges pa'i shes pa mngon sum gyis zlos kar byed pa ni man ngag yin no //
analyzed: bla ma'i tshig gis stong pa nyid las dran pa'i nges pa drangs nas aa sams  ma zhes te nges pa'i shes pa mngon sum gyis zlos kar byed pa ni man ngag yin no //
translated: The instruction is that, having been inspired by the words of the guru, one should repeat the ascertainment of emptiness with mindfulness, and should make the ascertainment of the direct perception of the consciousness of emptiness.

original: de'i phan yon ni /
analyzed: de'i phan yon ni /
translated: The benefits of that are:

original: lha dang mi yi bde ba ni //üîΩbsdus byas rdo rje 'dzin pa yi //
analyzed: lha dang mi yi bde ba ni // bsdus byas rdo rje 'dzin pa yi //
translated: The bliss of gods and humans

original: bcu drug char yang mi phod do //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bcu drug char yang mi phod do // zhes gsungs te /
translated: does not approach one-sixteenthüîΩof the bliss of the compounded vajra holder.

original: lha ni tshangs pa dang brgya byin la sogs pa'i bsam gtan gyi bde ba'o //
analyzed: lha ni tshangs pa dang brgya byin la sogs pa'i bsam gtan gyi bde ba'o //
translated: The bliss of gods is the bliss of concentration of Brahma, Indra, and so forth.

original: mi ni mkhas pa rnams kyis rjes dpag gis stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i yid bde ba bsdus kyang mngon sum gyi bde ba zag pa med pa nyid kyi bcu drug char yang mi phod pa'o //
analyzed: mi ni mkhas pa rnams kyis rjes dpag gis stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i yid bde ba bsdus kyang mngon sum gyi bde ba zag pa med pa nyid kyi bcu drug char yang mi phod pa'o //
translated: The bliss of humans is the bliss of the inferential understanding of emptiness by the wise. Even if it is compounded, it does not approach one-sixteenth of the uncompounded bliss of the direct perception of the consciousness of emptiness.

original: de yang rdo rje mkha' 'gro las //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje mkha' 'gro las //
translated: Moreover, the Vajradaka says:

original: rtsa bcu drug la brten pa'i khams bcu drug / gtum mo drod kyis bzhu nas bde ba zag pa med pa gcig tu shes pas bsgril ba'i rtsa'i skud pa gcig gi bde ba stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i char yang mi phod pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa bcu drug la brten pa'i khams bcu drug / gtum mo drod kyis bzhu nas bde ba zag pa med pa gcig tu shes pas bsgril ba'i rtsa'i skud pa gcig gi bde ba stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i char yang mi phod pa'o //
translated: The sixteen channels based on the sixteen parts of the body, and the sixteen elements based on the sixteen parts of the body, are melted by the heat of the fierce fire, and are recognized as a single, undefiled bliss.

original: de ltar tshogs kyi 'khor lo dang zhi ba'i btung ba dang pho nya'i gtsang sbra bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar tshogs kyi 'khor lo dang zhi ba'i btung ba dang pho nya'i gtsang sbra bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the feast circle, the peaceful drink, and the messenger's purification,üîΩin the mountain caves, in the thickets, in the caves,üîΩon the banks of the rivers,

original: ri sul tshang tshing phug rnams dang // chu bo dag gi ngogs dag dang // gdod nas grub pa'i dur khrod du //
analyzed: ri sul tshang tshing phug rnams dang // chu bo dag gi ngogs dag dang // gdod nas grub pa'i dur khrod du //
translated: in the primordial charnel grounds,

original: der ni dkyil 'khor bri bar bya //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: der ni dkyil 'khor bri bar bya // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: there one should draw the mandala.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'i gnas bzhi ni bum pa'i dbang bskur ba'i gzugs brnyan gyi dkyil 'khor gyi rten yin no //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'i gnas bzhi ni bum pa'i dbang bskur ba'i gzugs brnyan gyi dkyil 'khor gyi rten yin no //
translated: The four literal locations are the supports of the reflected mandala of the vase empowerment.

original: dbyibs kyi dbang du byas na ri sul ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo //
analyzed: dbyibs kyi dbang du byas na ri sul ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo //
translated: In terms of shape, the mountain cave is the great bliss cakra.

original: chang tshing phug ni longs spyod kyi 'khor lo /
analyzed: chang tshing phug ni longs spyod kyi 'khor lo /
translated: The thicket cave is the enjoyment cakra.

original: chu bo'i ngogs ni chos kyi 'khor lo //
analyzed: chu bo'i ngogs ni chos kyi 'khor lo //
translated: The riverbank is the wheel of Dharma.

original: dur khrod ni sprul pa'i 'khor lo ste lus kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dur khrod ni sprul pa'i 'khor lo ste lus kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The charnel ground is the wheel of emanation, the body mandala.

original: sngags kyi dbang du byas na ri sul ni lo bcu gnyis ma tshang tshing phug ni bcu drug ma dang / chu bo'i ngogs ni nyi shu ma dang / dur khrod ni rtsa bzhi ma ste bha ga'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: sngags kyi dbang du byas na ri sul ni lo bcu gnyis ma tshang tshing phug ni bcu drug ma dang / chu bo'i ngogs ni nyi shu ma dang / dur khrod ni rtsa bzhi ma ste bha ga'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: In terms of mantra, the mountain is the twelve-year-old, the thicket is the sixteen-year-old, the riverbank is the twenty-year-old, and the charnel ground is the twenty-four-year-old, the bhaga mandala.

original: chos kyi dbang du byas na ri bo ni stong pa nyid dang tshang tshing phug ni mtshan ma med pa dang / chu bo ni smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbang du byas na ri bo ni stong pa nyid dang tshang tshing phug ni mtshan ma med pa dang / chu bo ni smon pa med pa'o //
translated: In terms of Dharma, the mountain is emptiness, the thicket is signlessness, and the riverbank is wishlessness.

original: dur khrod ni 'od gsal te /
analyzed: dur khrod ni 'od gsal te /
translated: The charnel ground is luminosity.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: This is the mandala of the dharmadhatu.

original: de skad du yang rgyud bla ma las /
analyzed: de skad du yang rgyud bla ma las /
translated: Thus it is said in the Uttaratantra:üîΩThe mandala called ‚Äúbody‚Äù

original: dkyil 'khor @362b lus zhes bya ba dang // dkyil 'khor bha ga zhes su bshad //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor @362b lus zhes bya ba dang // dkyil 'khor bha ga zhes su bshad //
translated: and the mandala called ‚Äúbhaga‚Äù

original: dkyil 'khor chos kyi dbyings yin te //üîΩrnam pa gsum du nges pa yin //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chos kyi dbyings yin te // rnam pa gsum du nges pa yin //
translated: are the mandala of the dharmadhatu.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: They are ascertained as being of three kinds.

original: le'u dang po'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u dang po'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the first chapter.

original: // / de ltar rdzogs pa'i rim pa bshad nas bskyed pa'i rim pa'i 'khor lo gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: // / de ltar rdzogs pa'i rim pa bshad nas bskyed pa'i rim pa'i 'khor lo gsungs pa ni /
translated: Having explained the completion stage, the wheel of the generation stage is taught.

original: de nas lci ba ma lhung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: de nas lci ba ma lhung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: It is taught beginning from ‚ÄúThen, not letting the feces fall down,‚Äù and so on.

original: de la le'u gnyis pas ni slob dpon gyi las bshad pa dang / le'u gsum pas slob ma'i las bshad pa dang / le'u bzhi pas lha dgod pa bshad nas bskyed pa'i rim par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de la le'u gnyis pas ni slob dpon gyi las bshad pa dang / le'u gsum pas slob ma'i las bshad pa dang / le'u bzhi pas lha dgod pa bshad nas bskyed pa'i rim par gyur pa yin no //
translated: In that regard, the second chapter explains the activities of the master, the third chapter explains the activities of the disciples, and the fourth chapter explains the arrangement of the deities.

original: de la thog mar gtsang sbra gsum gyis rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i bsnyen pa byas nas dkyil 'khor bri ba'am /
analyzed: de la thog mar gtsang sbra gsum gyis rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i bsnyen pa byas nas dkyil 'khor bri ba'am /
translated: To begin with, having performed the approach of the completion stage with the three purities, one should draw the ma·πá·∏çala.

original: yang na phyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bsnyen pa la ltos nas bskyed rim gyis bsnyen pa ma gsungs so //
analyzed: yang na phyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bsnyen pa la ltos nas bskyed rim gyis bsnyen pa ma gsungs so //
translated: Alternatively, since the approach will be explained later, the approach of the generation stage is not mentioned.

original: de yang rgyud bla ma las /
analyzed: de yang rgyud bla ma las /
translated: Moreover, it says in the Uttaratantra:

original: gtsang sbra gsum gyis bsnyen pa byas nas dkyil 'khor bri zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gtsang sbra gsum gyis bsnyen pa byas nas dkyil 'khor bri zhes gsungs so //
translated: Having performed the approach with the three purities, draw the ma·πá·∏çala.

original: sa'i cho ga ci'i phyir ma gsungs she na /
analyzed: sa'i cho ga ci'i phyir ma gsungs she na /
translated: Why is the earth ritual not mentioned?

original: bshad pa'i rgyud la ltos pa'am sbyang mi dgos pa'i dbang du mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud la ltos pa'am sbyang mi dgos pa'i dbang du mdzad pa yin no //
translated: This is from the point of view of the explanatory tantras, or from the point of view of not needing to purify.

original: bsnyen pa dang sa'i cho ga'i rjes la dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan nyid bshad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: bsnyen pa dang sa'i cho ga'i rjes la dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan nyid bshad par bzhed nas /
translated: After the section on the preliminary and the ground ritual, in order to explain the characteristics of the ma·πá·∏çala, [the tantra] states:üîΩSmear the ma·πá·∏çala ground

original: ba yi lci ba ma lhung bas //üîΩdkyil 'khor sa ni legs par byug / ces gsungs te /
analyzed: ba yi lci ba ma lhung bas // dkyil 'khor sa ni legs par byug / ces gsungs te /
translated: with cow dung that has not fallen to the ground.

original: ba'i rnam lngas byugs pa ni rgyud sde bzhi'i thun mong yin no //
analyzed: ba'i rnam lngas byugs pa ni rgyud sde bzhi'i thun mong yin no //
translated: Smearing with the five cow products is common to all four classes of tantra.

original: khyad par du rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud las dur khrod kyi thal ba dang bdud rtsi rnam pa lngas byugs nas dkyil 'khor rtsom par bstan to //
analyzed: khyad par du rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud las dur khrod kyi thal ba dang bdud rtsi rnam pa lngas byugs nas dkyil 'khor rtsom par bstan to //
translated: In particular, the Yoginƒ´ Tantras teach that after smearing with charnel ground ash and the five elixirs, one should begin the ma·πá·∏çala.

original: dur khrod kyi thal ba dang mi gtsang bas ci zhig byed ce na /
analyzed: dur khrod kyi thal ba dang mi gtsang bas ci zhig byed ce na /
translated: What is the purpose of charnel ground ash and filth?

original: shi ba dang ma shi ba dang gtsang ba dang mi gtsang bar ro mnyam par ston par bzhad pa yin no //
analyzed: shi ba dang ma shi ba dang gtsang ba dang mi gtsang bar ro mnyam par ston par bzhad pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that one should be equal in taste with regard to the dead and the living, the pure and the impure.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan nyid bshad nas /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan nyid bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the characteristics of the ma·πá·∏çala,

original: tshon gyi mtshan nyid bshad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: tshon gyi mtshan nyid bshad par bzhed nas /
translated: in order to explain the characteristics of the colors, [the tantra] states:

original: dur khrod du ni kun spyod pa //
analyzed: dur khrod du ni kun spyod pa //
translated: One should practice in the charnel ground,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so forth.

original: kun spyod pa ni mnyam par spyod pa ste rin po che dang tshon rtsi dang dur khrod kyi rdzas la dbye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: kun spyod pa ni mnyam par spyod pa ste rin po che dang tshon rtsi dang dur khrod kyi rdzas la dbye ba med pa'o //
translated: Practice means equal practice, without distinction of precious substances, colors, and charnel ground substances.

original: ro bsregs pa'i sol ba'i phye ma dang / zhes bya ba ni rus pa'i phye ma dkar po dang / sol ba'i phye @363a * //üîΩma nag po'o //üîΩdur khrod so phag ldan pa yi //
analyzed: ro bsregs pa'i sol ba'i phye ma dang / zhes bya ba ni rus pa'i phye ma dkar po dang / sol ba'i phye @363a * // ma nag po'o // dur khrod so phag ldan pa yi //
translated: The ashes of a cremation are the white bone powder and the black charcoal powder.

original: zhes bya bas mtshos pa las ser po dang / tshos pa las dmar po'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas mtshos pa las ser po dang / tshos pa las dmar po'o //
translated: The charnel ground brick is the yellow from the unbaked and the red from the baked.

original: ljang gu ni rus pa dang tshon ljang gu bsres pa'o //
analyzed: ljang gu ni rus pa dang tshon ljang gu bsres pa'o //
translated: The green is the bones mixed with green dye.

original: dkyil 'khor bzang po bri bar bya //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bzang po bri bar bya //
translated: One should draw the excellent ma·πá·∏çala.

original: zhes bya ba ni drag po 'jigs byed zhe sdang chen pos 'dul bas na bzang po'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni drag po 'jigs byed zhe sdang chen pos 'dul bas na bzang po'o //
translated: Since Rudra is tamed by the great wrath of Bhairava, he is excellent.

original: snying stobs rdul dang mun pas kyang //
analyzed: snying stobs rdul dang mun pas kyang //
translated: Since sattva, rajas, and tamas

original: gang phyir sems can don 'gyur bas //
analyzed: gang phyir sems can don 'gyur bas //
translated: are for the sake of sentient beings,

original: des na 'di ni bzang po ste //
analyzed: des na 'di ni bzang po ste //
translated: therefore, this is excellent.

original: byang chub spyod pa'i rjes 'jug pa'i //
analyzed: byang chub spyod pa'i rjes 'jug pa'i //
translated: The one who follows the conduct of enlightenment

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is the one who should be known as the master.

original: de ltar tshon gyi mtshan nyid bstan nas ;
analyzed: de ltar tshon gyi mtshan nyid bstan nas ;
translated: Having thus taught the characteristics of the colors,

original: slob dpon gyi mtshan nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi mtshan nyid ston pa ni /
translated: the characteristics of the master are taught.

original: slob dpon mtshan nyid thams cad pa //
analyzed: slob dpon mtshan nyid thams cad pa //
translated: The master has all the characteristics,

original: yang dag shes shing rgyud shes pa //
analyzed: yang dag shes shing rgyud shes pa //
translated: knows reality, and knows the tantras.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: And so forth.

original: mtshan nyid thams cad ni rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid thams cad ni rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: All the characteristics are the perfection of one's own and others' goals.

original: yang dag shes ni rgyud sde bzhi'i lta ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag shes ni rgyud sde bzhi'i lta ba shes pa'o //
translated: Knowing reality is knowing the view of the four classes of tantras.

original: rgyud shes pa ni rgyud sde bzhi'i spyod pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud shes pa ni rgyud sde bzhi'i spyod pa shes pa'o //

analyzed: sgrub po gal te dngos grub 'dod //
translated: The adept, if he desires power,

original: ces bya ba ni dngos grub len pa'i tshe las kyi phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pas /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni dngos grub len pa'i tshe las kyi phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pas /
translated: means that at the time of taking power, he enters into union with the karma consort.

original: gnyis med dpa' bo mchod par bya //
analyzed: gnyis med dpa' bo mchod par bya //
translated: Worship the nondual hero.

original: zhes bya'o // 'dir ni rjes 'jug rnal 'byor pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gzugs brnyan bri ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // 'dir ni rjes 'jug rnal 'byor pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gzugs brnyan bri ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, it is stated for the sake of the subsequent yogi/nis that the image is drawn.

original: sngon nas sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i 'khor los sku'i sgo nas chos ston par mdzad pa'i tshe na byang chub sems dpa' sa'i snying pos thod pa'i phreng ba'i sangs rgyas lnga ni 'byung ba lnga'o //
analyzed: sngon nas sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i 'khor los sku'i sgo nas chos ston par mdzad pa'i tshe na byang chub sems dpa' sa'i snying pos thod pa'i phreng ba'i sangs rgyas lnga ni 'byung ba lnga'o //
translated: When the Buddha's emanation wheel previously taught the Dharma through the door of the body, the bodhisattva K·π£itigarbha said, The five buddhas of the garland of skulls are the five elements.

original: spyi gtsug gi rtsa lnga dang spyan gsum dang zhal bzhi lkog ma longs spyod kyi 'khor lo'i rtsa bzhi dang / phyag bcu gnyis kyi rtsa lhag ma bcu gnyis dang / phyag drug gis dbang po drug gi rtsa dang / g-yas brkyang bas bshang gci gnyis kyi rtsa mtshon pas ma 'ongs pa'i rnal 'byor bas rtsa'i 'khor lo bsgom mo zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi gtsug gi rtsa lnga dang spyan gsum dang zhal bzhi lkog ma longs spyod kyi 'khor lo'i rtsa bzhi dang / phyag bcu gnyis kyi rtsa lhag ma bcu gnyis dang / phyag drug gis dbang po drug gi rtsa dang / g-yas brkyang bas bshang gci gnyis kyi rtsa mtshon pas ma 'ongs pa'i rnal 'byor bas rtsa'i 'khor lo bsgom mo zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: The five channels at the crown, the three eyes, the four faces, the four channels of the enjoyment chakra at the throat, the twelve remaining channels of the twelve arms, the six channels of the six faces, and the two channels of feces and urine of the right leg extended are taught to be the channels of the chakras that future yogins should meditate on.

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi dbang du byas na thod pa lnga ni spyi gtsug gi 'khor lo'i rlung lnga mtshon pa dang / spyan gsum ni rlung gsum dang / zhal bzhi ni lkog ma'i rlung bzhi dang / phyag bcu gnyis kyis lkog ma'i rlung bcu gnyis dang /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi dbang du byas na thod pa lnga ni spyi gtsug gi 'khor lo'i rlung lnga mtshon pa dang / spyan gsum ni rlung gsum dang / zhal bzhi ni lkog ma'i rlung bzhi dang / phyag bcu gnyis kyis lkog ma'i rlung bcu gnyis dang /
translated: In terms of Avalokite≈õvara, the five skulls indicate the five winds of the crown chakra, the three eyes the three winds, the four faces the four winds of the throat, the twelve arms the twelve winds of the throat,

original: phyag drug @367a * //
analyzed: phyag drug @367a * //
translated: the six faces the six sense winds,

original: ni dbang po drug gi rlung dang / zhabs gnyis kyis bshang gci gnyis kyi rlung 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: ni dbang po drug gi rlung dang / zhabs gnyis kyis bshang gci gnyis kyi rlung 'gog pa'o //
translated: and the two legs the blocking of the two winds of feces and urine.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyi dbang du byas na thod pa lnga ni ye shes lnga dang / zhal bzhi ni ye shes bzhi dang / spyan gsum rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / phyag bcu gnyis pha rol tu phyin pa bcu gnyis dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyi dbang du byas na thod pa lnga ni ye shes lnga dang / zhal bzhi ni ye shes bzhi dang / spyan gsum rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / phyag bcu gnyis pha rol tu phyin pa bcu gnyis dang /
translated: In terms of the bodhisattva Manjushri, the five skulls are the five pristine awarenesses, the four faces are the four pristine awarenesses, the three eyes are the three doors of liberation, the twelve arms are the twelve perfections,

original: phyag rgya drug pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / zhabs gnyis srid pa dang zhi ba la mi gnas pa dang / stag gi pags pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral ba dang / mi mgo lnga bcu rtsa gcig ni 'du byed lnga bcu rtsa gcig rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya drug pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / zhabs gnyis srid pa dang zhi ba la mi gnas pa dang / stag gi pags pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral ba dang / mi mgo lnga bcu rtsa gcig ni 'du byed lnga bcu rtsa gcig rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: the six symbolic implements are the six perfections, the two legs are not abiding in existence or peace, the tiger skin is free from afflictive and cognitive obscurations, and the fifty-one human heads are the fifty-one mental formations.

original: de ltar yang kha sbyor las bshad pas the tshom mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang kha sbyor las bshad pas the tshom mi bya'o //
translated: Since this is explained in the Samputa Tantra, do not doubt it.

original: bum pa bzhi ni ye shes bzhi dang / stong pa nyid bzhi dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes thugs kyi 'khor lor snang ba dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes gsung gi 'khor lor snang ba dang / me long lta bu sku'i 'khor lor snang ba dang /
analyzed: bum pa bzhi ni ye shes bzhi dang / stong pa nyid bzhi dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes thugs kyi 'khor lor snang ba dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes gsung gi 'khor lor snang ba dang / me long lta bu sku'i 'khor lor snang ba dang /
translated: The four vases are the four pristine consciousnesses, the four emptinesses, the pristine consciousness of the dharmadhatu appearing as the wheel of mind, the pristine consciousness of discernment appearing as the wheel of speech, the mirror-like pristine consciousness appearing as the wheel of body,üîΩand the wheel of activities appearing as the wheel of perseverance.üîΩThe five walls appear as the five pristine consciousnesses, the four doors appear as the four gates of liberation, the four meditative concentrations appear as the four pediments, the eight charnel grounds appear as the eight buddhafields,

original: phrin las kyi 'khor lor bya ba nan tan gyi 'khor lo dang / rtsig pa lnga ye shes lngar snang ba dang / sgo bzhi rnam par thar pa bzhir snang ba dang / bsam gtan bzhi rta babs bzhir snang ba dang / dur khrod brgyad ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing khams brgyad du snang ba dang /
analyzed: phrin las kyi 'khor lor bya ba nan tan gyi 'khor lo dang / rtsig pa lnga ye shes lngar snang ba dang / sgo bzhi rnam par thar pa bzhir snang ba dang / bsam gtan bzhi rta babs bzhir snang ba dang / dur khrod brgyad ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing khams brgyad du snang ba dang /
translated: and the four continents appear as the four immeasurables.

original: shing brgyad byang chub kyi shing brgyad dang / klu brgyad yon gyi bdag po brgyad dang / phyogs skyong brgyad rnam par gzigs la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas brgyad dang / pho nya brgyad nyan thos brgyad dang / sprin brgyad mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshul ston pa'i rang rgyal ba brgyad dang /
analyzed: shing brgyad byang chub kyi shing brgyad dang / klu brgyad yon gyi bdag po brgyad dang / phyogs skyong brgyad rnam par gzigs la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas brgyad dang / pho nya brgyad nyan thos brgyad dang / sprin brgyad mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshul ston pa'i rang rgyal ba brgyad dang /
translated: The eight trees are the eight bodhi trees, the eight nƒÅgas are the eight lords of gifts, the eight directional guardians are the eight buddhas such as Vipa≈õyin, the eight messengers are the eight ≈õrƒÅvakas, and the eight clouds are the eight pratyekabuddhas who demonstrate the mode of nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: tshig pa dang ma tshig pa la sogs pa brgyad ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgyad de /
analyzed: tshig pa dang ma tshig pa la sogs pa brgyad ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgyad de /
translated: The eight [topics] such as burned and unburned are the eight buddhafields.

original: de ltar na rnam par gzigs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi theg pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo brgyad kyis mtha' bskor ba'i dbus na 'khor lo bde mchog bzhugs pa ni bstan pa'i snying po mngon sum gyi lam yin pas sa bcu gcig pa la thams cad kyang mngon
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par gzigs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi theg pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo brgyad kyis mtha' bskor ba'i dbus na 'khor lo bde mchog bzhugs pa ni bstan pa'i snying po mngon sum gyi lam yin pas sa bcu gcig pa la thams cad kyang mngon
translated: Thus, in the center surrounded by the eight wheels of dharma of the vehicles characterized by Vipa≈õyin and so on, Cakrasa·πÉvara resides. Since this is the path of direct perception, the essence of the teaching, all [buddhas] are directly perceived on the eleventh stage.

original: sum gyi lam 'khor lo bde mchog tu sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: sum gyi lam 'khor lo bde mchog tu sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning is that they are buddhas in the path of direct perception, Cakrasa·πÉvara.

original: rdo rjer ba ni rdo rje theg pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / me 'od ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i @367b sgrib pa bsreg go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rdo rjer ba ni rdo rje theg pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / me 'od ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i @367b sgrib pa bsreg go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The vajra-holder is the one who turns the wheel of the Dharma of the Vajra Vehicle, and the fire-light is the one who burns the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: de ltar lha dgod pa'i cho ga bstan nas dkyil 'khor bteg nas sta gon gyi lha dbab pa dang bsres te rdo rje dril bu dkrol zhing lan bdun bskor ba byas nas lhag pa dang ma tshang ba dang bskang par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de ltar lha dgod pa'i cho ga bstan nas dkyil 'khor bteg nas sta gon gyi lha dbab pa dang bsres te rdo rje dril bu dkrol zhing lan bdun bskor ba byas nas lhag pa dang ma tshang ba dang bskang par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: Having thus explained the ritual of arranging the deities, one should lift up the mandala, and having mixed it with the descent of the deities of the preliminary service, one should ring the vajra bell and circumambulate seven times, and then one should make offerings for whatever is lacking or incomplete. This is the remainder.

original: da ni bum pa gzhug par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: da ni bum pa gzhug par bya ba yin pas /
translated: Now, one should place the vase.

original: de nas bum pa bya ba ni //
analyzed: de nas bum pa bya ba ni //
translated: Then, the procedure for the vase

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so forth is stated.

original: bum pa'i rgyu rin po che'am sa las byas pa kha gyed pa gsus pa ldir ba mgrin pa phra ba mchu 'phyang ba la cho ga bya zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: rtsa ba la sogs nag nog med //
analyzed: rtsa ba la sogs nag nog med //
translated: Without impurities of root and so forth,

original: ces bya ba ni legs par bkrus nas dris byugs pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni legs par bkrus nas dris byugs pa'o //
translated: This means that one should wash well and anoint with perfume.üîΩPearl, gold, and jewels,

analyzed: mu tig gser dang rin chen dang / byi ru dngul dang zangs ma ste //
translated: coral, silver, and copper,

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rin po che ldan pa'i bum pa'i steng du bza' ba kun bkang ba'o //

analyzed: snod ni ldan pa'i bum pa'i steng du bza' ba kun bkang ba'o //

analyzed: mgrin pa srad bus dkris pa dang // zhes bya ba ni tshon sna lnga'i skud pa btags pa'o //

original: zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang ldan pas kha brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang ldan pas kha brgyan pa'o //
translated: This means that the mouth is adorned with fruits.

original: gos zung gis ni legs dkris pa ;
analyzed: gos zung gis ni legs dkris pa ;

original: ces bya ba ni rgyal ba dang bkra shis dang dngos grub dang rdzu 'phrul dang rgyal ba dang rnam par rgyal ba dang grub pa dang srung ba brgyad sgo bzhi dang mtshams bzhir dgod pa'o ;

translated: This is the eightfold victory, auspiciousness, accomplishment, magic, victory, complete victory, success, and protection, which are placed in the four doors and four corners.

analyzed: / gos zung gis ni legs dkris pa'o //

original: gser ram dngul lam rin chen nam //
analyzed: gser ram dngul lam rin chen nam //

original: de lta bu'i @368a * //
analyzed: de lta bu'i @368a * //
translated: Such a ma·πá·∏çala

analyzed: dri yi chu yis / de ltar bum pa bshad nas da ni mchod pa'i rdzas byin gyis brlab pa ni /

analyzed: bdag nyid kun nas bsgo ba yi //

analyzed: dri yi chu yis legs par gdab //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dpa' bo lnga'i shi'i snod brgya lha mor bskyed cing dbul pa'o //

translated: Thus it is said.

original: yon dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: yon dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Having invoked the gnosis being with the mudra of phe·πÉ phe·πÉ, one should offer the gift of worship as it occurs in the Vajra·∏çƒÅka Tantra, having praised with the one hundred and eight names of the ·∏çƒÅkinƒ´ that occur in the Vajra·∏çƒÅka Tantra, and having invited the gnosis being to the space in front with the mudra of the arrow.

translated: Having made the mudra of the womb, one should offer the gift of worship to the mind wheel, that is, to those abiding in the celestial realm, to the speech wheel, that is, to the sky-goers of the earth, to the body wheel, that is, to those abiding in the underworld, and to the twelve mƒÅt·πõkƒÅs abiding in the directions and intermediate directions.

translated: Then, having supplicated for the conferral of empowerment, one should bathe the image on the surface of a mirror, which is arranged with drops of water and flower-clusters, and one should confer empowerment on oneself.

analyzed: gal te dngos grub mchog 'dod na // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If one desires the supreme attainment,

original: nang gi sbyin sreg gi rdzas ni //
analyzed: nang gi sbyin sreg gi rdzas ni //
translated: The inner fire-offering substances are

translated: Having generated the one-faced, two-handed form, the gnosis being is caused to enter by the light rays of the eyes and the lines.

analyzed: sems dpa' bcug la mchod pa lngas mchod la /

translated: The supreme friend of practice is the syllable h≈´·πÉ and the breath of the nose. Having inhaled, extract it from the path of the secret vajra and place it in the form of Vajra H≈´·πÉkara.

original: de'i lag par dza: dza: zhes bya bas thig skud gtad la slob dpon shar du kha bltas te slob mas drangs la nub tu kha bltas pas tshangs pa'i thig dang por gdab par bya'o //

translated: In the hand of that [master], having given the thread with ja·∏• h≈´·πÉ va·πÉ ho·∏•, the master should face east, and the disciple should pull it, facing west. The first BrahmƒÅ line should be drawn.

translated: The master should face north and draw the second BrahmƒÅ line.üîΩThe master should remain in the south and, facing north, draw the eastern line.

original: slob dpon rlung du gnas nas lhor bltas te nub phyogs kyi thig gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon rlung du gnas nas lhor bltas te nub phyogs kyi thig gdab par bya'o //
translated: The master should remain in the west and, facing east, draw the southern line.

original: yang bskor nas de nyid du 'dug la shar du bltas nas byang du thig gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: yang bskor nas de nyid du 'dug la shar du bltas nas byang du thig gdab par bya'o //

analyzed: me'i phyogs su 'dug ste nub tu bltas te lho'i thig gdab par bya'o //
translated: Sitting in the direction of fire, facing west, one should lay down the southern line.

original: de bzhin du kha khyer dang mtshams kyi thig gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kha khyer dang mtshams kyi thig gdab par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should lay down the lines of the intermediate directions and the lines of the walls.

original: tshangs pa'i thig nas brtsams te cha bcu bdun panytsa re kh'a'i rtseg pa dang / nyi shu pa la sgo 'gram gyi rtsig pa dang / rtsa gsum pa la ya phubs kyi rtsig pa dang / rtsa bzhi pa la bcu gcig rdo rje dang sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bar gyis rta babs gdugs dang bcas pa rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i thig nas brtsams te cha bcu bdun panytsa re kh'a'i rtseg pa dang / nyi shu pa la sgo 'gram gyi rtsig pa dang / rtsa gsum pa la ya phubs kyi rtsig pa dang / rtsa bzhi pa la bcu gcig rdo rje dang sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bar gyis rta babs gdugs dang bcas pa rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: Beginning from the line of BrahmƒÅ, on the seventeenth part one should make the top of the arch, on the twentieth part the wall of the door frame, on the twenty-third part the wall of the pediment, and on the twenty-fourth part, up to the thirty-second part, one should complete the pediment with the canopy and the vajras.

original: sgo 'khor lo'i brgyad cha la sgo'i dbus nas brtsams nas gsum pa dang lnga pa la sgo khyud dang logs kyi rtsig pa bya'o //
analyzed: sgo 'khor lo'i brgyad cha la sgo'i dbus nas brtsams nas gsum pa dang lnga pa la sgo khyud dang logs kyi rtsig pa bya'o //
translated: The door is one-eighth of the circumference of the mandala. Beginning from the center of the door, on the third and fifth parts one should make the door frame and the wall of the side chambers.

original: de ltar zur bzhi pa'i thig rdzogs nas bdud rtsi 'khyil ba'i phur bu stod khro bo la smad rdo rje rtse gcig pa dbus su btab la de la srad bu nyis ldab tu btags nas tshangs pa'i thig nas brtsams te cha gsum ni padma /

translated: After completing the lines of the four corners in that way, one should drive in the dagger of Am·πõtaku·πá·∏çali, which is wrathful above and a single-pointed vajra below, in the center. Having tied a double thread to that, beginning from the line of BrahmƒÅ, one should draw three parts as a lotus.

original: cha gcig ni gri gug gam rin po ches bskor ba'o //
analyzed: cha gcig ni gri gug gam rin po ches bskor ba'o //
translated: One part is surrounded by a flaying knife or a jewel.

original: de'i phyi rol du cha gsum ni 'khor lo cha gcig rdo rje phreng bas bskor ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du cha gsum ni 'khor lo cha gcig rdo rje phreng bas bskor ba'o //
translated: Outside of that, three parts are a wheel, and one part is surrounded by a vajra garland.

original: de'i phyi rol du gsung gi 'khor lo cha gsum ni padmas bskor la /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du gsung gi 'khor lo cha gsum ni padmas bskor la /
translated: Outside of that, three parts of the wheel of enlightened speech are surrounded by lotuses.

analyzed: de'i phyi rol du sku'i 'khor lo cha gsum ni 'khor lo'i phreng bas bskor ba'o //
translated: Outside of that, three parts of the wheel of enlightened body are surrounded by a garland of wheels.

original: de'i phyi rol du @369b rdo rje ra ba me 'od rim pa gnyis thams cad kyi mtha' nas bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du @369b rdo rje ra ba me 'od rim pa gnyis thams cad kyi mtha' nas bskor bar bya'o //
translated: Outside of that, one should surround the vajra fence and the double row of flames with everything.

original: de ltar thig btab nas bar chad kyi bgegs bzlog pa'i phyir phyogs skyong la phur bus btab la tshon dgye bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar thig btab nas bar chad kyi bgegs bzlog pa'i phyir phyogs skyong la phur bus btab la tshon dgye bar bya'o //
translated: After having laid out the lines in that way, in order to avert obstructing hindrances, one should drive in the daggers of the directional guardians and lay out the colors.

original: yod cing 'byor na gser la sogs pa'i rin po che'am yang na bsres pa 'am tshon rtsi las byas pa dur khrod du rus pa'i phye ma las dkar po'o //
analyzed: yod cing 'byor na gser la sogs pa'i rin po che'am yang na bsres pa 'am tshon rtsi las byas pa dur khrod du rus pa'i phye ma las dkar po'o //
translated: If one has and is wealthy, one should make it with jewels such as gold, or else with a mixture or with colored powders.

original: thal ba las mag po dang / so phag tshos pa dang ma tshos pa las dmar po dang ser po /
analyzed: thal ba las mag po dang / so phag tshos pa dang ma tshos pa las dmar po dang ser po /
translated: In a charnel ground, one should make it with bone powder for white, with charcoal for black, with burnt brick for red, with burnt brick and unburnt brick for yellow,

analyzed: mi rus dang bsres pa'i ljang gu la rigs lnga'i sa bon bkod nas lhar bskyed de ye shes sems dpa' bcug ste mchod pa lngas mchod de /

original: aom badzra tsi tra sa ma ye h'um zhes bya bas sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pas yi ge hi: dang bcas pas gzi byin bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra tsi tra sa ma ye h'um zhes bya bas sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pas yi ge hi: dang bcas pas gzi byin bskyed par bya'o //
translated: With the mantra o·πÉ vajra-citra samaye h≈´·πÉ, one should recite the mantra one hundred and eight times, and with the syllable hi·∏• one should generate brilliance.

original: de nas thog mar slob dpon gyis sgo rnams phye la 'khor lo bris nas dbus kyi phur bu'i bu ga bkang la dbang ldan gyi mtshams su tshon gyi pra brtags nas slob mas kyang ci bde bar bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas thog mar slob dpon gyis sgo rnams phye la 'khor lo bris nas dbus kyi phur bu'i bu ga bkang la dbang ldan gyi mtshams su tshon gyi pra brtags nas slob mas kyang ci bde bar bri bar bya'o //

translated: As explained above, having arranged the five wheels, having arranged the seed syllables of the deities, or the hand implements, or the great seal of the body, one should draw them with the five colors, blue, yellow, red, green, and white.

original: rin chen pha gu dkar po /
analyzed: rin chen pha gu dkar po /
translated: The jeweled cornice is white.

original: dra ba dra phyed kyis nag po'o //

analyzed: shar du rta babs rdo rjes mtshan pa /
translated: In the east, one should draw a gateway marked with a vajra.

original: lhor rin po che /
analyzed: lhor rin po che /
translated: In the south, a jewel.üîΩIn the west, a lotus.

analyzed: nub tu padma dang / byang du sna tshogs rdo rjes mtshan pa'i rta babs bri bar bya'o //

translated: Having generated the sixty-two deities in the body, insert the gnosis being, and don the armor.üîΩHaving given the five permissions of the aural lineage, the five permissions of the victory over nonreturning, and the five permissions of all tantras, confer the vajra master empowerment.

original: pa dang me long bstan pa dang ye shes dang mda' gzhu gtad pas sprul pa 'gyed pa'i sku dang / dril bu gsung dang ; yang me long bstan pas thugs dang / rgyud thams cad kyi rjes su gnang ba rnam pa lnga dang / sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs dang /
analyzed: pa dang me long bstan pa dang ye shes dang mda' gzhu gtad pas sprul pa 'gyed pa'i sku dang / dril bu gsung dang ; yang me long bstan pas thugs dang / rgyud thams cad kyi rjes su gnang ba rnam pa lnga dang / sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs dang /
translated: Having given the five permissions of the aural lineage, the five permissions of the victory over nonreturning, and the five permissions of all tantras, confer the vajra master empowerment.

original: lung bstan pa dang / gzengs bstod pa dang / dbugs dbyung ba dang / rjes su gnang ba byin pa dang / yan lag bcu dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: lung bstan pa dang / gzengs bstod pa dang / dbugs dbyung ba dang / rjes su gnang ba byin pa dang / yan lag bcu dang ldan pa ste /

analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi dkyil 'khor la bum pa'i dbang bskur ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa ste /

original: phyag rgya mchod ces bya ba ni mdor bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: phyag rgya mchod ces bya ba ni mdor bshad pa yin no //

analyzed: da ni lus kyi dkyil 'khor la gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba ni /
translated: Now, the secret empowerment is conferred on the body mandala.

original: de nas slob ma phyi de nyin //
analyzed: de nas slob ma phyi de nyin //
translated: Then, the next day, the disciples

original: @372a * // zhes bya ba smos te rdul tshon gyi lha gshegs su gsol nas tshogs kyi 'khor lo la dbye ste /
analyzed: @372a * // zhes bya ba smos te rdul tshon gyi lha gshegs su gsol nas tshogs kyi 'khor lo la dbye ste /
translated: Having requested the deities of the colored powders to depart, the disciples should be separated in the ga·πáacakra.

analyzed: gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba'i gsol ba slob mas btab nas /
translated: Having requested the secret empowerment,

original: khyod kyis srog chags gsad par bya //
analyzed: khyod kyis srog chags gsad par bya //

analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sdom pa bzhi phog nas rgyud kyi rim pa dang sngags kyi rim pa dang ye shes kyi rim pa sgom du bcug nas /

analyzed: mtshal chen lan gsum bzlas pa yi //
translated: one should recite the great vermilion three times.

analyzed: de la thig le bya ba yin // zhes bya ba ni gnas gsum du bdud rtsi lnga'i dri'i thig le byas la /
