original: mtshal chen dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems slob mas rdo rje'i rtse mo las sam padma'i rtse mo las srin lag gis sam dung chos las blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtshal chen dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems slob mas rdo rje'i rtse mo las sam padma'i rtse mo las srin lag gis sam dung chos las blang bar bya'o //
translated: Having made a bindu of the scent of the five am·πõtas in the three places, the bodhicitta endowed with great vermilion is taken with the ring finger from the tip of the vajra or from the tip of the lotus or from the conch.üîΩThe master causes the bindu that is received from the mouths of the buddhas of the ten directions to fall on the tongue of the disciple. Since the gnosis of Vajrarasa is generated in RasanƒÅ, the samayas of the three joys are generated.

original: slob dpon gyis phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhal nas zhu ba'i thig le slob ma'i lce la phab nas ro rdo rje ma la dga' ba gsum gyi ting nge 'dzin bskyed pas bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / bzhi pa ro'i stong pa nyid shes pas zag pa med pa'i sdom pa bskyed nas ngo mtshar bde ba che zhes ched du brjod pa ched du brjod gzhug go //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhal nas zhu ba'i thig le slob ma'i lce la phab nas ro rdo rje ma la dga' ba gsum gyi ting nge 'dzin bskyed pas bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / bzhi pa ro'i stong pa nyid shes pas zag pa med pa'i sdom pa bskyed nas ngo mtshar bde ba che zhes ched du brjod pa ched du brjod gzhug go //
translated: Since the fourth is the knowledge of the emptiness of taste, the uncontaminated vow is generated.

original: de nas de'i tshogs kyi 'khor lo byas la dkyil 'khor bha ga la shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de'i tshogs kyi 'khor lo byas la dkyil 'khor bha ga la shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having performed the ga·πáacakra, the empowerment of the gnosis of wisdom is conferred in the bhaga ma·πá·∏çala.

original: pha ma'i thabs dang shes rab las sgyu ma lta bu'i lhar bskyed pas zla ba sa bcu dang / aa ham 'don pa sngags dang / khru ma chos gos dang / thal mo sbyar ba'i phyag rgya dang / rgyu rkyen gyi tshogs pa las lhar bskyed do zhes me long gi gzugs brnyan bstan nas shes rab kyi dbang bskur ba'i gsol ba 'debs su bcug la /
analyzed: pha ma'i thabs dang shes rab las sgyu ma lta bu'i lhar bskyed pas zla ba sa bcu dang / aa ham 'don pa sngags dang / khru ma chos gos dang / thal mo sbyar ba'i phyag rgya dang / rgyu rkyen gyi tshogs pa las lhar bskyed do zhes me long gi gzugs brnyan bstan nas shes rab kyi dbang bskur ba'i gsol ba 'debs su bcug la /
translated: After the mirror image is shown, have them supplicate for the conferral of the wisdom empowerment.

original: bla ma dang shes rab kyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal nas sdom pa dag kyang mnos te /
analyzed: bla ma dang shes rab kyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal nas sdom pa dag kyang mnos te /
translated: After they prostrate to the guru and the wisdom consort, they should also take the vows.

original: de yang bsnyen sgrub bzhis sbyangs pa'i rdzas dang me tog gi thig les brgyan pa'i las kyi phyag rgya dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i ched du gtad la 'byung ba bzhi'i dbus ma nam mkha'i rtsa dang reg par gyur pas reg bya stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin
analyzed: de yang bsnyen sgrub bzhis sbyangs pa'i rdzas dang me tog gi thig les brgyan pa'i las kyi phyag rgya dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i ched du gtad la 'byung ba bzhi'i dbus ma nam mkha'i rtsa dang reg par gyur pas reg bya stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin
translated: For the purpose of union with the karma consort, who is adorned with the substances refined by the four sessions of approach and accomplishment and a drop of flower, the karma consort is given to them. Since they touch the nƒÅ·∏çƒ´ of space, which is the middle of the four elements, they should meditate on the samƒÅdhi of the emptiness of touch.

original: rtogs pa ni gdong phye dkyil 'khor bstan zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni gdong phye dkyil 'khor bstan zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Realization is the face-unveiling, the teaching of the mandala.

original: gang gi lha gnas gang yin pa //
analyzed: gang gi lha gnas gang yin pa //
translated: Whose deity abode is what?

original: zhes bya ba ni bde ba stong nyid zag med ni lha yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bde ba stong nyid zag med ni lha yin la /
translated: The deity is the undefiled emptiness of bliss.

original: de'i gnas ni dud can dang padma can dang ri @372b dags can no //
analyzed: de'i gnas ni dud can dang padma can dang ri @372b dags can no //
translated: Its abode is the one with the womb, the one with the lotus, and the one with the deer.

original: der de yang dag bstan par bya //
analyzed: der de yang dag bstan par bya //
translated: There, that is to be taught.

original: zhes bya ba ni slob ma de bde ba stong pa nyid kyi tshogs pa de slob dpon gyi mngon sum gyi gzhan don gyi man ngag gis slob ma la nges pa skyes pa ni yang dag par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni slob ma de bde ba stong pa nyid kyi tshogs pa de slob dpon gyi mngon sum gyi gzhan don gyi man ngag gis slob ma la nges pa skyes pa ni yang dag par bstan pa'o //
translated: The disciple, in that assembly of the bliss of emptiness, by the master's direct perception, is given the oral instruction for the benefit of others. The disciple's arising of certainty is the teaching.

original: slob ma shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba'i rjes la zhi gnas kyi sgo mo brgyad khri bzhi stong gi sgo nas lhag mthong stong pa nyid brgyad khri bzhi stong gi mngon sum gyi lam ston cing zhes brjod du gnang ba sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: slob ma shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba'i rjes la zhi gnas kyi sgo mo brgyad khri bzhi stong gi sgo nas lhag mthong stong pa nyid brgyad khri bzhi stong gi mngon sum gyi lam ston cing zhes brjod du gnang ba sbyin par bya'o //
translated: After the disciple's empowerment of the wisdom consort, the master should give permission to teach the path of direct perception of the 84,000 emptinesses of vipa≈õyanƒÅ through the door of the 84,000 ≈õamathas.

original: de nas nyi ma 'char kar slob dpon la yon dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas nyi ma 'char kar slob dpon la yon dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Then, at sunrise, the disciple should offer a gift to the master.

original: de nas phyag 'tshal ba dang bskor ba byas la dkyil 'khor bha ga dang bla ma slob dpon la sngags dang phyag rgya'i cho gas phyag bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyag 'tshal ba dang bskor ba byas la dkyil 'khor bha ga dang bla ma slob dpon la sngags dang phyag rgya'i cho gas phyag bya'o //
translated: Then, having bowed down and circumambulated, one should pay homage to the bhaga of the ma·πá·∏çala and the master with the rite of mantra and mudra.

original: de nas bla ma dag la yon //
analyzed: de nas bla ma dag la yon //
translated: Then, to the gurus, the gift.

original: zhes bya ba ni go sla'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni go sla'o //
translated: This is easy to understand.

original: de ltar nges par bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar nges par bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, one should definitely do this:

original: sgrub pa po yis rab mnyes bya //
analyzed: sgrub pa po yis rab mnyes bya //
translated: the adept should please the gurus.

original: zhes pa dbang bskur ba nges par thob pa'i rjes thogs la nges par yon dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa dbang bskur ba nges par thob pa'i rjes thogs la nges par yon dbul bar bya'o //
translated: This means that after definitely receiving the empowerment, one should definitely offer a gift.

original: de nas dbang bskur ba'i phan yon bstan pa ni //
analyzed: de nas dbang bskur ba'i phan yon bstan pa ni //
translated: Then, the benefits of empowerment are taught:

original: de nas de la mkha' 'gro ma //
analyzed: de nas de la mkha' 'gro ma //
translated: Then, the dakinis

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so forth are said.

original: mkha' 'gro ma sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa ye shes kyi lha mo bzhi dang / sgrub pa po lhan cig tu dga' ba bzhi'i ting nge 'dzin spyod pas 'gro ba thams cad zil gyis gnon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa ye shes kyi lha mo bzhi dang / sgrub pa po lhan cig tu dga' ba bzhi'i ting nge 'dzin spyod pas 'gro ba thams cad zil gyis gnon par 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of the practice of the four ecstasies of the samƒÅdhi of the thirty-two ·∏çƒÅkinƒ´s, the four awareness goddesses such as ·∏åƒÅkinƒ´, and the practitioner, one will overpower all migrating beings.

original: phan yon gnyis pa ni dbang bskur ba khyad par can 'di grub na 'jig rten gsum po thams cad kyi bar chad bya bar mi zlos shing mi snang ba dang / sa 'og tu 'gro ba dang / nam mkha' la rgyu ba dang / rkang mgyogs dang bcud len la sogs pa rnal 'byor pa 'dod pa tsam gyis dus thams cad du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan yon gnyis pa ni dbang bskur ba khyad par can 'di grub na 'jig rten gsum po thams cad kyi bar chad bya bar mi zlos shing mi snang ba dang / sa 'og tu 'gro ba dang / nam mkha' la rgyu ba dang / rkang mgyogs dang bcud len la sogs pa rnal 'byor pa 'dod pa tsam gyis dus thams cad du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The second benefit is that if one accomplishes this special empowerment, all obstacles of the three worlds will be pacified, and one will become invisible, one will be able to travel underground and in the sky, and one will be able to obtain swift-footedness, alchemical powers, and so on, whenever one wishes.

original: phan yon gsum pa ni gzugs du ma byed pa dang / nam mkha' la song nas mkha' 'gro ma rnams la bka' bsgo zhing chad pas bcad pa dang / phan 'dogs dag kyang bltas pa tsam gyis skad cig gis skyed par byed do //
analyzed: phan yon gsum pa ni gzugs du ma byed pa dang / nam mkha' la song nas mkha' 'gro ma rnams la bka' bsgo zhing chad pas bcad pa dang / phan 'dogs dag kyang bltas pa tsam gyis skad cig gis skyed par byed do //
translated: The third benefit is that one can create many forms, and having gone into space, one can issue commands to the sky-goers and punish them, and one can benefit them, and one can create them in an instant just by looking.

original: gal te dbang ma thob na des ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dbang ma thob na des ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one does not obtain initiation, what happens?

original: sngags pas dkyil 'khor ma mthong ba //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /üîΩdbang ma thob bzhin du bsgom bzlas byas kyang grub par mi 'gyur ba'i dpe gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: sngags pas dkyil 'khor ma mthong ba // zhes bya ba smos te / dbang ma thob bzhin du bsgom bzlas byas kyang grub par mi 'gyur ba'i dpe gsungs pa ni /
translated: The mantra practitioner who has not seen the mandalaüîΩis not a vessel for the supreme.üîΩThis is saying that even if one meditates and recites without obtaining initiation, one will not achieve [the result].

original: sgra @373a * //
analyzed: sgra @373a * //
translated: The example is given:

original: snyan pa 'byung du re bas nam mkha' la khu tshur brdeg pa dang smig rgyu'i chu 'thung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: snyan pa 'byung du re bas nam mkha' la khu tshur brdeg pa dang smig rgyu'i chu 'thung ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like someone who, hoping for a pleasant sound, punches the sky, or drinks the water of a mirage.

original: rgyud sde thams cad las khyad par du gyur par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rgyud sde thams cad las khyad par du gyur par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching on how this is superior to all the tantras is:üîΩThis yoga is the supreme

original: rnal 'byor 'di ni mchog rab dang // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor 'di ni mchog rab dang // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: and the best.

original: 'khor lo bde mchog tu dbang thob na rgyud sde bzhi'i slob dpon du gyur pa dang / rgyud sde bzhi'i dngos grub tu rung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'khor lo bde mchog tu dbang thob na rgyud sde bzhi'i slob dpon du gyur pa dang / rgyud sde bzhi'i dngos grub tu rung ba yin te /
translated: If one obtains initiation into Cakrasamvara, one becomes a master of the four classes of tantra and is fit for the powers of the four classes of tantra.

original: de yang lha la sogs pa drag po 'jigs byed nyi shu rtsa bzhi zil gyis gnon pas dgod pa dang blta ba dang lag bcangs dang 'khyud pa la sogs pa ni 'dir dbang bskur bar gyur pas thams cad kyi bdag por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang lha la sogs pa drag po 'jigs byed nyi shu rtsa bzhi zil gyis gnon pas dgod pa dang blta ba dang lag bcangs dang 'khyud pa la sogs pa ni 'dir dbang bskur bar gyur pas thams cad kyi bdag por 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, since one overpowers the twenty-four deities such as Rudra, one becomes the lord of all by means of the initiation here, through laughing, looking, holding hands, embracing, and so on.

original: gzhan du dbang bskur bas bde mchog gi slob dpon du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du dbang bskur bas bde mchog gi slob dpon du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why does one not become a master of Cakrasamvara through initiation elsewhere?

original: mngon sum gyi lam ston pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi mchog 'di ni sangs rgyas 'od srungs la sogs pa la yang ma byung la /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi lam ston pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi mchog 'di ni sangs rgyas 'od srungs la sogs pa la yang ma byung la /
translated: This supreme mandala that teaches the path of direct realization did not occur even for the buddhas such as Kashyapa.

original: ma byon pa'i rgyal ba byams pa la sogs pa'i ring la yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byon pa'i rgyal ba byams pa la sogs pa'i ring la yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It will not occur for the future victors such as Maitreya.

original: de ltar na rgyud thams cad kyi don la bde mchog gi rgyud kyi don gyis khyab bam zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyud thams cad kyi don la bde mchog gi rgyud kyi don gyis khyab bam zhe na /
translated: Thus, is the meaning of all tantras pervaded by the meaning of the Cakrasamvara Tantra?

original: bshad dang ma bshad gang ci'ang rung //
analyzed: bshad dang ma bshad gang ci'ang rung //
translated: Whatever is explained or not explained,

original: de kun dpal ldan khrag 'thung gnas //
analyzed: de kun dpal ldan khrag 'thung gnas //
translated: all that is the abode of glorious Heruka.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: rgyud sde bzhi bshad pa dang ma bshad pa'i 'khor lo bde mchog gi rgyud kyi don thams cad kyis brjod par bya ba ni sku gsum gyi rang bzhin dpal he ru ka brjod byar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyud sde bzhi bshad pa dang ma bshad pa'i 'khor lo bde mchog gi rgyud kyi don thams cad kyis brjod par bya ba ni sku gsum gyi rang bzhin dpal he ru ka brjod byar bstan pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the Chakrasamvara Tantra, which is explained or not explained in the four classes of tantra, is taught to be the expressed meaning of the glorious Heruka, who is the nature of the three kayas.

original: le'u gsum pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u gsum pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the explanation of the third chapter.

original: // / de ltar dbang bskur ba bshad nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar dbang bskur ba bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the empowerment,

original: da ni lha dgod pa bshad par bya ba ni /
analyzed: da ni lha dgod pa bshad par bya ba ni /
translated: now the placement of the deities will be explained.

original: de nas rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis //
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis //
translated: Then, the yoginis

original: sa la rnam par rol pa ste //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sa la rnam par rol pa ste // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: play on the ground.

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams ni sum cu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams ni sum cu rtsa bdun no //
translated: The yoginis are thirty-seven.

original: sa la rnam par rol pa ni dbang byas pa dang / longs spyad pa dang thim pa gsum gyis gdul bya 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: sa la rnam par rol pa ni dbang byas pa dang / longs spyad pa dang thim pa gsum gyis gdul bya 'dul ba'o //
translated: Playing on the ground means taming disciples by the three activities of subjugating, enjoying, and dissolving.

original: ci'i phyir lha dgod pa dbang bskur ba'i rjes la bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lha dgod pa dbang bskur ba'i rjes la bshad ce na /
translated: Why is the placement of the deities explained after the empowerment?

original: rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor dang lus kyi dkyil 'khor dang bha ga'i dkyil 'khor gsum la thun mong du lha dgod par bshad pa yin //
analyzed: rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor dang lus kyi dkyil 'khor dang bha ga'i dkyil 'khor gsum la thun mong du lha dgod par bshad pa yin //
translated: This explains the common placement of the deities in the three mandalas: the colored-powder mandala, the body mandala, and the bhaga mandala.

original: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid slob ma 'jug pa'i rim pa dang sbyar nas sku'i 'khor lo nas brtsams @373b te thugs kyi 'khor lo'i bar du bstan pa yin /
analyzed: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid slob ma 'jug pa'i rim pa dang sbyar nas sku'i 'khor lo nas brtsams @373b te thugs kyi 'khor lo'i bar du bstan pa yin /
translated: Their characteristics are taught beginning with the body wheel and ending with the mind wheel, in connection with the stages of inducting the disciples.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúlocated in the middle of body, speech, and mind‚Äù

original: sku gsung thugs kyi dbus su gnas pa ni /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi dbus su gnas pa ni /
translated: means

original: phyi rol ji ltar de bzhin nang //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phyi rol ji ltar de bzhin nang // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚Äújust as externally, so internally.‚Äù

original: phyi rol ni gzugs brnyan dang / nang ni lus dang / gsang ba ni bha ga'o //
analyzed: phyi rol ni gzugs brnyan dang / nang ni lus dang / gsang ba ni bha ga'o //
translated: Externally refers to the reflected image, internally to the body, and secretly to the bhaga.

original: mkha' 'gro ma ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: The dakinis are the twenty-four.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi 'khor lo la gtso bor bstan pa yin no //üîΩ'di dag sngon nyid grub pa yin //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi 'khor lo la gtso bor bstan pa yin no // 'di dag sngon nyid grub pa yin //
translated: This teaches the principal deities of the body, speech, and mind wheels.

original: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gsum du dgod pa'i lha ni sngon nyid nas grub pa'i lha yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gsum du dgod pa'i lha ni sngon nyid nas grub pa'i lha yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthese are already accomplished‚Äù means that the deities to be placed in the three mandalas are already accomplished deities.

original: de ltar lha dgod pa bstan nas de'i sngags bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar lha dgod pa bstan nas de'i sngags bstan pa ni /
translated: Having thus taught the placement of the deities, he teaches their mantras.

original: rang ming brjod pa'i sngags la ni //
analyzed: rang ming brjod pa'i sngags la ni //
translated: The mantra that expresses one's own name

original: mthar ni h'um h'um phat dang sbyar //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mthar ni h'um h'um phat dang sbyar // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: is joined at the end with h≈´·πÉ h≈´·πÉ pha·π≠.

original: dkyil 'khor gsum la lha dgod pa bzlas pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gsum la lha dgod pa bzlas pa'i sngags so //
translated: This is the mantra for the recitation of the placement of the deities in the three mandalas.

original: rnal 'byor mchog ni 'di mthong na //
analyzed: rnal 'byor mchog ni 'di mthong na //
translated: Seeing this supreme yoga,

original: zhes bya ba ni lha dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i sngags 'di mthong na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lha dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i sngags 'di mthong na /
translated: seeing this mantra of the hero and heroine deities,

original: gzhan dag snying po med rtsvar mtshungs //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan dag snying po med rtsvar mtshungs // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: others are like worthless straw.

original: 'bras bu 'dod pas phub ma brdung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dod pas phub ma brdung ba bzhin no //
translated: One should not tell them, just like beating a drum for those who desire results.

original: aom ni thams cad gsal byed de //
analyzed: aom ni thams cad gsal byed de //
translated: Om is the illuminator of all,

original: grub pa 'dod pa thams cad ster //
analyzed: grub pa 'dod pa thams cad ster //
translated: giving all that is desired for the sake of accomplishment.

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: dngos grub gsum ster zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos grub gsum ster zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It gives the three accomplishments, is the meaning.

original: de ltar lhar dgod pa'i bzlas pa dag gi phan yon gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar lhar dgod pa'i bzlas pa dag gi phan yon gsungs pa ni /
translated: Having thus taught the benefits of the recitation of the placement of the deities, he says:

original: dpa' bo nyid 'gyur grub pa ni //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dpa' bo nyid 'gyur grub pa ni //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: One becomes a hero, and is accomplished.

original: mtshan ma thob pa'i bsnyen pa grub pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma thob pa'i bsnyen pa grub pa'o //
translated: The approximation of attaining the sign is accomplished.

original: khyim du dkyil 'khor mthong ba yin //
analyzed: khyim du dkyil 'khor mthong ba yin //
translated: One sees the mandala in the house.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs brnyan dang lus bha ga gsum rang gi gnas su mthong ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs brnyan dang lus bha ga gsum rang gi gnas su mthong ba'o //
translated: This means that one sees the reflection, the body, and the bhaga in one's own place.

original: de shes nas mngon sum gyi lam gyis rtag tu sgom pa ni gdon mi za bar 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: de shes nas mngon sum gyi lam gyis rtag tu sgom pa ni gdon mi za bar 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so //
translated: Knowing that, one always meditates by the path of direct seeing, and one will certainly accomplish it. Thus the Tathagata has said.

original: 'dis ni shugs la dpa' mo rnams kyi sngags btu ba yang bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni shugs la dpa' mo rnams kyi sngags btu ba yang bstan pa yin te /
translated: This also teaches the extraction of the mantras of the heroines by implication.

original: yab yum gyi snying po dang / nye ba'i snying po bzhi dang / dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i sngags dang / go cha'i sngags gnyis dang / rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags gnyis dang / gnod mdzes dang bcu gcig la sngags btu ba'i thabs rnam pa bzhi yin te /
analyzed: yab yum gyi snying po dang / nye ba'i snying po bzhi dang / dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i sngags dang / go cha'i sngags gnyis dang / rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags gnyis dang / gnod mdzes dang bcu gcig la sngags btu ba'i thabs rnam pa bzhi yin te /
translated: The extraction of the mantras is of four kinds: the essence and the quintessence of the father and mother, the mantras of the heroes and heroines, the two armor mantras, the two eight-line mantras, and Sumbha.

original: ming mtshan gyi dang po 'khrul 'khor gyi sgo nas btu ba dang / ming gi sgo @374a * //
analyzed: ming mtshan gyi dang po 'khrul 'khor gyi sgo nas btu ba dang / ming gi sgo @374a * //
translated: The extraction of the mantras is by the door of the name, the first part, and the wheel.

original: nas btu ba dang / dbyangs dang gsal phyed kyi sgo nas btu ba dang phyed btus pa'o //
analyzed: nas btu ba dang / dbyangs dang gsal phyed kyi sgo nas btu ba dang phyed btus pa'o //
translated: The extraction of the seed-syllable, the extraction by way of vowel and consonant, and the half-extraction.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud 'dir ni dpal mo rnams kyi sngags ming gis btus pa dang / rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags dbyangs dang gsal byed kyis btus pa dang / go cha gnyis phyed btus pa ste bzhi 'dir btu ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud 'dir ni dpal mo rnams kyi sngags ming gis btus pa dang / rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags dbyangs dang gsal byed kyis btus pa dang / go cha gnyis phyed btus pa ste bzhi 'dir btu ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: In this Root Tantra, the extraction of the seed-syllable by way of the names of the ≈örƒ´ Herukas, the extraction of the eight-line mantra by way of vowel and consonant, and the half-extraction of the two armors, these four extractions are taught here.

original: de la re zhig dang por dpa' mo rnams kyi sngags ming gis btu ba shugs la bstan no //
analyzed: de la re zhig dang por dpa' mo rnams kyi sngags ming gis btu ba shugs la bstan no //
translated: Therein, first, the extraction of the seed-syllable by way of the names of the heroines is taught by implication.

original: le'u bzhi pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bzhi pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the fourth chapter on the meditation on the deities.

original: // / de ltar le'u gsum gyis lha bsgom pa bshad nas bzlas pa'i sngags btu ba bstan pa ni dang por rtsa ba'i sngags btu ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: // / de ltar le'u gsum gyis lha bsgom pa bshad nas bzlas pa'i sngags btu ba bstan pa ni dang por rtsa ba'i sngags btu ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, having explained the meditation on the deities by means of three chapters, the teaching on the extraction of the mantra of recitation is the teaching on the extraction of the root mantra.

original: de la sngags btu ba'i gzhi ni /
analyzed: de la sngags btu ba'i gzhi ni /
translated: Therein, the basis of the extraction of the mantra is:

original: de nas thams cad chos 'byung bar //
analyzed: de nas thams cad chos 'byung bar //
translated: Then, in the source of phenomena,

original: sna tshogs lte bar mi shigs dge / zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sna tshogs lte bar mi shigs dge / zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the variegated navel is the indestructible bliss.

original: sa'i phyogs cha mnyam par ba'i rnam lnga bdud rtsi lngas byugs la me tog sil ma bkram ste /
analyzed: sa'i phyogs cha mnyam par ba'i rnam lnga bdud rtsi lngas byugs la me tog sil ma bkram ste /
translated: Having anointed the even part of the ground with the five nectars and the five meats, and having scattered loose flowers,

original: chos 'byung gru gsum gyi dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bris la de'i lte ba la mi shigs pa'i yi ge aa dge ba bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos 'byung gru gsum gyi dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bris la de'i lte ba la mi shigs pa'i yi ge aa dge ba bri bar bya'o //
translated: in the middle of the triangular source of phenomena one should draw an eight-petaled lotus, and in its center one should draw the indestructible syllable A.

original: bris nas cho ga bzhin du sngags //
analyzed: bris nas cho ga bzhin du sngags //
translated: Having drawn it, one should recite the mantra according to the rite,

original: chos kun gcig tu 'dus par bya //
analyzed: chos kun gcig tu 'dus par bya //
translated: and one should gather all phenomena into one.

original: zhes bya ba ni yi ge thams cad kyi phyi ma dbyangs yig dang / gsal byed lnga bcu gsung gi chos gcig tu bsdus pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yi ge thams cad kyi phyi ma dbyangs yig dang / gsal byed lnga bcu gsung gi chos gcig tu bsdus pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: This means that one should draw the last vowel of all the syllables, and the fifty consonants, which are the phenomena of speech, gathered into one.

original: btu ba'i don bstan pa ni 'dir sngags tshig 'di yin te /
analyzed: btu ba'i don bstan pa ni 'dir sngags tshig 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the extraction is taught here, and these are the mantra words:

original: a'a li k'a li mnyam byas nas //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li mnyam byas nas //
translated: Having equalized the Alikali,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said.

original: padma 'dab brgyad la a'a li gcig dang k'a li bdun bdun bkod pas mnyam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: padma 'dab brgyad la a'a li gcig dang k'a li bdun bdun bkod pas mnyam par 'gyur ro //
translated: By arranging one Alikali and seven Kalikali on the eight petals of the lotus, they become equalized.

original: bzhi bzhi ru ni shes byas la //
analyzed: bzhi bzhi ru ni shes byas la //
translated: Having understood the four by four,

original: zhes pa ni bzhi mnyam pa'i sde tshan brgyad de de btus pas ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: zhes pa ni bzhi mnyam pa'i sde tshan brgyad de de btus pas ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is the purpose of collecting the eight groups of four?

original: 'dir don thams cad grub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir don thams cad grub par byed pa ste /
translated: Here, it is to accomplish all goals.

original: sngags btu ba 'di la brten nas 'jig rten dang thun mong dang mchog gi dngos grub gsum skyed par mdzad de /
analyzed: sngags btu ba 'di la brten nas 'jig rten dang thun mong dang mchog gi dngos grub gsum skyed par mdzad de /
translated: Based on this collection of mantras, the three common and supreme siddhis are generated.

original: de yang rdzogs pa'i rim pa lus kyi 'khor lo dang sbyar na sgra rang gi mtshan nyid bskyed pa'i rgyu lte ba sprul pa'i 'khor lo gru gsum gyi dbus na rtsa drug cu rtsa bzhi padma'i lte ba 'dab ma brgyad pa de la a'a li'i nang du 'jug
analyzed: de yang rdzogs pa'i rim pa lus kyi 'khor lo dang sbyar na sgra rang gi mtshan nyid bskyed pa'i rgyu lte ba sprul pa'i 'khor lo gru gsum gyi dbus na rtsa drug cu rtsa bzhi padma'i lte ba 'dab ma brgyad pa de la a'a li'i nang du 'jug
translated: Further, if the stage of completion is applied to the body cakras, the cause of generating the intrinsic characteristics of sound is the eight-petaled lotus in the center of the sixty-four nƒÅ·∏çƒ´s in the center of the triangular nirmƒÅ·πáacakra at the navel.

original: pa dang / k'a li phyir rgyu ba'i rlung gis @374b brgyan pa'i gnas de la slob dpon sems kyi rgyal pos rkan dang lkog ma la sogs pa gnas brgyad nas sngags kyi tshul du 'byung ba yin /
analyzed: pa dang / k'a li phyir rgyu ba'i rlung gis @374b brgyan pa'i gnas de la slob dpon sems kyi rgyal pos rkan dang lkog ma la sogs pa gnas brgyad nas sngags kyi tshul du 'byung ba yin /
translated: The master CitrƒÅ·πÖgada states that the mantra arises from the eight places, such as the palate, throat, and so on, in the manner of a mantra.

original: chos 'byung gru gsum de yang lus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus yin no //
analyzed: chos 'byung gru gsum de yang lus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus yin no //
translated: That triangular source of phenomena is the center of the body ma·πá·∏çala.

original: rkang pa rlung dang lte ba me dang lto ba chu dang snying ga sa dang mgo bo nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus na yan lag brgyad kyi rkang pa dang ldan pa'i dbus na sgo bzhi nye bar mtshon pa'i dkyil 'khor la sngags btu bar bya'o zhes bya

In the center of the ma·πá·∏çala endowed with eight petals, the center of which is indicated by the four doors, one should collect the mantras.

original: ba shugs kyis ston pa yin no //
analyzed: ba shugs kyis ston pa yin no //

analyzed: de dag dpal he ru ka'i gsang sngags kyi rgyal po'o //

original: ka ra ka ra zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpa' bo'i sngags ni nges brjod bla mar btu bar dgongs te /
analyzed: ka ra ka ra zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpa' bo'i sngags ni nges brjod bla mar btu bar dgongs te /
translated: The hero's mantra beginning with kara kara is intended to be extracted from the Supreme Tantra of Clear Expression.

original: 'dir ma gsungs sngags 'di ni kha sbyor gyi rgyud las rigs lnga'i he ru ka'i nang nas don yod grub pa he ru ka'i sngags yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ma gsungs sngags 'di ni kha sbyor gyi rgyud las rigs lnga'i he ru ka'i nang nas don yod grub pa he ru ka'i sngags yin te /
translated: The mantra not mentioned here is the mantra of Amoghasiddhi Heruka from among the five family Herukas in the Samputa Tantra.

original: der sprul pa'i sku dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi char bgos nas sngags su byas pa la yin gyi rang rang gi sde sngags su byas pas ni khanda ka p'a la la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: der sprul pa'i sku dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi char bgos nas sngags su byas pa la yin gyi rang rang gi sde sngags su byas pas ni khanda ka p'a la la sogs pa yin no //
translated: There, it is made into a mantra by dividing it among the twenty-four emanated heroes, but if it were made into a mantra of each individual family, it would be Khandakapala and so forth.

original: rkang pa brgyad pa dang sngags 'di bsdams pa la rtsa ba'i sngags zhes ming du 'dogs te /
analyzed: rkang pa brgyad pa dang sngags 'di bsdams pa la rtsa ba'i sngags zhes ming du 'dogs te /
translated: This mantra together with the eight-line verse is called the root mantra.

original: de la yang rkang pa brgyad pa cha brgyad du ma bgos shing sngags 'di tshan nyi shu rtsa bzhir ma bgos pa'i thog ma aom gcig mtha' mar h'um h'um phat gcig dang @375b bcas pa las thams cad byed ces pa'i rtsa ba'i sngags yin la /
analyzed: de la yang rkang pa brgyad pa cha brgyad du ma bgos shing sngags 'di tshan nyi shu rtsa bzhir ma bgos pa'i thog ma aom gcig mtha' mar h'um h'um phat gcig dang @375b bcas pa las thams cad byed ces pa'i rtsa ba'i sngags yin la /
translated: Moreover, the root mantra is the one that is not divided into eight parts, the eight-line verse, nor into twenty-four parts, the mantra. It begins with one Om and ends with one Hum Hum Phat.

original: rkang pa brgyad pa cha brgyad du bgos nas aom brgyad dang h'um h'um phat brgyad dang bcas pa ni aa tsa na manda zhes bya ste mchod pa sprul pa'i sngags yin no //
analyzed: rkang pa brgyad pa cha brgyad du bgos nas aom brgyad dang h'um h'um phat brgyad dang bcas pa ni aa tsa na manda zhes bya ste mchod pa sprul pa'i sngags yin no //
translated: The mantra called Acana Man, which is divided into eight parts, the eight-line verse, and is endowed with eight Oms and eight Hum Hums Phats, is the mantra for emanating offerings.

original: sngags 'di cha nyi shu rtsa bzhir bgos pa ni bstod pa dang bzlas pa'i sngags yin no //
analyzed: sngags 'di cha nyi shu rtsa bzhir bgos pa ni bstod pa dang bzlas pa'i sngags yin no //
translated: This mantra, divided into twenty-four parts, is the mantra for praise and recitation.

original: rig pa'i rgyal po'i gsang sngags te //
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po'i gsang sngags te //
translated: The mantra of the king of knowledge

original: zhes bya ba ni phan yon ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phan yon ston pa'o //
translated: shows the benefits.

original: 'jig rten dang thun mong dang mchog gi dngos grub thams cad grub par yod pa dang / bya ba dang rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi sngags 'di mchog tu gyur pa gzhan na med pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang thun mong dang mchog gi dngos grub thams cad grub par yod pa dang / bya ba dang rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi sngags 'di mchog tu gyur pa gzhan na med pa'o //
translated: and all mundane and supramundane powers are accomplished, and that this mantra of Action and Yoga Tantra is supreme and not found elsewhere.

original: gzhan dag snying po med rtsvar mtshungs //
analyzed: gzhan dag snying po med rtsvar mtshungs //
translated: Others are like worthless straw.

original: zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes 'bebs pas na sems 'od gsal ba'i snang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes 'bebs pas na sems 'od gsal ba'i snang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that the appearance of the clear light mind is due to the descent of uncontaminated intuition.

original: le'u lnga pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u lnga pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the fifth chapter.

original: // / de ltar le'u lnga pas rtsa ba'i sngags btu ba bshad nas //
analyzed: // / de ltar le'u lnga pas rtsa ba'i sngags btu ba bshad nas //

analyzed: go cha'i sngags btu ba bstan pa ni /

original: gzhan yang yi ge nyi shu gnyis //
analyzed: gzhan yang yi ge nyi shu gnyis //

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /

original: rgyud bla mar lha nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyi ming mtshan gyi dang po 'khrul 'khor gyi yi ge btu ba la dgongs nas 'dir ming tsam las ma gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyud bla mar lha nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyi ming mtshan gyi dang po 'khrul 'khor gyi yi ge btu ba la dgongs nas 'dir ming tsam las ma gsungs so //
translated: With the intention of selecting the syllables of the wheel from the names of the twenty-two deities in the Highest Tantra, here only the names are mentioned.

original: snying po yi ge bdun nye snying //
analyzed: snying po yi ge bdun nye snying //
translated: The essence is the seven syllables, the quintessence

original: zhes bya ba la snying po chos kyi sku ston pa yin la nye ba'i snying po ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ston pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la snying po chos kyi sku ston pa yin la nye ba'i snying po ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ston pa yin no //
translated: The essence is the teaching of the dharmakƒÅya, and the near essence is the teaching of the sƒÅmbhogikakƒÅya.

original: rtsa ba'i sngags kyi yi ge sprul pa'i sku ston pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sngags kyi yi ge sprul pa'i sku ston pa yin no //
translated: The root mantra syllables are the teaching of the nairmƒÅ·πáikakƒÅya.

original: nye ba'i snying po ni rgyud bla mar lha bdun gyi yi ge btu ba'i 'khrul 'khor gyis bstan pas 'dir ming tsam las ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba'i snying po ni rgyud bla mar lha bdun gyi yi ge btu ba'i 'khrul 'khor gyis bstan pas 'dir ming tsam las ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: The near essence is taught in the Uttaratantra by the yantra of extracting the syllables of the seven deities, so here it is not taught except by name.

analyzed: snying po dang nye ba'i snying po gnyis kyi sngags dngos ni le'u brgyad pa las go bzlog nas ston pa yin no //
translated: The actual mantras of the essence and the near essence are taught in the eighth chapter in reverse order.

original: go cha'i sngags phyed btu bar bya ba ni //
analyzed: go cha'i sngags phyed btu bar bya ba ni //

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa lha'i skur bsgoms snying ga nas yan lag gi bar du go cha bgos nas bzlas pa bya ba ni mantra ste sngags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa lha'i skur bsgoms snying ga nas yan lag gi bar du go cha bgos nas bzlas pa bya ba ni mantra ste sngags zhes bya'o //

analyzed: thod par bskyed pa'i sa bon dang sman aa go ta la sogs pas mtshon cha bzlog cing bsrung ba'i go cha'i las byed pas tantra ste sman gyi rgyud yin no //
translated: Tantras are called tantras because, in the skull, the seed syllables of the generation stage and medicinal substances such as aguru are used to avert weapons and perform the activity of protecting with the armor.

original: shing la 'dzegs te gang du 'dod pa der 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sngon du bsnyen pas mtshan ma thob pa dang rkang pa brgyad pa'i 'khru 'khor rkang pa gnyis la bsgoms te /

translated: This means that one who has obtained the signs through prior service, having meditated on the wheel of the eight-line mantra on the two feet,

original: nam mkha' la skas gdang gi phreng ba yod par bsgoms nas 'dzegs na gar 'dod pa der 'gro'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la skas gdang gi phreng ba yod par bsgoms nas 'dzegs na gar 'dod pa der 'gro'o //

analyzed: sngags 'phrog par byed ces pa ni rang la byad byed pa'i sngags kyi 'khrul 'khor gyi steng du @380a * //

translated: As for stealing all powers, one should perform a hundred thousand repetitions beforehand, and having obtained the signs, one should make an effigy of the one whose powers one desires, insert the eight-line Yantra into its heart, and perform a fire offering, or cast it into a river, or bury it underground.

original: khrag 'dren par byed na zhes bya ba ni spra tshil gyi lingga sor brgyad pa byas la de'i snying gar rkang pa brgyad pa'i 'khrul 'khor khrag dang bcas pa gzhug par bya zhing gsar ba'i gnas su zangs ma'i mo khab btsugs na khrag 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: khrag 'dren par byed na zhes bya ba ni spra tshil gyi lingga sor brgyad pa byas la de'i snying gar rkang pa brgyad pa'i 'khrul 'khor khrag dang bcas pa gzhug par bya zhing gsar ba'i gnas su zangs ma'i mo khab btsugs na khrag 'dren par byed do //
translated: As for drawing blood, one should make a lingam of beeswax eight finger-widths long, insert the eight-line Yantra together with blood into its heart, and insert a copper needle into the place of the new moon. Blood will be drawn.

original: slar 'o mas bkrus na 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar 'o mas bkrus na 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one washes it with milk, it will revive.

original: gzugs brgya stong phrag du mar byed do zhes bya ba ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro las sman gyi rgyud bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs brgya stong phrag du mar byed do zhes bya ba ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro las sman gyi rgyud bshad par bya ste /
translated: As for one can create many hundreds of thousands of forms, this should be explained as the medicine tantra in the Vajradaka.

original: mi'i thod par ae randa dang smyo byed kyi sa bon btab la bkang ste bskyed nas smin pa dang mar gyi ngo'i nyi shu dgu la dmangs rigs kyi bud med kyi khrag dang bdud rtsi lngas de'i 'bras bu smin pa na bsgos te /

translated: Plant the seeds of eranda and madana in a human skull, fill it, and cultivate it. When it ripens, on the twenty-ninth of the waning phase, smear its fruit with the blood of a low-caste woman and the five nectars.

original: srog chags gang yang rung ba'i spu dang skud pa byas la srog chags de'i mgul du btags na de'i gzugs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog chags gang yang rung ba'i spu dang skud pa byas la srog chags de'i mgul du btags na de'i gzugs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Make a thread from the hair of any animal, and tie it around the neck of that animal. It will take on that form.üîΩIf one desires, it will appear; if one does not desire, it will not appear.

translated: Take the seed of the golden tree, and on the twenty-ninth, smear the inside of a crow‚Äôs skull with the fat of a black snake, cultivate it, and when it ripens, take it.üîΩWhoever‚Äôs neck it is tied around will disappear.

analyzed: du bcings na de mi snang bar 'gyur zhing bkrol na snang bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bza' btung la bltas pa tsam gyis dug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: one's food and drink will become poison merely by one's looking at them.

translated: Mix the ashes from the burnt offering with citraka juice, make pills, dry them in the shade, put them in a straw bag, and pour them into a beer vessel.

analyzed: ces bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems mi nyams pa'i bde ba thob pa'o //
translated: This is the method: one obtains the bliss of not losing the bodhicitta.

original: de ltar bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob na mi'i mchog de'i dngos grub snga ma thams cad kyi dpal sus kyang 'phrog par mi nus so //
analyzed: de ltar bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob na mi'i mchog de'i dngos grub snga ma thams cad kyi dpal sus kyang 'phrog par mi nus so //
translated: Thus, if one obtains the concentration of the bliss of meditative concentration, the glory of all the former powers of this best of men cannot be taken away by anyone.

original: rnam pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i dngos grub ces bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems dga' bral du mi gtong ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod na dngos grub thams cad 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i dngos grub ces bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems dga' bral du mi gtong ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod na dngos grub thams cad 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The so-called power endowed with such a form, if one has the concentration of not letting go of the bodhicitta of joy, all powers will be fruitful.

original: dran pa tsam gyis gsod par byed de zhes bya ba ni ras sam shing shun la nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rkang pa brgyad pa'i 'khrul 'khor bris la dur khrod kyi thal ba dang sol ba las gzugs brnyan byas te /

translated: One kills by mere recollection means that one writes the eight-line Yantra in the center of a sun ma·πá·∏çala on cloth or birch bark, and makes an effigy from charnel ground ash and charcoal.

original: snying gar bcug nas bsgrub bya bkug @381a * //
analyzed: snying gar bcug nas bsgrub bya bkug @381a * //
translated: Having placed it in the heart, one summons the victim.

original: cing mi rus kyi phur bus snying gar btab nas chu tshan blugs te dur khrod kyi sar sbas na nyi ma bdun gyis gsod par byed do //
analyzed: cing mi rus kyi phur bus snying gar btab nas chu tshan blugs te dur khrod kyi sar sbas na nyi ma bdun gyis gsod par byed do //
translated: Having stabbed the heart with a kƒ´la of human bone, one pours hot water and buries it in a charnel ground. One will kill in seven days.

original: spra tshil gyi dbus su mu zi dang me shel bcug la tshon sna lnga'i skud pas dkris te lan stong phrag gcig tu bskor nas 'phangs na gnas der me skyed par byed do //
analyzed: spra tshil gyi dbus su mu zi dang me shel bcug la tshon sna lnga'i skud pas dkris te lan stong phrag gcig tu bskor nas 'phangs na gnas der me skyed par byed do //
translated: Having placed antimony and a sunstone in the middle of the beeswax, wrap it with five-colored thread and cast it a thousand times. If you cast it, fire will be generated in that place.

original: sa bon rnam par 'joms pa zhes bya ba ni til gyi mar gyis bskus la rdo rje rtse gcig pa la rkang pa brgyad pa stong rtsa brgyad bzlas nas bsnun na 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: sa bon rnam par 'joms pa zhes bya ba ni til gyi mar gyis bskus la rdo rje rtse gcig pa la rkang pa brgyad pa stong rtsa brgyad bzlas nas bsnun na 'joms par byed do //
translated: The seed-destroyer is as follows: Having anointed it with sesame oil, strike it with a single-pointed vajra one thousand and eight times while reciting the eight-line [praise]. It will be destroyed.

original: ser ba 'beb  pa ni sgra gcan 'dzin rgyu ba'i dus su rkang pa brgyad pa stong rtsa brgyad bzlas pa'i khrag gi thod pa me la blugs na ser ba 'bebs so //
analyzed: ser ba 'beb  pa ni sgra gcan 'dzin rgyu ba'i dus su rkang pa brgyad pa stong rtsa brgyad bzlas pa'i khrag gi thod pa me la blugs na ser ba 'bebs so //
translated: For bringing rain, when Rahu is moving, recite the eight-line [praise] one thousand and eight times. If you pour a skull-cup of blood into a fire, it will rain.

original: mdung rtse gsum pa la stong rtsa brgyad bzlas nas spyi bo la bskor na ser bzlog par byed do //
analyzed: mdung rtse gsum pa la stong rtsa brgyad bzlas nas spyi bo la bskor na ser bzlog par byed do //
translated: If you recite it one thousand and eight times on a three-pointed spear and circle it above your head, it will avert hail.

original: lha thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan gar byed du gzhug pa ni rkang pa brgyad pa'i 'khrul 'khor lha rnams kyi snying gar bcug la 'od ma'i gzhu la ka ra b'i ra'i lcug ma'i mda' mtshal chen gyis bskus la thugs kar 'phangs na lha'i gzugs brnyan gar byed par
analyzed: lha thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan gar byed du gzhug pa ni rkang pa brgyad pa'i 'khrul 'khor lha rnams kyi snying gar bcug la 'od ma'i gzhu la ka ra b'i ra'i lcug ma'i mda' mtshal chen gyis bskus la thugs kar 'phangs na lha'i gzugs brnyan gar byed par
translated: Having placed the eight-line [mantra] machine in the heart of the deity, one should shoot an arrow of karavƒ´ra twigs smeared with vermilion into the heart of the bow of bamboo.üîΩThe image of the deity will dance.

analyzed: 'gyur ro // thod pa sha med par btogs pa la srin lag g-yon pa'i khrag gis gzugs brnyan bris la gang gi ming dang spel ba de'i snying gar 'khrul 'khor bris la ming nas bzung ste lan re zhing rkang pa brgyad pa dang spel nas bzlas shing khrag dang mnyes na
translated: Having drawn the image in a skull-cup without flesh with the blood of the left ring finger, having written the eight-line [mantra] machine in the heart of the one whose name is combined with it, having taken the name, and having repeated the eight-line [mantra] combined with it,

original: mod la 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mod la 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he will die immediately.

original: sa ma lus pa rnams la longs spyod ces bya ba ni ba lang gi sha dang bcas pa la rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags stong rtsa brgyad zlos shing sbyin sreg byas na rgyal srid thob par 'gyur ro //

translated: The phrase all the stages means that one should perform the homa rite one thousand and eight times while reciting the eight-line praise, including the line the flesh of cows. One will obtain a kingdom.

original: 'dod na sdud par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i longs spyod kyis skyon zhi ba'i sbyin sreg gis rgyal srid kyi g-yeng ba sdud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod na sdud par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i longs spyod kyis skyon zhi ba'i sbyin sreg gis rgyal srid kyi g-yeng ba sdud par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one wishes, one can gather the distractions of a kingdom with a pacifying homa of desired enjoyments.

original: de la spyod pa ji lta bus bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la spyod pa ji lta bus bya zhe na /
translated: What kind of conduct should one perform?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi rkang pa brgyad pa 'di zlos pa'i tshe brtul zhugs mi dgos spyod pa dang / smyung ba mi dgos cho ga thams cad ci bde bas las byas na 'grub par 'gyur ro //

translated: When one recites this eight-line praise of the Blessed One, there is no need for observances, no need for conduct, and no need for fasting. If one performs the rite in any way that is comfortable, one will be successful.

translated: One should draw a magic diagram on cloth from a charnel ground with a stick made from human bone, with the liquid of poison and charnel ground char, and write ‚ÄúMƒÄRAYA PHA·π¨‚Äù in the center.

original: bya'o // de nas bsnyen pa 'bum byas la dug dang khrag dang ske tshe dang / lan tshva dang yungs kar dang rkang rjes dang bsres pa las byas pa'i lingga'i snying gar bcug nas las la sbyar ba'i tshe lan cig bzlas na 'chi bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bya'o // de nas bsnyen pa 'bum byas la dug dang khrag dang ske tshe dang / lan tshva dang yungs kar dang rkang rjes dang bsres pa las byas pa'i lingga'i snying gar bcug nas las la sbyar ba'i tshe lan cig bzlas na 'chi bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Then, having performed the rite of familiarization one hundred thousand times, one should place the diagram in the heart of a linga made from poison, blood, black mustard seeds, salt, and white mustard seeds mixed with earth from an anthill, and when one applies it to the rite, one will die by the utterance of the mantra once.

original: 'o mas bkrus na 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o mas bkrus na 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one washes it with milk, one will live.

original: dur khrod kyi sol ba la lan cig bzlas pa byas zhes bya ba ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang dgu la ro bsregs pa'i me la shing aarka bsregs la da du ra'i khu bas me bsad la dug dang lan tshva dang bcas pa'i sol ba'i khu ba mi
analyzed: dur khrod kyi sol ba la lan cig bzlas pa byas zhes bya ba ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang dgu la ro bsregs pa'i me la shing aarka bsregs la da du ra'i khu bas me bsad la dug dang lan tshva dang bcas pa'i sol ba'i khu ba mi
translated: Having recited the mantra over the ashes of a charnel ground once, one should draw the eight-line wheel in the center of a sun ma·πá·∏çala with a stick of human bone.

original: rus kyi smyu gus nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor kyi dbus su rkang pa brgyad pa'i 'khrul 'khor bris la dur khrod kyi thal ba las byas pa'i gzugs brnyan sor brgyad pa'i snying gar ming dang spel ba'i 'khrul 'khor bcug nas dgug pa la sogs pa byas nas gu gul
analyzed: rus kyi smyu gus nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor kyi dbus su rkang pa brgyad pa'i 'khrul 'khor bris la dur khrod kyi thal ba las byas pa'i gzugs brnyan sor brgyad pa'i snying gar ming dang spel ba'i 'khrul 'khor bcug nas dgug pa la sogs pa byas nas gu gul
translated: Having inserted the wheel, which is combined with the name, into the heart of an effigy eight fingers long made from charnel ground ash, having summoned, and so on, one should fumigate with guggula

original: gyis bdug cing dur khrod kyi sol ba'i sta re byas te lingga gtubs na de'i mod la ltung bar 'gyur zhing 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gyis bdug cing dur khrod kyi sol ba'i sta re byas te lingga gtubs na de'i mod la ltung bar 'gyur zhing 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and chop the li·πÖga with an axe made from charnel ground ash. She will fall and die instantly.

original: dur khrod kyi thal ba la sngags bzlas te bsnun na de'i mod la sha zas gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dur khrod kyi thal ba la sngags bzlas te bsnun na de'i mod la sha zas gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one strikes with the mantra-enchanted ashes of a charnel ground, she will be seized by a zombie spirit instantly.

original: dur khrod kyi sol ba la sngags lan cig bzlas nas zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i shing aarka'i thal ba nyi shu rtsa dgu'i mtshan mo spang leb bam rtsig pa la gza' chen po brgyad bris la snying ga'i dbus su bsgrub bya'i ming dang spel ba'i 'khrul
analyzed: dur khrod kyi sol ba la sngags lan cig bzlas nas zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i shing aarka'i thal ba nyi shu rtsa dgu'i mtshan mo spang leb bam rtsig pa la gza' chen po brgyad bris la snying ga'i dbus su bsgrub bya'i ming dang spel ba'i 'khrul
translated: Having enchanted the charnel ground ash once, one should draw the eight great planets on a board or a wall with the ash of the Arka tree taught previously, and insert the effigy of the victim in the center of the heart, along with his name.

original: 'khor bcug la bdud rtsi lnga'i dud pas bdug cing sngags bzlas na gza' chen po brgyad kyis gdon mi za bar gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor bcug la bdud rtsi lnga'i dud pas bdug cing sngags bzlas na gza' chen po brgyad kyis gdon mi za bar gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one fumigates it with the smoke of the five ambrosias and recites the mantra, the eight great planets will certainly seize him.

original: 'o mas bkrus na slar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o mas bkrus na slar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one bathes him with milk, he will recover.

original: aa ti mukta ka'i lcug ma la lan cig bzlas pa zhes bya ba ni tsandan dmar po'i ri lu byas pa'i bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan gyi snying gar dur khrod kyi ras la ro'i sen rtsi dang gi wang gis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'khrul 'khor bris
analyzed: aa ti mukta ka'i lcug ma la lan cig bzlas pa zhes bya ba ni tsandan dmar po'i ri lu byas pa'i bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan gyi snying gar dur khrod kyi ras la ro'i sen rtsi dang gi wang gis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'khrul 'khor bris
translated: Having enchanted the branch of the atimuktaka once, one should draw the effigy of the victim with human blood and cow concretion on charnel ground cloth, and in the center of the moon ma·πá·∏çala in the heart of the effigy, one should draw the magic diagram with human blood and guggulu.

original: la bcug nas dgug pa la sogs pa byas te dri'i chus sku khrus gsol zhing aa ti mukta ka'i lcug ma la sngags lan bdun bzlas te bsnun par bya'o //
analyzed: la bcug nas dgug pa la sogs pa byas te dri'i chus sku khrus gsol zhing aa ti mukta ka'i lcug ma la sngags lan bdun bzlas te bsnun par bya'o //
translated: Having placed it in the mouth, one should summon and so forth, and having bathed the body with perfumed water, one should strike with an atimuktaka twig, having enchanted it seven times with the mantra.

original: bsnun pa'i tshe bsgom par bya ba ni gcer bu skra grol ba byang chub kyi sems 'bab cing kha dog nyams shing 'jigs pas brgyal ba rlung gi dkyil @382a * //
analyzed: bsnun pa'i tshe bsgom par bya ba ni gcer bu skra grol ba byang chub kyi sems 'bab cing kha dog nyams shing 'jigs pas brgyal ba rlung gi dkyil @382a * //
translated: At the time of striking, one should visualize the target as naked, with loose hair, with the bodhicitta flowing, with a pale complexion, and fainting from fear, mounted on a camel on a wind mandala,

original: 'khor gyi steng du rnga mo la bskyon nas rang gi rkang pa'i drung du ltung bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor gyi steng du rnga mo la bskyon nas rang gi rkang pa'i drung du ltung bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: and falling at the feet of oneself.

original: gseg ma la lan cig bzlas te zhes bya ba ni mi'i thod pa'i dum bu la ba bla dang yung bas nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i 'khrul 'khor ming dang spel ba bris te dur khrod dam lam gyi bzhi mdor khru gang tsam brkos te sba zhing
analyzed: gseg ma la lan cig bzlas te zhes bya ba ni mi'i thod pa'i dum bu la ba bla dang yung bas nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i 'khrul 'khor ming dang spel ba bris te dur khrod dam lam gyi bzhi mdor khru gang tsam brkos te sba zhing
translated: One should bury the target's name written with dog's blood and human blood on a piece of human skull, together with a drawing of a magic wheel on a sun mandala, in a charnel ground or at a crossroads, to the depth of a cubit,

analyzed: kha spub la gseg ma la sngags bzlas shing gang la 'debs pa de rengs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and one should strike with gravel, enchanted with the mantra. Whoever one strikes will be paralyzed.

original: gang du lding ba der 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshub mas khyer ba'i shing lo la mchil ma dang khva'i khrag gis bya rog gi sgro'i smyu gu byas la 'khrul 'khor bris te tshub ma chen po gyen du ldang ba la bskur na bskrad pa'i
analyzed: gang du lding ba der 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshub mas khyer ba'i shing lo la mchil ma dang khva'i khrag gis bya rog gi sgro'i smyu gu byas la 'khrul 'khor bris te tshub ma chen po gyen du ldang ba la bskur na bskrad pa'i
translated: Wherever one flies, one will go there. One should make a stick of crow feathers with saliva and the blood of a pig, draw a yantra, and cast it into a great rising whirlwind.

original: gnas der 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas der 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be expelled to the place where the whirlwind goes.üîΩIf one fumigates with great gugul,

original: gu gul chen pos bdugs na zhes bya ba ni ra thug gi rva dang rmig pa bzhi dang mi'i tshil dang bshad pa cha mnyam la chang gis sbrus te ;
analyzed: gu gul chen pos bdugs na zhes bya ba ni ra thug gi rva dang rmig pa bzhi dang mi'i tshil dang bshad pa cha mnyam la chang gis sbrus te ;

analyzed: dud pas bdugs na sems can thams cad la mkha' 'gro ma 'bebs par 'gyur ro //

original: lag pa g-yon pas chang bkab la g-yon pa'i srin lag khar bcug nas tshigs gsum gyi gnas su lces reg cing gzhi bas na dus su zin pa'i dug gso bar byed do //
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pas chang bkab la g-yon pa'i srin lag khar bcug nas tshigs gsum gyi gnas su lces reg cing gzhi bas na dus su zin pa'i dug gso bar byed do //
translated: One will cure poison that has reached the bones.

original: mkha' 'gro mas rgyas btab pa la zhes bya ba dur khrod kyi ras la shing aa ti mukta ka'i smyu gus sngar bshad pa'i 'khrul 'khor bris te lte ba'i dbus su ae gru gsum bris la zur gsum du aa ma h'um gsum dang dbus su raksha zhes byaüîΩba bzhin ming dang spel ba bris te bsgrub bya'i mgul du btags la /

In the center of the navel one draws an e triangle and in the three corners one writes a ma h≈´·πÉ three times. In the center one writes rak·π£a and the name of the victim.üîΩ One ties this around the neck of the victim.

original: chu la rkang pa brgyad pa bzlas shing gdon gyi gzugs brnyan byas pa'i snying gar gdon gyi ming bcug la chus yang dang yang du bsnun zhing slar gtor na gdon rengs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu la rkang pa brgyad pa bzlas shing gdon gyi gzugs brnyan byas pa'i snying gar gdon gyi ming bcug la chus yang dang yang du bsnun zhing slar gtor na gdon rengs par 'gyur ro //
translated: One recites the eight-line praise over water and makes an effigy of the spirit. One inserts the name of the spirit in the heart of the effigy and repeatedly strikes it with water. If one scatters it again, the spirit will be paralyzed.

original: ka ra b'i ra'i lcug ma zhes bya ba ni dur khrod kyi ras la bsgrub bya'i ming dang spel ba'i 'khrul 'khor bris la bud med kyi ro bsregs pa'i thal ba dang tsandan dmar po'i rdul dang bsres pa'i bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan gyi snying gar bcug ste ka
analyzed: ka ra b'i ra'i lcug ma zhes bya ba ni dur khrod kyi ras la bsgrub bya'i ming dang spel ba'i 'khrul 'khor bris la bud med kyi ro bsregs pa'i thal ba dang tsandan dmar po'i rdul dang bsres pa'i bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan gyi snying gar bcug ste ka
translated: The branch of karavira is as follows: Having written the name of the victim together with the yantra on a cloth from a charnel ground, one inserts it into the heart of an effigy of the victim mixed with the ashes of a woman's cremation and red sandalwood powder.

original: ra b'i ra'i lcug ma khru do yod pa dur khrod kyi me la gdungs nas slar yang blangs te spyi bo la bskor @382b zhing snga ma'i gzugs brnyan gyi lte bar bsnun na mngal gang du 'dod pa der 'pho bar 'gyur ro //üîΩde la 'khrul 'khor ni 'di yin te ae gru gsum gyi dbus su zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bris la /
analyzed: ra b'i ra'i lcug ma khru do yod pa dur khrod kyi me la gdungs nas slar yang blangs te spyi bo la bskor @382b zhing snga ma'i gzugs brnyan gyi lte bar bsnun na mngal gang du 'dod pa der 'pho bar 'gyur ro // de la 'khrul 'khor ni 'di yin te ae gru gsum gyi dbus su zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bris la /
translated: Having heated a karavira branch two cubits long in the fire of a charnel ground, one again takes it and, having circled it over the head, one pierces the navel of the previous effigy.üîΩThe yantra is as follows: Having drawn a moon ma·πá·∏çala in the center of an e triangle,

original: de'i steng du 'khor lo gsum bris te lte bar sna tshogs rdo rje //
analyzed: de'i steng du 'khor lo gsum bris te lte bar sna tshogs rdo rje //
translated: one draws three wheels above that, and in the center, a crossed vajra.

original: de'i lte bar padma 'dab ma brgyad pa de'i lte bar bcom ldan 'das kyi sa bon h'um dang yum gyi sa bon bam padma 'dab ma brgyad la rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags bris la 'khor lo gsum la rang gi lha'i snying po bris la rdo rje dang padma
analyzed: de'i lte bar padma 'dab ma brgyad pa de'i lte bar bcom ldan 'das kyi sa bon h'um dang yum gyi sa bon bam padma 'dab ma brgyad la rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags bris la 'khor lo gsum la rang gi lha'i snying po bris la rdo rje dang padma
translated: In its center is an eight-petaled lotus, in its center the seed syllable of the Bhagavat, and in the center of the mother's lotus the seed syllable of the mother. On the eight petals of the lotus write the eight lines of the mantra. On the three wheels write the essence mantras of one's deities.üîΩWith vajra and lotus

original: dang 'khor los bskor ba dang sgo dang mtshams su mkha' 'gro ma'i snying po dang dur khrod brgyad kyi gnas su rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags dang rdo rje ra ba dang me 'od kyi bar du ka ra b'i ra'i sngags bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dang 'khor los bskor ba dang sgo dang mtshams su mkha' 'gro ma'i snying po dang dur khrod brgyad kyi gnas su rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags dang rdo rje ra ba dang me 'od kyi bar du ka ra b'i ra'i sngags bri bar bya'o //
translated: and wheel, and at the gates and in the intermediate directions the essence mantras of the dakinis, and in the eight charnel grounds the eight lines of the mantra. Between the vajra fence and the ring of fire write the mantra of karavƒ´ra.

analyzed: dbus su bsgrub bya'i ming zhi ba dang rgyas pa la sogs pa dang spel ba'i ming la las bcu gnyis byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the center write the name of the victim, and for pacifying, increasing, and so forth, and for multiplying the name, one will accomplish the twelve acts.

original: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa re mig brgyad du byas shing rdo rje rol pa rta'i 'gros sam gshin rje dbyug pa 'chang ba'am yi dags srin po'i gdong ngam ma mo rigs ldan ma'i 'khor lo dgod par bya'o zhes mkha' 'gro las gsungs so //
analyzed: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa re mig brgyad du byas shing rdo rje rol pa rta'i 'gros sam gshin rje dbyug pa 'chang ba'am yi dags srin po'i gdong ngam ma mo rigs ldan ma'i 'khor lo dgod par bya'o zhes mkha' 'gro las gsungs so //
translated: The dakini teaches that one should draw an eight-petaled lotus with eight squares, and draw the wheel of Vajra Lƒ´lƒÅ, the gait of a horse, or Yama with a staff, or the face of a hungry ghost or rƒÅk·π£asa, or the mother of the family.

original: de ltar las lnga bcu bshad nas phan yon ston pa ni dpal ldan khrag 'thung zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar las lnga bcu bshad nas phan yon ston pa ni dpal ldan khrag 'thung zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Having explained the fifty rites, the benefits are taught: ‚ÄúThe glorious heruka,‚Äù and so on.

analyzed: rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags mi shes par dngos grub 'dod pa rmongs pa 'bras 'dod pas phub ma brdung ba dang mtshungs so //
translated: Those who desire power without knowing the mantra of eight lines are deluded, like one desiring fruit beating a stump.

original: gsang sngags 'di med par 'jig rten dang thun mong dang mchog gi dngos grub gsum mi'i rnal 'byor pas thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsang sngags 'di med par 'jig rten dang thun mong dang mchog gi dngos grub gsum mi'i rnal 'byor pas thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Without this mantra, the yogin will not attain the three mundane and supreme powers.

original: gsang sngags 'di mi shes na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi rnal 'byor yang ngal ba don med cing /
analyzed: gsang sngags 'di mi shes na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi rnal 'byor yang ngal ba don med cing /
translated: If one does not know this mantra, the yoga of ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ is meaningless hardship.

analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi 'bras bu yang thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And one will not attain the fruits of serenity and insight.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'gyur snyam na sprul pa'i sku'i sngags rkang pa brgyad pa ni gzhan gyi don yongs su rdzogs pa yin no zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'gyur snyam na sprul pa'i sku'i sngags rkang pa brgyad pa ni gzhan gyi don yongs su rdzogs pa yin no zhes dgongs so //
translated: Why will one not attain them? The eight-line mantra of the emanation body is the fulfillment of the welfare of others.

original: gsang sngags 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la spyod cing bde bar gshegs pas rgyud sde bzhir gsungs pa'i gsang sngags kyi dngos grub rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags dang phyag rgya'i dngos @383a * //

translated: The mantra and mudra siddhi of the eight-line mantra and the four classes of tantra taught by the Sugata, which are the siddhi of mantra for one who enjoys the five sense objects, is the result.

original: grub de lta bu'i 'bras bu ma grub na ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: grub de lta bu'i 'bras bu ma grub na ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If one does not accomplish such a result, what should one do?üîΩOne should eat and drink,

original: bza' dang btung ba la sogs pa //
analyzed: bza' dang btung ba la sogs pa //
translated: and so on.

original: zhes smos te tshogs kyi 'khor los bskyar ba'i cho ga byas nas bsgrubs na zas kyi mchog bcud kyis len dang bcud la sogs pa dngos grub thams cad ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes smos te tshogs kyi 'khor los bskyar ba'i cho ga byas nas bsgrubs na zas kyi mchog bcud kyis len dang bcud la sogs pa dngos grub thams cad ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one practices with the ritual of the ga·πáacakra, all siddhis, such as the supreme food, rasƒÅyana, and so on, will be bestowed.

original: le'u dgu pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u dgu pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the explanation of the ninth chapter.

original: // / rtsa ba'i sngags kyi dngos grub dang las bshad nas snying po'i dngos grub dang las bshad pa ni /
analyzed: // / rtsa ba'i sngags kyi dngos grub dang las bshad nas snying po'i dngos grub dang las bshad pa ni /
translated: Having explained the powers and activities of the root mantra, now, the powers and activities of the essence mantra are explained.

original: de nas he ru ka gnyis med //
analyzed: de nas he ru ka gnyis med //
translated: Next, the nondual Heruka

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: is explained.

original: he ru ka ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: he ru ka ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Heruka is threefold:

original: sems kyi 'khor lo dang / lus kyi 'khor lo dang / sprul pa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: sems kyi 'khor lo dang / lus kyi 'khor lo dang / sprul pa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: the mind wheel, the body wheel, and the emanation wheel.

original: de dang gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba gang gis shes pa tsam gyis sku gsum gyi 'bras bu'i dngos grub dang / 'jig rten gyi dngos grub 'grub par the tshom med pas na re zhig dang por sku gsum bshad par bya'o //

translated: By the yoga of nonduality with him, one should have no doubt that the power of the result, the three bodies, and the mundane powers are achieved merely by knowing him. original: de ltar mdor bstan nas rgyas par bshad pa ni chos kyi sku can du zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar mdor bstan nas rgyas par bshad pa ni chos kyi sku can du zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúEndowed with the dharma body,‚Äù

analyzed: gang gi sems kyis 'khor lo bde mchog bsgom pa'i tshe sgrub pa po dngos grub brgyad thob par 'gyur ba na ye shes kyi sku grub pa yin no //
translated: when the practitioner meditates on Cakrasa·πÉvara with that mind and attains the eight powers, the gnosis body is accomplished.

translated: When the practitioner meditates on the ma·πá·∏çala of the body of the Enjoyment Body, then at that time the causal Heruka attains the Enjoyment Body.

analyzed: gang gi tshe sprul pa'i 'khor lo bde mchog sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin du sgrub pa pos bsgoms na sprul sku thob par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: When the practitioner meditates on the emanation ma·πá·∏çala as having the nature of the Emanation Body, then at that time the causal Heruka attains the Emanation Body.

original: yang na rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dbang du byas nas dbang bzhi pa thob nas sems kyi stong pa nyid rtogs pas chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid rtogs te bde ba chen po'i rgyas btab nas bsam gyis mi khyab par bsgoms na de'i tshe chos kyi sku thobüîΩpar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dbang du byas nas dbang bzhi pa thob nas sems kyi stong pa nyid rtogs pas chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid rtogs te bde ba chen po'i rgyas btab nas bsam gyis mi khyab par bsgoms na de'i tshe chos kyi sku thobüîΩpar 'gyur ro //
translated: Alternatively, from the perspective of the completion stage, when the practitioner attains the fourth empowerment, realizes the emptiness of mind, realizes the emptiness of all phenomena, and meditates on the inconceivable state of being sealed by great bliss, then at that time the causal Heruka attains the Dharma Body.

original: shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba thob nas las kyi phyag rgya la bde stong reg bya'i stong pa nyid rtogs nas gzung ba rang bzhin med par shes pa 'od gsal ba'i stong pa nyid bsgoms na de'i tshe longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba thob nas las kyi phyag rgya la bde stong reg bya'i stong pa nyid rtogs nas gzung ba rang bzhin med par shes pa 'od gsal ba'i stong pa nyid bsgoms na de'i tshe longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur 'gyur ro //
translated: Having obtained the wisdom-awareness initiation, one realizes the emptiness of the tactile object of bliss and emptiness in the action seal, and if one meditates on the emptiness of clear light, the knowledge that the object has no intrinsic nature, then at that time one will become the enjoyment body.

original: gsang ba'i dbang thob nas ro rdo rje ma la sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pas chos kyi phyag rgya @383b la brten nas sgyu ma lta bu'i rang bzhin bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i lam bsgoms na sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin thob par 'gyur ro zhes slob dpon klu
analyzed: gsang ba'i dbang thob nas ro rdo rje ma la sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pas chos kyi phyag rgya @383b la brten nas sgyu ma lta bu'i rang bzhin bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i lam bsgoms na sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin thob par 'gyur ro zhes slob dpon klu
translated: Having obtained the secret initiation, one realizes the corpse-vajra woman as illusion-like, and if one meditates on the path of self-consecration, the nature of which is illusion-like, in dependence on the doctrine seal, then one will obtain the nature of the emanation body.

original: sgrub kyis bshad do //

original: yang na rtsa'i 'khor lo bsgoms pas sprul pa'i sku dang / rlung gi 'khor lo bsgoms pas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sems kyi 'khor lo bsgoms pas chos kyi sku thob po zhes kha sbyor las gsungs so //
analyzed: yang na rtsa'i 'khor lo bsgoms pas sprul pa'i sku dang / rlung gi 'khor lo bsgoms pas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sems kyi 'khor lo bsgoms pas chos kyi sku thob po zhes kha sbyor las gsungs so //

original: bdag nyid shr'i he ru kar //

translated: To expel obstructors with white mustard seed, smear it with the blood and grease of a corpse, and on the twenty-fourth day, when the star Pu·π£ya and the sun are in conjunction, mix it with blood and grease in a charnel ground, and grow the white mustard seed in a human skull.

translated: At that time, various obstacles arise from the corpse's body, and one should meditate on Heruka with a hundred thousand arms. Placing the five nectars together with beer on his tongue,üîΩone should recite:

original: bsgrub bya'i snying gar bcug nas skye gnas kyi phyag rgya bcings la dgug pa la sogs pa byas na sngar bshad pa'i phur bu lkog mar btab na tshig @385a * //

translated: Having inserted it into the heart of the victim, having bound the seal of the womb, and having performed the summoning, and so on, if one strikes with the previously explained dagger into the throat, the victim will be summoned.

translated: As for drawing blood to wherever one wishes, one should insert the machine into the navel of the victim, who is made of red sandalwood. If it is a woman, one should draw out the thread from the bhaga.üîΩIf it is a man, one should draw out the thread from the nostrils.

analyzed: de nas tshab gsum dang spa tshil gyis byugs la seng ldeng gi me bdag la bdugs na nges par khrag 'dren par 'gyur ro //

translated: If one performs the homa,

original: gnod par yang byed do //
analyzed: gnod par yang byed do //

translated: The sweet-smelling dust is the sign of the first birth.

analyzed: bden par smra ba gnyis pa'i rtags so //

analyzed: mig mi 'dzums pa gsum pa'o //
translated: Not winking is the third.

analyzed: khrol med pa bzhi pa'o //

analyzed: kha'i dbugs dri zhim pa ni lnga pa'o //

translated: The seven shadows spoken of in the Nƒ´ti≈õƒÅstra are the sixth.

original: bdun pa ngang pa'i 'gros can rnams te skye ba bdun pa'i rtags de rnams shes nas de ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bsnyen bkur gyis bsten pa dang / 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe /

translated: The seventh is the one who has the gait of a goose. Having known those signs of the seven-times-born being, one should rely on him by serving him for as long as one lives, and at the time of death,

analyzed: khyed kyi dngos grub bdag @385b la stsol cig ces gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
translated: One should request, Please grant me your spiritual powers.

original: de kha na ma tho ba med par shi ba dang / de'i snying ga na gi wang yod pa blangs la dpal he ru ka'i snying po 'am nye ba'i snying po la sogs pa gang yang rung ba brgya bzlas nas dpral bar thig le byas na nam mkha' la lding bar 'gyur zhing dpag tshad bye bar 'gro bar 'gyur
analyzed: de kha na ma tho ba med par shi ba dang / de'i snying ga na gi wang yod pa blangs la dpal he ru ka'i snying po 'am nye ba'i snying po la sogs pa gang yang rung ba brgya bzlas nas dpral bar thig le byas na nam mkha' la lding bar 'gyur zhing dpag tshad bye bar 'gro bar 'gyur
translated: When he dies without sin, one should take the realgar that is in his heart, and having enchanted it one hundred times with any suitable essence mantra or quintessence mantra of glorious Heruka, one should make a bindu on the forehead. One will fly in the sky and travel ten million leagues.

original: ro // snying gar thig le byas na gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / mig tu thig le byas na lha'i mig thob pa dang / rna bar thig le byas na lha'i rna ba 'byung ba dang / rkang par thig le byas na rkang mgyogs kyi dngos grub 'byung ba la sogs pa ni rgyud bla ma las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ro // snying gar thig le byas na gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / mig tu thig le byas na lha'i mig thob pa dang / rna bar thig le byas na lha'i rna ba 'byung ba dang / rkang par thig le byas na rkang mgyogs kyi dngos grub 'byung ba la sogs pa ni rgyud bla ma las blta bar bya'o //
translated: If one makes a bindu on the heart, one will know the minds of others. If one makes a bindu on the eyes, one will obtain the divine eye. If one makes a bindu on the ears, one will obtain the divine ear. If one makes a bindu on the feet, one will obtain the spiritual power of swift feet. These and so forth should be learned from the Unexcelled Tantra.

original: de ltar bsten pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gsum gyi ye shes dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bsten pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gsum gyi ye shes dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Just by attending to it means that one becomes a buddha endowed with the gnosis of the three worlds.

original: dpag tshad ces bya ba ni skye ba bdun pa'i sha zos na dpag tshad lnga bcur 'gro ba dang 'ong bar nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpag tshad ces bya ba ni skye ba bdun pa'i sha zos na dpag tshad lnga bcur 'gro ba dang 'ong bar nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: As for yojana, if one eats the flesh of one born seven times, one will be able to go and come in fifty yojanas.

original: de ni 'jig rten gyi dngos grub po //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten gyi dngos grub po //
translated: That is the mundane siddhi.

original: de'i snying zos na bsam gtan dang gzugs med kyi lus thob par 'gyur ba thun mong gi dngos grub po //
analyzed: de'i snying zos na bsam gtan dang gzugs med kyi lus thob par 'gyur ba thun mong gi dngos grub po //
translated: If one eats its heart, one will obtain the body of the dhyƒÅna and formless [absorptions], the common siddhi.

translated: The glorious Heruka's essence and quintessence, which will be explained later, are the twelve [topics] of which whatever is desired will be obtained.

original: spyod pa dang bya ba dang gnyi ga dang rnal 'byor gyi rgyud la ni smyung bar gnas pas dngos grub thob pa yin la /
analyzed: spyod pa dang bya ba dang gnyi ga dang rnal 'byor gyi rgyud la ni smyung bar gnas pas dngos grub thob pa yin la /

original: 'dir ni sman bcud kyis len nam bdud rtsi lnga'am /
analyzed: 'dir ni sman bcud kyis len nam bdud rtsi lnga'am /
translated: Here, one should practice for the attainment of power by means of the elixir of life or the five ambrosias,

analyzed: skye ba bdun pa'i sha zos nas dngos grub bsgrub par bya'o //

analyzed: ci skye ba bdun pa'i sha 'ba' zhig zos pas thob bam zhi na /
