original: skye ba bdun pa'i sha dang thod pa srubs med dang / yid bzhin nor bu bsam 'phel dang / sman bcud kyis len dang / las kyi phyag rgya dung can ma dang / padma can dang / ri dags kyis kyang bsam gtan gyi dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba bdun pa'i sha dang thod pa srubs med dang / yid bzhin nor bu bsam 'phel dang / sman bcud kyis len dang / las kyi phyag rgya dung can ma dang / padma can dang / ri dags kyis kyang bsam gtan gyi dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One attains the power of meditation by eating the flesh and skull of one who has died a natural death, by the wish-fulfilling gem, by the elixir of life, by the karmamudra, by the conch-shell woman, by the lotus woman, and by the deer.

original: ke le'u bcu gcig pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: ke le'u bcu gcig pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the eleventh chapter, the ‚ÄúChapter on the Substances for Attaining Power,‚Äù of this Ornament of the Essence, the commentary on the Entrance to the Middle Way.

analyzed: // / de ltar dngos grub kyi rdzas bshad nas /
translated: Now, having explained the substances for attaining power,

original: cad thob byed cing //
analyzed: cad thob byed cing //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dngos grub gsum nges par thob par byed do //

translated: Drying up the oceans, rivers, and ponds, and so on, means that, as previously explained, one should meditate on Heruka with the face of Garu·∏ça in the middle of the eight nƒÅgas, and having arranged the machine of the seven syllables in all the pores of the body,

analyzed: / de'i gnas su gu gul gyi dud pas bdug cing mchod pa phul nas rang dpal he ru kar bsgoms pa'i gnas su bcug la lag pa g-yon pas kha bkab la rjes thogs la yang yi ge bdun pa brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas na de'i mdo las spyod pa rnams la mi snang bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Having offered incense of gugul in that place, and having offered worship, one should cause the person to enter the place where one has meditated on oneself as glorious Heruka, and having covered his mouth with one's left hand, immediately recite the seven-syllable [mantra] one hundred and eight times.üîΩThen, his conduct will not be visible to those who move on the earth.

analyzed: sa 'og la spyod pa rnams la grib ma yang mi snang bar 'gyur zhing /

analyzed: mkha' spyod kyi lha rnams kyis kyang mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even the gods who move in the sky will not see him.

original: kha nas bton na snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha nas bton na snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he removes [the covering from] his mouth, he will become visible.

original: ri lu 'di ni rgyud 'dir yum phag mos ma zhus par dpa' bo nyid kyis thugs rje'i dbang gis gsungs pa yin no //

translated: This pill is taught by the hero himself out of compassion, without being requested by the mother VarƒÅhƒ´, in this tantra.

original: dgra bo'i thod pa sha med par byas la dgra bo'i gzugs brnyan bris te de'i snying gar yi ge bdun pa'i 'khrul 'khor bkod la snying po dang nye ba'i snying po bzlas te rang gi srin lag gi khrag dang mnyes na de'i khrag 'dren par 'gyur ro //

translated: Having made the skull of an enemy without flesh, one should draw the image of the enemy, and having arranged the wheel of the seven syllables in the heart of that [image], one should recite the essence and the quintessence, and if one anoints it with one's blood from the ring finger, one's blood will be drawn [from one's body].

analyzed: gi wang la bzlas te zhes bya ba ni gi wang la yi ge bdun pa bzlas nas dpral bar thig le @387a * //
translated: As for on guggulu, one should recite the seven syllables on guggulu, and having made a drop on the forehead,

translated: and having made the fingers of the hand light rays, whoever one threatens with the index finger will fall at that moment.

original: sngags bzlas na zhes bya ba ni nyi ma phyed na sems khros pa dang bcas pas dur khrod kyi ras sam shing aarka'i 'dab ma la mi rus kyi smyu gus dug dang khrag dang dur khrod kyi sol ba la sogs pas 'khrul 'khor bris la /
analyzed: sngags bzlas na zhes bya ba ni nyi ma phyed na sems khros pa dang bcas pas dur khrod kyi ras sam shing aarka'i 'dab ma la mi rus kyi smyu gus dug dang khrag dang dur khrod kyi sol ba la sogs pas 'khrul 'khor bris la /
translated: If one recites the mantra, at noon, with an angry mind, one should draw a wheel on cloth from a charnel ground or on a leaf of the arka tree with a stick made from a human bone, with poison, blood, charnel ground ash, and so forth.

original: dur khrod kyi thal ba las byas ba'i dgra bo'i gzugs brnyan gyi snying gar ske tshe byugs la yang dang yang du gso bar byas na lus tsha bas btab ste sa la brgyal bar 'gyur ro //

translated: One should repeatedly revive the effigy of the enemy made from charnel ground ash, smearing it with semen and mustard seeds, until the body is struck by heat and falls unconscious on the ground.

original: de dur khrod kyi thab kyi 'og tu sbas nas mi rus kyi phur bus snying gar btab nas snying gar chu tshan blugs shing yungs kar dang ske tshe la sngags bzlas shing bsnun na de'i mod la 'chi bar 'gyur ro //

translated: Having hidden it under the hearth in the charnel ground, one should stab the heart with a stake made from a human bone, pour hot water on the heart, and strike with mustard seeds and semen while reciting the mantra. He will die instantly.

original: chu la bzlas te btab na slar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu la bzlas te btab na slar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra over water and sprinkles it, he will revive.

original: sngags bzlas nas zhes bya ba ni dur khrod kyi ras la yung ba dang ldod ros kyis 'khrul 'khor bris la tsandan dmar po'i rdul dang ske tshe dang lan tshva dang bsgrub bya'i rkang rjes kyi sa dang lcags phye dang bsres nas dgra bo'i gzugs brnyan byas la
analyzed: sngags bzlas nas zhes bya ba ni dur khrod kyi ras la yung ba dang ldod ros kyis 'khrul 'khor bris la tsandan dmar po'i rdul dang ske tshe dang lan tshva dang bsgrub bya'i rkang rjes kyi sa dang lcags phye dang bsres nas dgra bo'i gzugs brnyan byas la
translated: Having recited the mantra means that one should draw a magic diagram on charnel ground cloth with red mercury sulfide and vermillion, and make an effigy of the victim out of red sandalwood powder, black mustard seed, salt, earth from the victim's feet, and iron filings.

original: lam gyi bzhi mdor sbas na dgra bo'i dpung yang gnon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lam gyi bzhi mdor sbas na dgra bo'i dpung yang gnon par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one buries it at a crossroads, the victim's army will be suppressed.

original: tshig gis 'grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bton la 'o mas bkus na grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig gis 'grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bton la 'o mas bkus na grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As for one will be released by the words, if one recites the mantra and then washes it away with milk, one will be released.

original: sme sha can gyi thal ba las //
analyzed: sme sha can gyi thal ba las //
translated: From the ashes of an outcaste.

analyzed: zhes pa ni sme sha can gyi ro bsregs pa'i thal ba las bsgrub par bya ba'i gzugs brnyan byas la /

original: gang gi ming dang bcas pa'i 'khrul 'khor snying gar bcug nas sems can de ba lang dang khyi la sogs par gyur cig ces bsams nas thal bas byugs na de dang de'i gzugs 'dzin par 'gyur ro //

original: spyin sreg me yi thal pa las //

translated: one should make an effigy from the ashes of the burnt offering mixed with arka wood. Having placed the yantra in its heart, if one recites the mantra, even the gods will not see him.

analyzed: gu gul chu la lan bdun bzlas te gtor na snang bar 'gyur ro //

translated: The ‚Äúsealed skull gesture‚Äù is as follows: Having written the yantra in the skull of a rabid dog, sealed with the five kinds of insanity, bound with a thread of five colors, and buried in a charnel ground, he will go mad.

original: skye bo stong la byas kyang smyo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye bo stong la byas kyang smyo bar 'gyur ro //

translated: ‚ÄúTogether with a skull cup‚Äù means that one should draw a magic diagram in the middle of a skull cup, scatter mustard seed as previously explained above, below, and in the ten directions, and the gods, gandharvas, and those who move in the sky, yak·π£as, rƒÅk·π£asas, those who move on the earth, nƒÅgas, and asuras who move below the earth will be bound.

original: thod pa dang bcas pa la zhes bya ba ni thod pa'i nang du 'khrul 'khor bris la chu bo'i sna zug par bcug na bzlog par 'gyur zhing bton na 'bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thod pa dang bcas pa la zhes bya ba ni thod pa'i nang du 'khrul 'khor bris la chu bo'i sna zug par bcug na bzlog par 'gyur zhing bton na 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one writes the yantra in a skull and inserts it in the current of a river, the current will be reversed. If one removes it, the current will flow as before.

analyzed: kha phye na kha phyir ldog par 'gyur ro //

translated: You will not be cut by weapons means that according to the Vajradaka, if you smear your hands with the medicine called good to see, you will not be harmed by weapons that are thrown by the hand, such as a discus, or by a sword that is not thrown, or by arrows that are shot by a machine, or by weapons that are thrown and then caught, or by weapons that are thrown by the power of the wind.

original: sman @388a * //

translated: If one anoints one's body with the juice of unmatta, one cannot be struck by a sword and so on.

analyzed: sman de'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the special features of those medicines?

original: bram ze'i thod par ro bsregs pa'i sas bkang ba la sman de rnams kyi sa bon bdud rtsi lnga dang / sme sha can gyi bu mo'i khrag gis byugs na nyi shu brgyad dang / nyi shu dgu'i dus su sa bon btab na m'a ma k'i'i sngags kyis chu blugs la /

translated: In a Brahmin skull filled with the ashes of a cremation ground, one should plant the seeds of those medicines, smeared with the five nectars and the blood of a Chandala girl, at the time of the twenty-eighth or twenty-ninth day. translated: Why is that?

original: dngos rjes ro mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos rjes ro mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the entity and the sign are of the same taste.

original: des na rnal 'byor pa thams cad 'bras bu sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rnal 'byor pa thams cad 'bras bu sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //

original: shes rab ye shes kyi dbang thob pas mig la sogs pa'i dbang po gang dang gang yin pa stong par shes nas lam du gyur pa'i yul rnams stong pa nyid de dang de'i ngo bor byas te /
analyzed: shes rab ye shes kyi dbang thob pas mig la sogs pa'i dbang po gang dang gang yin pa stong par shes nas lam du gyur pa'i yul rnams stong pa nyid de dang de'i ngo bor byas te /
translated: Since one has obtained the empowerment of the gnosis of the wisdom consort, having understood that whatever is a sense organ, such as the eyes, is empty, the objects that are the path are made into the essence of that emptiness.

original: thams cad der dga' ba'i rang bzhin bde ba chen po'i bdag nyid rgyas btab pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i tshe yang bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du shes pa ni mchog tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i sbyor ba yin te /

translated: At the time of equipoise, the seal of the nature of great bliss, which is the nature of delight in everything, is expanded. The application of supreme equipoise is the knowledge that the nature of great bliss is expanded.

original: dngos rjes bde ba chen por ro mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos rjes bde ba chen por ro mnyam pa'i phyir ro //

original: sri ni gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: sri ni gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba'o //

original: rang byung ni khrag go //
analyzed: rang byung ni khrag go //
translated: Self-arisen is blood.

original: so ni gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba'i zhi ba'i btung ba'o //
analyzed: so ni gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba'i zhi ba'i btung ba'o //

original: pi zhes bya ba ni sman sna brgya rtsa brgyad du bskol ba'i thug pa'o //
analyzed: pi zhes bya ba ni sman sna brgya rtsa brgyad du bskol ba'i thug pa'o //

original: hi zhes bya ba ni sha lnga'o //
analyzed: hi zhes bya ba ni sha lnga'o //

original: bha zhes bya ba ni dbang bskur ba'i tshe kha zas 'bras chan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bha zhes bya ba ni dbang bskur ba'i tshe kha zas 'bras chan la sogs pa'o //

original: nu zhes bya ba ni shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: nu zhes bya ba ni shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: NU is the consecration of the wisdom-knowledge.

original: 'di tsam gyis ni dbang gi lha mo'i brda bstan te /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni dbang gi lha mo'i brda bstan te /

analyzed: da ni dag byed kyi lha mo'i brda ston to //

original: pi zhes bya ba ni sems 'dzin pa'i gnas su khrod pa'o //
analyzed: pi zhes bya ba ni sems 'dzin pa'i gnas su khrod pa'o //
translated: PI is the cemetery as the place of mind-fixation.

analyzed: du zhes bya ba ni skye ba bdun pa'i ro kha zas su za ba'o //
translated: DU is the corpse of one born seven times, which is eaten as food.

original: de zhes bya ba ni yum rdo rje phag mo'i rig so /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni yum rdo rje phag mo'i rig so /
translated: DE is the knowledge of the mother Vajravarahi.

original: da zhes bya ba ni sgrol ma'o //
analyzed: da zhes bya ba ni sgrol ma'o //
translated: DA is Tara.üîΩ HRIH is BuddhalocanƒÅ.

original: hri zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas spyan /
analyzed: hri zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas spyan /
translated: The syllable hrƒ´·∏• is BuddhalocanƒÅ.üîΩ

original: ku zhes bya ba ni m'a ma k'i //
analyzed: ku zhes bya ba ni m'a ma k'i //
translated: Ku is Mamaki.

original: ha zhes bya ba ni gos dkar mo /
analyzed: ha zhes bya ba ni gos dkar mo /
translated: Ha is PƒÅ·πá·∏çaravƒÅsinƒ´.

original: dza zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi lha mo de rnams dang byin pa gnyis kyis 'khyud pa'i sems 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dza zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi lha mo de rnams dang byin pa gnyis kyis 'khyud pa'i sems 'dzin pa'o //

original: da ni dpa' bo'i lha mo'i bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni dpa' bo'i lha mo'i bshad par bya ste /

original: thog ma phrad pa'i che ba zhes bya ba phyag 'tshal ba ston la /
analyzed: thog ma phrad pa'i che ba zhes bya ba phyag 'tshal ba ston la /

original: ni zhes bya ba ni sha la sogs pa'i bza' bya'o //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni sha la sogs pa'i bza' bya'o //

analyzed: byo zhes bya ba ni bdud rtsi lngar byin gyis brlabs nas bza' ba'o //

analyzed: bhi zhes bya ba ni rdo rje chur byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: Bhi is the consecration of the vajra water.

original: ga zhes bya ba ni dbang bskur ba la bgrod par bya ba yin gyi ma bskur ba la dam tshig dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ga zhes bya ba ni dbang bskur ba la bgrod par bya ba yin gyi ma bskur ba la dam tshig dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: Ga is the consecration, which is to be performed, but not for one who is not consecrated and is not a pledge-holder.üîΩ One should not delight in relying on a knowledge-woman,

original: rig ma bsten par dga' ba dang // zhes bya ba ni nyes par byung bas bgrod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rig ma bsten par dga' ba dang // zhes bya ba ni nyes par byung bas bgrod par mi bya'o //

original: da ni bkas gnang ba'i lha mo'i mchod pa'i lha mo ston te /üîΩka zhes bya ba ni rigs lnga'i lha mo so @394a * //
analyzed: da ni bkas gnang ba'i lha mo'i mchod pa'i lha mo ston te / ka zhes bya ba ni rigs lnga'i lha mo so @394a * //

original: sor 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: sor 'dod par bya'o //

analyzed: sa zhes bya ba ni skyes pa gzhan gyi gam du mi 'gro ba'o //

analyzed: ra zhes bya ba ni bdag po med pa dang mchod pa'i phyag rgya'o //

analyzed: da ni kun spyod ma ston te /

analyzed: du zhes bya ba ni gzugs 'tshong ba'o //

original: su zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa la dad pa'o //
analyzed: su zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa la dad pa'o //

analyzed: na zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pa la dad pa'o //

analyzed: aa zhes bya ba ni dbang bskur ba ma ma thob pa'o //

analyzed: y'a zhes bya ba ni dad pas 'ongs pa'o //

original: na zhes bya ba ni dad pa med pas ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: na zhes bya ba ni dad pa med pas ma 'ongs pa'o //

analyzed: so zhes bya ba ni yid du 'ong ba'i yul du gyur pa'o //
translated: So means one who has become a pleasing object.

original: yi ge re re'i brda 'di dag tshor ba sdug bsngal dang / btang snyoms spangs nas tshor ba bde ba sgom zhing rtog pa med pa mngon sum gyi lam la dad pa la sbyin par bya'i ma dad pa la mi sbyin pa dang / grol ba'i lam yang ma yin zhes shes par bya'o //

original: le'u bco lnga ba'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bco lnga ba'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the fifteenth chapter, the ‚ÄúChapter on the Procedure of the Seal of the Yoginƒ´‚Äôs Observance,‚Äù the ultimate secret.

original: // / da ni sems 'dzin pa'i dag byed kyi lha mo'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni sems 'dzin pa'i dag byed kyi lha mo'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /

original: de nas bza' dang bza' mi bya //
analyzed: de nas bza' dang bza' mi bya //
translated: Then, eat and do not eat.

original: zhes bya ba ni las kyi phyag rgya yid du 'ong ba gzugs sngu  gu mig gis bza' bar bya ba dang / sgra snyan pa rna ba dang / dri zhim po sna dang / ro zhim po lce'i dang / nam mkha'i rtsa'i dang reg pa lus kyi bza' bar bya ba ste /

translated: The attractive karmamudra, who is to be eaten with the eyes, is to be eaten with the ears, with the nose, with the tongue, with the space channel, and with the body.

original: longs spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: longs spyad par bya'o //
translated: One should enjoy her.

original: bza' bar mi bya ba ni yid du mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: bza' bar mi bya ba ni yid du mi 'ong ba'o //

original: de nas rab tu bshad par bya //
analyzed: de nas rab tu bshad par bya //

original: zhes bya ba ni dag byed kyi lha mo bshad par bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dag byed kyi lha mo bshad par bya zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that the purifying goddesses are to be explained.üîΩAccording to A≈õvagho·π£a and Bhavabha·π≠·π≠a, what is to be eaten is the nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya buddhas and bodhisattvas dwelling in the twenty-four sacred sites and those who dwell there teaching the dharma with the form of the qualities of desire through ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ.

original: mi thub zla ba dang bha ba ba'i zhal snga nas bza' bar bya ba ni gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi na gnas pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i sprul pa'i sku dang / de rnams la 'dod pa'i yon tan gyi gzugs kyi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis chos ston pas bzhugs pa la las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor bas mtshan nyid ma rtogs pas mtshan nyid brtags nas sprul pa'i sku'i lha ye shes kyi lha mo de dang snyoms par
analyzed: mi thub zla ba dang bha ba ba'i zhal snga nas bza' bar bya ba ni gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi na gnas pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i sprul pa'i sku dang / de rnams la 'dod pa'i yon tan gyi gzugs kyi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis chos ston pas bzhugs pa la las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor bas mtshan nyid ma rtogs pas mtshan nyid brtags nas sprul pa'i sku'i lha ye shes kyi lha mo de dang snyoms par
translated: Since the yoga of beginners does not understand the characteristics, having examined the characteristics, the nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya deity and the j√±ƒÅnakƒÅya goddess enter into union.

original: zhugs pas me long gi gzugs brnyan la de nyid mthong ba bzhin du 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga char la stong nyid mthong bar 'gyur pas de'i mtshan nyid @394b bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: zhugs pas me long gi gzugs brnyan la de nyid mthong ba bzhin du 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga char la stong nyid mthong bar 'gyur pas de'i mtshan nyid @394b bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: Just as one sees reality in a mirror image, since emptiness is seen in all five qualities of desire, that characteristic is taught.

original: rin chen rdo rje'i zhal snga nas /
analyzed: rin chen rdo rje'i zhal snga nas /
translated: According to Ratnarak·π£ita,

original: pho nyas lhan cig skyes dngos grub //üîΩmchog dang 'bring dang tha ma yi //
analyzed: pho nyas lhan cig skyes dngos grub // mchog dang 'bring dang tha ma yi //
translated: The messenger is the innate, the power.

original: zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa /
translated: The supreme, the middling, and the inferior.

original: mchog sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i sprul pa'i sku'i ye shes kyi lha mo yang yin la gnas nyis shu rtsa bzhir skyes pa dbang po tshan ba las kyi mtha' ma log pa ni 'bring po yin no //
analyzed: mchog sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i sprul pa'i sku'i ye shes kyi lha mo yang yin la gnas nyis shu rtsa bzhir skyes pa dbang po tshan ba las kyi mtha' ma log pa ni 'bring po yin no //
translated: The supreme is the wisdom goddess of the Buddha and the Bodhisattva, the emanation body. The middling is one born in the twenty-four places, with unimpaired faculties, and not perverted in action.

original: sdom pa gsum la gnas shing dbang bskur ba thob pa ni sngags las skyes pa ste tha ma yin no //
analyzed: sdom pa gsum la gnas shing dbang bskur ba thob pa ni sngags las skyes pa ste tha ma yin no //
translated: The inferior is one born from mantra, who abides in the three vows and has received empowerment.

original: de dag gsum char gyi mtshan nyid bsdoms nas ston pa ni ye shes kyi lha mo kho na yin zhes mi bya'o ;
analyzed: de dag gsum char gyi mtshan nyid bsdoms nas ston pa ni ye shes kyi lha mo kho na yin zhes mi bya'o ;
translated: The characteristics of all three are not to be taught as combined, saying ‚Äúthe wisdom goddess alone.‚Äù

original: / de gsum char las kyang zhi gnas rtog pa med pa dang / lhag mthong stong pa nyid kyi ye shes skye'o //
analyzed: / de gsum char las kyang zhi gnas rtog pa med pa dang / lhag mthong stong pa nyid kyi ye shes skye'o //
translated: From all three, the non-conceptual calm abiding and the wisdom of emptiness, the special insight, arise.

original: sgrub pa mchog tu dam tshig la gnas pa //
analyzed: sgrub pa mchog tu dam tshig la gnas pa //
translated: The one who abides in the pledge of the supreme practice

original: zhes bya ba ni chags pa'i lam bsgom pa'i rten gyi gang zag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chags pa'i lam bsgom pa'i rten gyi gang zag go //
translated: is the person who is the basis for the cultivation of the path of passion.

original: bza' bya rjes gnang phan spyod pa //
analyzed: bza' bya rjes gnang phan spyod pa //
translated: The permission of the consort, the benefit of practice.

original: zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i las kyi phyag rgya de slob dpon gyis rjes su gnang nas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi shes pa skye ba la phan 'dogs par byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu du dang chos 'phags bzhin du bud med kyi bsam
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i las kyi phyag rgya de slob dpon gyis rjes su gnang nas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi shes pa skye ba la phan 'dogs par byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu du dang chos 'phags bzhin du bud med kyi bsam
translated: The master gives permission to the qualified karmamudra, and the bodhisattva, like Sadaprarudita and Dharmodgata, benefits the arising of the knowledge of shamatha and vipashyana.

original: gtan dang zag med kyi ting nge 'dzin skye ba'i phyag rgya de rab tu sbyor bar bya'o //
analyzed: gtan dang zag med kyi ting nge 'dzin skye ba'i phyag rgya de rab tu sbyor bar bya'o //
translated: The yogin should apply the mudra for the arising of the dhyanas and uncontaminated samadhis.

original: de dang rnal 'byor pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de dang rnal 'byor pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What does the yogin do with her?

original: yul lnga dbang po'i shes pas las kyi phyag rgya'i yul dang gnyis su med par bya ba'i rnal 'byor pa de brtags //
analyzed: yul lnga dbang po'i shes pas las kyi phyag rgya'i yul dang gnyis su med par bya ba'i rnal 'byor pa de brtags //
translated: The yogin should examine the five objects with the consciousness of the sense organs, making them nondual with the object of the karmamudra.

original: zhes bya ba ni dbang bskur ba'i rnal 'byor pa de blang bya dang dor bya'i rigs kyi bye brag shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbang bskur ba'i rnal 'byor pa de blang bya dang dor bya'i rigs kyi bye brag shes par bya'o //
translated: The yogin who has been initiated should know the distinctions of the types of things to adopt and abandon.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens by that?

original: gang gis shes pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: gang gis shes pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: By merely knowing that,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he will attain the supreme.

original: bcom po mo bshes gnyen la byang chub sems dpa' chos 'phags kyis byang chub tu sems bskyed pa bzhin du sgrub pa po rnams kyis snyoms par zhugs pa las dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom po mo bshes gnyen la byang chub sems dpa' chos 'phags kyis byang chub tu sems bskyed pa bzhin du sgrub pa po rnams kyis snyoms par zhugs pa las dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the bodhisattva Sublime Wisdom generated the thought of awakening in front of the Transcendent Conqueror Maitreya, so too will the practitioners attain power through meditative union.

original: de bas na de thob pa'i thabs kyi cho ga bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de thob pa'i thabs kyi cho ga bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the ritual method for attaining that will be explained.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: And what is that like?

original: bud med pad rtsa ltar dkar zhing //
analyzed: bud med pad rtsa ltar dkar zhing //
translated: A woman, white as a lotus root,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is said to be the best.

original: ye shes las kyes pa dang zhing skyes dang sngags skyes kyi dag byed kyi lha mo mtshan nyid bsdom nas bshad pa yin te /üîΩde la mtshan nyid @395a * //
analyzed: ye shes las kyes pa dang zhing skyes dang sngags skyes kyi dag byed kyi lha mo mtshan nyid bsdom nas bshad pa yin te / de la mtshan nyid @395a * //
translated: This is a summary of the characteristics of the purifying goddesses who are born from wisdom, born from a realm, or born from mantra.üîΩThere are three characteristics:

original: gsum ste / kha dog dbyibs spyod lam gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gsum ste / kha dog dbyibs spyod lam gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristics of color, shape, and deportment.

original: kha dog ni dkar ba dang / dbyibs ni mig dkyus ring ba dang / gos dkar po la dga' ba dang / tsandan sar pa'i dri yod pa dang / dkon mchog gsum la dad pa ni rin po che'i rigs kyi bud med do //
analyzed: kha dog ni dkar ba dang / dbyibs ni mig dkyus ring ba dang / gos dkar po la dga' ba dang / tsandan sar pa'i dri yod pa dang / dkon mchog gsum la dad pa ni rin po che'i rigs kyi bud med do //
translated: The woman of the jewel family is white, has long eyes, likes white clothes, smells of sandalwood, and is devoted to the Three Jewels.

original: bud med gang zhig kha dog ser ba dang / dmar ser gyi gos la dga' ba dang / dz'a ti dang tsampa ka'i dri yod pa dang / de yang dkon mchog gsum gyi bstan pa bzang po'i rjes su 'gro ba ni padma'i rigs so //
analyzed: bud med gang zhig kha dog ser ba dang / dmar ser gyi gos la dga' ba dang / dz'a ti dang tsampa ka'i dri yod pa dang / de yang dkon mchog gsum gyi bstan pa bzang po'i rjes su 'gro ba ni padma'i rigs so //
translated: The woman of the lotus family is yellow, likes red and yellow clothes, smells of jasmine and champak, and follows the good teachings of the Three Jewels.

original: bud med gang zhig kha dog sngo bsangs ni gos sngon po la dga' ba autpala'i dri yod pa dpa' bo byang chub sems dpa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i he ru ka'i rigs so //
analyzed: bud med gang zhig kha dog sngo bsangs ni gos sngon po la dga' ba autpala'i dri yod pa dpa' bo byang chub sems dpa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i he ru ka'i rigs so //
translated: The woman of the sword family is dark blue, likes blue clothes, smells of utpala, and follows the hero bodhisattva Heruka.

original: bud med gang zhig mdog dkar ba spyod lam padma'i rtsa ba'i dri yod pa thugs kyi 'khor lo'i dpa' bo bla ma ste mi bskyod pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: bud med gang zhig mdog dkar ba spyod lam padma'i rtsa ba'i dri yod pa thugs kyi 'khor lo'i dpa' bo bla ma ste mi bskyod pa'i rigs so //
translated: The woman of the wheel family is white, smells of lotus root, and follows the hero guru of the mind wheel, Akshobhya.

original: bud med gang zhig kha dog dmar ba /
analyzed: bud med gang zhig kha dog dmar ba /
translated: A woman who is red,

original: gos dmar po la dga' ba ma li ka dang autpala'i dri yod pa de ni rdo rje phag mo'i rigs so //
analyzed: gos dmar po la dga' ba ma li ka dang autpala'i dri yod pa de ni rdo rje phag mo'i rigs so //
translated: who likes red clothes, and who has the scent of jasmine and utpala flowers, is of the Vajravarahi clan.

original: bud med gang zhig kha dog ljang ser gos dkar po la dga' ba mgo la padma'i dri yod pa ni don yod grub pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: bud med gang zhig kha dog ljang ser gos dkar po la dga' ba mgo la padma'i dri yod pa ni don yod grub pa'i rigs so //
translated: A woman who is yellowish green, who likes white clothes, and who has the scent of lotus flowers on her head, is of the Amoghasiddhi clan.

original: bud med gang zhig kha dog dmar zhing gos dmar ba la dga' ba ga pur gyi dri dang ldan pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs so //
analyzed: bud med gang zhig kha dog dmar zhing gos dmar ba la dga' ba ga pur gyi dri dang ldan pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs so //
translated: A woman who is red, who likes red clothes, and who has the scent of camphor, is of the Vairocana clan.

original: de ltar na rnal 'byor ma bdun po de dag ni g-yon pa la spyod pa bde ba lam du byed pa la rtag tu dga' ba ni rnal 'byor ma bdun gyi thun mong gi rtags bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnal 'byor ma bdun po de dag ni g-yon pa la spyod pa bde ba lam du byed pa la rtag tu dga' ba ni rnal 'byor ma bdun gyi thun mong gi rtags bstan pa yin no //
